loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 30 años, es divorciada y vive con sus dos hijos Cristian de 12 y Luz Clara de 10 años. Es una mujer muy hacendosa, siempre ha trabajado, ya que tuvo que dejar sus estudios de secundaria para dedicarse a ello. Olga trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en la venta de CDs, de películas, dibujos animados, documentales, etc., que los clientes adquieren con gran frecuencia, lo único malo de su trabajo es tener que pelear por los sitios donde se ubica para realizar la venta (es ambulante), ya que la competencia no desea que se les acerquen demasiado, pero obviando este pequeño inconveniente le gusta su trabajo, ya que se distrae y al mismo tiempo obtiene dinero para solventar los gastos de su familia. Olga quiere que sus hijos no pasen incomodidades a causa de su economía, es por eso que ella se sacrifica para darles lo mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá más CDs para obtener mayores ganancias y en el futuro contar con una local fijo donde ofrecer su mercadería.
texts.en:
Olga is 30 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children, 12 year old Cristian and 10 year old Luz Clara. She is a very industrious woman who has always worked since she had to leave her studies in highschool to work. Olga works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon selling CDs, movies, cartoons, documentaries, etc, which clients buy very frequently. The only bad thing about her work is having to fight for the locations where she goes to make her sales (she is a traveling saleswoman), since the competition does not want to be too close together. But aside from this small inconvenience she likes her work, since it distracts her and at the same time she earns money to cover her family's costs. Olga wants her children to not be uncomfortable because of their finances. It is because of this that she sacrifices to give them the best. With the money from the loan she will purchase more CDs to earn more income and in the future have a fixed location to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of discs that she sells, and save to have a location of her own for her business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia es natural de Ocuviri, está divorciada de su pareja y vive con sus hijos Rolando de 25, William de 22, Mary Luz de 20 y Beatriz de 15 años. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, ya que se tuvo que hacer cargo de sus 4 hijos, tras la separación de su esposo, por  suerte contaba con el negocio familiar, un pequeño taller de fabricación de muebles, el cual abre desde las 9 de la mañana hasta promediarse las 5 o 6 de la tarde, contando con el apoyo de dos jóvenes que trabajan allí. A Aurelia le gusta administrar y también participar en la elaboración de los muebles que fabrican, ya que espera lograr los mejores resultados, la única desventaja es el no poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. Aurelia quiere que sus hijos se interesen por el negocio para poder sacarlo adelante entre toda la familia. Con el préstamo comprará material para los que los jóvenes que la apoyan produzcan más y así hacer rentable su negocio, consolidándose como el mejor de la zona.
texts.en:
Aurelia is from Ocuviri, she is divorced and lives with her children; Rolando, 25, William, 22, Mary Luz, 20, and Beatriz, 15 years old. She is a very self-sacrificing lady as she had to take of her 4 children after the separation from her husband. Luckily she had the family business, a small carpenter workshop, open from 9 a.m. until 5 or 6 p.m with the assistance of two young men that work there. Aurelia likes to administer as well as to participate in the manufacture of the furniture as she wants excellent results. The only disadvantage is that she does not spend more time with her children. Aurelia wishes her children to be interested in the business so that the entire family can cooperate to keep it going. With the loan she will buy material so that her young assistants can manufacture more and thus improve business making it the best in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for a furniture workshop.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula tiene 50 años, vive con Manuel su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte en su triciclo, y sus dos hijas María del Rosario D. 10 años y María Ángela que son gemelas y son su adoración. Ella se dedica a la venta D. fruta D. forma ambulatoria en su triciclo, ayudada por sus pequeñas hijas, desD. hace ya 10 años atrás. Paula desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 4 o 5 D. la tarD. que es cuando la gente demanda el consumo D. la fruta, su optimismo hizo que saliera adelante por su familia, ya que todos la menospreciaban porque no sabía leer ni escribir, pero Paula demostró que con muchas ganas y fuerza se pueden conseguir las metas trazadas. Esta madre desea que sus dos hijas estudien y puedan defenderse en al vida y no pasen lo que le tocó vivir a ella en su juventud. El dinero que Paula solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. más fruta, para agrandar su negocio y en el futuro establecerse en un local fijo.
texts.en:
Paula is 50 years old and lives with her husband Manuel, who has a business where he transports and sells goods by tricycle. They have two 10-year-old twin daughters, María del Rosario and María Ángela, whom Paula adores. For 10 years, Paula has been a traveling salesperson, aided by her young daughters and selling fruit on her tricycle. Paula works from 8 am to 4 or 5 pm, which is when there is the greatest demand for fruit. Her optimism has enabled her to be successful for her family, since she cannot read or write and many people had underestimated her capabilities. However, Paula showed that, with great enthusiasm and strength, one can achieve their goals. This mother wants her two daughters to study, to be able to defend themselves in life, and not to have to experience what she herself had to deal with her in her youth. The loan that Paula requests will be invested in buying more fruit so she can grow her business and establish it in a permanent location.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of fruit she sells.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German tiene 50 años, es divorciado, así que vive solo en un cuarto que alquila. El es un hombre honesto que ha venido trabajando en el servicio de aplicado de parket  para una empresa desde hace 9 años, tiene mucho talento para esta labor, además de que con sus ganancias solventa sus gastos. German no tiene un horario fijo, ya que los contratos llegan esporádicamente, pero cuando lo contratan el trabajo dura de tres semanas a más, es un trabajo que requiere mucha precisión. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es que no sea estable, ya que si bien recibe muchos contratos, también hay veces que se queda semanas sin conseguirlos, haciendo que no tenga mucha estabilidad en realizarlo. German quiere ser un hombre útil y sabe que aun la vida le depara muchas oportunidades, es por eso que quiere estar preparado para afrontarlas. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar sus propias herramientas para el asentado de parket y poder trabajar paralelamente de forma independiente. En el futuro German quiere poner su propia empresa del rubro en el que trabaja, pero a su vez le gustaría otro negocio el cual aun no decide cual puede ser.
texts.en:
German is 50 years old and divorced, living alone in a rented room. He is an honest man who has been working for a business installing parquet floors for nine years. He has great talent for this work, and with his earnings is able to meet his expenses. German does not have a set schedule since contracts come in sporadically. However, when he is contracted out he works hard for three weeks or more. It is work that requires great precision. The most difficult part is that it is not stable employment and, at times, he receives many contracts but there are also weeks at a time when he may not receive any work. German wants to be a useful man, and knows that life still provides many opportunities which he wants to be prepared to confront. With the money from the loan, he wants to buy his own tools for parquet installation so he can also do work independently. In the future, German would like to have his own business in his current line of work but also would like to start another enterprise which he has yet to decide on.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary tools to carry out his work, so that he can also take on projects independently.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina started her business in the era of Perestroika when she didn’t get paid at her previous job and had to quit it in order to survive. She has successfully been running her business selling women’s jackets, sweaters and footwear for 14 years. She has been working in the market called Yulana and has gotten to know some of the tricks of her trade really well. Her business has seen stable and consistent growth within the past years. Presently, Valentina has over 17,000 Grivnas in turnover capital. Her net profit is about 3,500 Grivnas a month.  

Valentina is married with two grown children. She is always seeking ways to earn additional income for her family. She would love to get a 3000 Grivna loan to purchase new inventory, increasing her stock as a result. Valentina is in the process of constructing a vending kiosk for inventory storage. We believe her polite and respectful way in dealing with customers, along with perfect credit history, will secure timely loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Avancemos Juntas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas esta ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, en L. comunidad D. Yauli, esta es una zona muy hermosa con paisajes muy hermosos y zonas turísticas como Tintay panco, Incañan, Bosque D. las piedras (qampata), sopa D. piedras en Ambato. Las vestimentas son D. muchos colores D. los Chopcca Las actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. agricultura, se produce papa, cebolL., trigo, olluco, en L. ganadería, pequeña cantidad ganado vacuno porcino, vino ente otros.

Teresa A., elL. es analfabeta vive en una casa muy pequeña, es Padre y Madre para sus tres hijas D. 15, 28 y 20 años, que estudian en el tecnológico. Ha pasado su vida tejiendo medias y chalinas, Su mayor dificultad es un accidente que tuvo pasteando sus cabras, se cayo del cerro y se rompió el brazo por lo cual no pudo continuar tejiendo, su negocio bajo y elL. necesita el dinero para que sus hijas estudien. Con el apoyo D. FINCA Peru logró conseguir un préstamo y con L. ayuda D. su promotora salió adelante, le gusta FINCA Peru por que encuentra mucha a alegría en las promotoras y socias, ha aprendido ahorrar y confiar en otros. Su sueño es lograr que sus hijas sean profesionales y que saquen su titulo. Teresa va invertir el préstamo en comprar más mercadería como lanas y darle trabajo a su vecina para que teja medias y chalinas

L. M., es casada con tres hijos pequeños D. 2 meses, 6 y 8 años, vive en casa D. su madre. L. tiene negocio D. venta D. gasolina y trasporte D. ómnibus entre Huancavelica y Yauli y alrededor D. su pueblo, con sus prestamos y ahorros compro un ómnibus D. segunda que estaba en oferta, L. es socia antigua D. Finca. Los problemas que elL. enfrenta son que su mamá le dió parálisis facial y estuvo a punto D. morir y con sus ahorros pudo ayudarL.. ElL. obtuvo un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles D. Finca Perú va invertir su dinero comprando llantas traseras y gata para su trasporte. Su sueño es comprar su casa propia y para ello esta ahorrando.

Rebeca T., es casada con cuatro hijos D. 6, 9, 11, 12, todos estudiando en el colegio, gracias a Dios no tiene mayores dificultades. Empezó este nuevo negocio con el préstamo D. 200 nuevos soles D. Finca Perú D. venta D. lanas y cahuas D. lanas, donD. aprendí ahorrar, me capacitaron, ahora soy mujer D. bien, apoyo a mis cuñadas que se han quedado solas. Va invertir su dinero comprando más lanas D. Huncayo. Su sueño es comprar una remalladota, y mas telares, tener una tienda D. lanas, sintética y naturales.
texts.en:
"Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas" is located in the department of Huancavelica, in the community of Yauli. This is a beautiful region with very pretty scenery and tourist areas such as Tintay Panco, Incañan, Bosque D. las Piedras (qampata), and Sopa D. Piedras in Ambato. The garments of the Chopcca are multicolored. The main activity of the community is farming (potato, onion, wheat, olluco) and a small quantity of cattle, pigs, and sheep among others.

Teresa A. is illiterate and lives in a very small house, she is father and mother to her three daughters, 15, 28, and 20 years old who study in the technological institute. All her life she has woven stockings and shawls, but due to an accident she had hearding sheep when she fell from a hill and broke her arm, she could not continue weaving and her business did not go well, and she needed the money so her daughters could study. With the support of FINCA Peru she got a loan and with the help of her promoter she moved ahead. She likes FINCA Peru because she finds much happiness with the promoters and partners. She has learned to save money and to have faith in others. It is her dream that her daughters become professionals and graduate. Teresa will invest the loan in buying more merchandise such as wool and offer work to her neighbor weaving stockings and shawls.

L. M. is married with three children, 2 months, 6 and 8 years old. She lives in her mother's house. L. sells gasoline and bus transportation between Huancavelica and Yauli and around the village. With her loans and savings she bought a second-hand bus which was on sale. L. is an old partner of Finca. Her problem is that her mother had a facial paralysis and almost passed away but her savings helped her. She got a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Finca Peru. The money will be invested in buying back tires and a jack for her bus. It is her dream to buy her own house and therefore she is saving money.

Rebeca T. is married with four children, 6, 9, 11, and 12 years old, all in school with no major difficulty. She started this new business with a loan of 200 nuevos soles from Finca Peru selling wool garments and wool shirts. She learned to save money and prepared to become a good woman helping her sisters-in-law who are on their own. The money will be invested in buying more wool products in Huncayo. Her dream is to purchase a sewing machine and more looms, and to have a store selling synthetic and natural wool,

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The 21 partners will invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es: Jennifer tiene 21 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca donde vive con su familia, es madre soltera de un hijo de un mes de nacido, llamado Rodrigo. Jennifer trabaja vendiendo productos naturistas desde hace ya 11 meses, tiempo en el cual le ha generado buenos ingresos económicos.  Es por eso que se dedica a su negocio casi todo el día, no teniendo un horario fijo, ya que ella trabaja por pedidos. Le gusta su trabajo porque tiene bastante libertad sobre las horas en las cuales realizarlo. Jennifer trabaja muy duro para satisfacer las necesidades de su pequeño bebe. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá más de sus productos, para venderlos y poder crecer en su negocio, en el futuro a ella le gustaría tener un negocio más estable, como una tienda o una boutique.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old and is a native of the city of Juliaca where she lives with her family. She is a single mother with a month-old son, named Rodrigo. Jennifer has worked selling natural products for the past 11 months, during which time she has generated good economic returns. It is for this reason she works almost all day long, without a fixed schedule, since she works for orders. She likes her job because she has a lot of freedom with the hours in which she works. Jennifer is working very hard to meet the needs of her young baby. With the money from the loan, she will acquire more products and sell them in order to be able to grow her business. In the future, she would like to have a more stable business, such as a shop or boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase the greatest amount of natural products she can sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells construction retail items and tools in the local Yubileinyi market. Valentina is married with one daughter, Alla. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her gross income is about 8,000 Grivnas. 

Valentina decided to start this business because construction and remodeling supplies are always in demand. She is very focused and hard-working. She devotes most of her time to this small business and believes her venture makes her life brighter and richer. This time Valentina is requesting a 6,000 Grivna loan to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to repay her the loan in 6 months. 

Note: Valentina is in a picture with some of her customers who came to buy from her as this picture was taken.

loans.use: To increase inventory and turnover in capital

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián tiene 44 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su hermana con su familia. Es un hombre muy carismático, esto le ha ayudado en su negocio de venta de productos Herbalife (productos alimenticios), donde se tiene que convencer a las personas para que le compren sus productos. Hasta ahora a Don Fabián le va muy bien, logrando buenos ingresos económicos, dedicándole gran parte de su tiempo al trabajo, pero no teniendo un horario fijo ya que trabaja por pedidos. Don Fabián quiere ayudar en la economía de su familia y colocar su granito de arena para lograr su bienestar. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más de sus productos Herbalife para distribuirlos a más personas y así lograr mejores ganancias.  En el futuro Don Fabián quiere subir en la escala de esta compañía, para lograr mejores ingresos económicos y asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Fabián is 44-years-old, single, and lives in his sister's house with her family. He is a very charismatic man, and this has helped him in his business of selling Herbalife products (nutritional products) when he has to convince people to purchase his products. Until now it has gone very well for Don Fabián, as he has made a good income. He dedicates a large part of his time to his work, but he doesn't have a fixed schedule since he works by taking orders.

Don Fabián wants to help with his family's expenses and do his part to achieve their well-being. With the money from this loan, he will purchase more Herbalife products to distribute to more people and therefore obtain more products. In the future, Don Fabián wants to increase the scale of this company to obtain more income and to secure his retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of the products he sells

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
The Nuevo Amanecer’ (meaning, New Dawn) communal bank is located in Huancavelica in the district and community named Yauli. Yauli has a warm climate. The most popular occupation is commerce because there is an abundance of potatoes, onions, wheat, and livestock, including cows, goats, and sheep, although in smaller numbers. The community also produces milk and cheese, and its beautiful sights attract tourists. Along the streets of Yauli you can see the Chopccas, the native people of the region who dress in colorful garments. In Yauli there is place near the train station where the members of Finca Peru sell their delicious potato and cheese dishes to the passengers.

Paulina C. is married and has two children, 23 and 30 years old, who are both married. Paulina started selling lollipops, earning nine soles for every box she sold. She heard about Finca Peru in the train station, and she decided to take part in their meetings. Her loans have allowed her to rent a store downtown in Yauli and purchase pots and pans, dishes, and clothing to stock the store. Paulina told us that business is going very well. With Finca Peru she learned to overcome problems in managing a store and thanks to the training given to members, she considers Finca Peru as a parent giving her a loan to start a new business. She learned how to save money and to set up a working capital fund. Paulina's dream is to have a larger store and to purchase more merchandise to better serve her clients.

MarceL. T. is married and has 4 children. She sells meats. MarceL. has a daughter who is mentally disabled and wanders the streets. This worries MarceL. very much but her friends at Finca Peru remind her that with the help of God she will get better. With her loans MarceL. rented a store in downtown Yauli and purchased more merchandise. She sells ice cream, soft drinks, and beer. Her dream is to purchase a house in downtown Yauli. It is very expensive but she is saving to make her dream a reality.

Doris B. is married and has 2 children, 2 and 4 years old. She tells us that her husband has abandoned her and during that period she suffered a great deal. She is the only one supporting her daughters. She has a convenience store where she previously sold only groceries, but little by little she was able to improve the selection. Now she sells meats, vegetables, fruits, clothing etc. In Yuali there are many weddings and baptisms and she wants to purchase merchandise for these special occasions. She has learned to appreciate herself as a woman and never allow herself to be mistreated. She is grateful to Finca Peru because she learned how to save money, to be strong, and have strong values. Doris’ dream is to proviD. her daughters with an education, until they grow up to be professionals. She also dreams of opening a snack bar, because there isn't one in Yauli.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer esta ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, distrito D. Yauli, comunidad D. Yauli, con clima calido, actividades principales D. L. comunidad donD. crece abundante papa, cebolL., trigo en ganadería encontramos abundantes vacas , cabras y ovejas menor proporción, en esta comunidad existe bastante comercio. También produce leche y quesos, encontramos que es una zona turística con atractivos muy lindos, por las calles D. Yauli se ve los Chopccas, son nativos D. L. zona que se pasean con sus vestimentas D. fuertes colores con chuyos, Waras, medias D. colores, En Yauli hay una estación donD. las socias D. FINCA Perú aprovechan en vender a los pasajeros L. rica papa con queso

Paulina C., es casada tiene dos hijos ya mayores D. 23 y 30 años casados, Paulina comenzó a vender chupetes y ganaba por caja dos nuevos soles, escucho en L. estación del tren hablar D. Finca Perú y se animó a asistir a las charlas, sus prestamos le han permitido alquilar una tienda en el centro D. Yauli, compro ollas, losas, ropas, surtió su tienda y elL. nos cuenta que le va bien. Con Finca aprendió a no tener problemas en el manejo D. su negocio, gracias a las capacitaciones que se les dan, elL. considera a Finca como su padre que el dio el préstamo para comenzar su nuevo negocio aprendiendo a ahorrar y separa el dinero para el capital El sueño D. doña Paulina es tener una tienda más granD. y comprar mercadería para atender mejor a sus clientes

MarceL. T., es casada con 4 hijos, elL. venD. carne Doña MarceL. tiene una hija que esta mal D. L. cabeza, camina sin sentido por las calles eso le aflige mucho pero sus amigas D. Finca L. alientan que con L. ayuda D. Dios se sanara. Con sus préstamos a alquilado una tienda en el centro D. Yauli, y compro mas mercadería, realiza venta D. helados, gaseosas, cervezas, su sueño es comprar una casa en el centro D. Yauli, cuesta mucho pero ahorrara para cumplir su sueño

Doris B., casada, tiene dos hijos D. 2 años y D. 4 años nos cuenta que su esposo L. abandono, fue una etapa en L. cual sufrió mucho, elL. es el único sustento para sus hijas. Tiene una tienda donD. solo vendía abarrotes, poco a poco elL. ha podido surtir su tienda y ahora venD. carne, verduras, frutas, ropas, etc. En Yauli se realizan muchos matrimonios, bautizos y elL. quiere aprovechar L. oportunidad en comprar mercadería para esas ocasiones. también ha aprendido a valorarse como mujer y a no permitir en ser maltratada, agrádese a Finca por que aprendió ahorrar, a ser muy solidaria, fuerte y sobre valores. El sueño D. dona Doris es darles estudios a sus hijas hasta que sean unas profesionales y abrir una pillería en Yauli, por que no hay.

loans.use: For members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman lives with his wife and daughter in Berdyansk, a city on the Sea of Azov. He runs a small business selling sportswear and jackets in the local market for low-income customers. He has been in this business for several years and has been quite successful. Currently, Roman has about $650 of working capital. His monthly net profit amounts to $500.

Roman is a very polite and affable businessman. His kiosk offers a variety of good-quality inventory for reasonable prices and his willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain repeat clientele. A nice, convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. Roman is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase some additional inventory. High inflation rates produce a negative impact on businesses in Ukraine. This has definitely affected Roman’s business, too. He believes that financial assistance in combination with his hard work and perseverance will help him keep up with competition and contribute much to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase his inventory

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de un niño llamado Cristian de 8 años de edad y vive en casa de unos familiares. Siempre le ha gustado el arte, es así que hace 16 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías y manualidades en corrospun (planchas de plástico) para mantener a su pequeño Cristian. Roxana no puede pedir un mejor trabajo, ya que es libre de crear los diseños que le parezcan de agrado al público, cuenta con una gran variedad de adornos que ofrecer y que la clientela compra frecuentemente. Roxana abre su establecimiento desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche, ya que trabaja atendiendo su negocio y al mismo tiempo elaborando más adornos. El motivo del esfuerzo de esta madre es sacar adelante a su hijo Cristian, quiere verlo grande y con muchas oportunidades para alcanzar sus sueños. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará materiales más novedosos para elaborar sus adornos y que su negocio sea el más concurrido por la clientela juliaqueña.
texts.en:
Roxana is 37 years old. She is a single mother of a boy named Cristian who is 8 years old, and she lives at home with relatives. She has always liked art, and for that reason, for the past 16 years she has sold her craftwork and handicrafts in corrospun (plastic sheets). She also does this to take care of her young child, Cristian. Roxana could not ask for a better job because she is free to create designs that seem to please the public, and she has a wide variety of ornaments to offer that customers buy frequently. Roxana keeps her business open from 8 AM until 8 or 9 at night, enabling her to work and take her customers’ business while developing more ornaments. The reason for this mother’s effort is to succeed for her son Cristian; she wants to see him grow up with plenty of opportunities to achieve his own dreams. With the money from the loan, she will buy newer materials to develop ornaments and so that her business can become the most popular among her Juliaqueña clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to prepare her crafts

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luís M. vive en la casa de sus padres, es una casa de ladrillo con 5 habitaciones de ellas, él ocupa uno, es soltero, desde hace tres años que trabaja en el rubro  y ahora cuenta con su propio taxi. 9 años que reside en la zona de El Torno, Bolivia y se dedica a la actividad del transporte urbano. Actualmente se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia crediticia, siempre para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehiculo. Quiere seguir trabajando con créditos porque le enseña a ser responsable y es una de las formas con las que puede seguir creciendo y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr José Luís M. lives in his parents home, in a brick house with five bedrooms, one of which he occupies. He is single, and has been working in the area for three years and now has his own taxi. For nine years he has resided in the El Torno zone in Bolivia, dedicating himself to urban transportation. At pesent he is asking for his fourth series of credits, always for maintaining and repairing his vehicle. He would like to continue to work with credits because it teaches him to be responsible and is a manner for him to keep increasing and improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Qantuwayta Group

texts.en:
Gardenia C., Aydee P. and Valeriana S. are members of the community bank, Qantuwayta, which is located in a small community, Vischongo, about 3500 meters above sea level in the Andes. Adjacent to the Pampas River, the area is known as an archaeological zone wich much potential in the agriculture and commercial markets.

Gardenia lives in the area with her 7-year-old son and has run a store from her house for the past 2 years. Unfortunately, about 2 years ago, she also experienced a small robbery in her store, which she has since been able to overcome with the help of loans and her savings from FINCA Perú. Her biggest dream is to have her son attend the University and become a professional; she is currently saving to be able to fulfill her dream.

For the past six months, Aydee has been working at her snack bar which continues to grow. She dreams of finishing her studies and being a professional.

Valeriana is married with three children, aged 25, 22 and 19. She came to the area from Lima five years ago to help her mom, and has not yet returned. She is currently saving for her mother’s health and has a dream of having her own small business to run with her family.

Their loan of 1,700 soles will be invested by the women into their businesses. Gardenia will invest into the purchase of more groceries including fruits and vegetables. Valeriana will purchase drinks and cakes for the restaurant. Aydee will purchase more items for her store including candies, ice cream, ice cream cones and cakes.

The community bank, Qantuwayta, needs a loan of 5,100 nuevos soles in order for 11 of its members to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To improve their businesses.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: El Sr. Marco A., hace 37 años que reside en la zona, cuenta con domicilio propio donde vivie con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su actividad es la agricultura, principalmente la producción de sésamo, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuenta con un tractor propio, con lo que realiza además los servicios de tractoreo en las pequeñas granjas de la zona. EL Sr. Marco es uno de los clientes mas antiguos con los que contamos actualmente, tiene ganas de seguir trabajando con la institución y de esa manera llegar a mejorar y crecer como agricultor, tiene 5 hectareas, las cuales destina para la crianza de ganado de tal manera que no le queda mucho espacio para la agricultura, por ello quisiera en un futuro próximo poder comprar una propiedad más grande.
texts.en:
Mr Marco A. has lived in the area for 37 years, in his own home that he lives in with his wife and two sons. He works in agriculture, principally in the production of sesame, as well as dedicating himself to the raising of cattle, relying on his own tractor, with which he also realizes tractor services in the little farms in the area. Mr Marco is one of our oldest clients, and has continued to earn work with the institution and in this manner has been able to improve and grow as an farmer. He has five hectares which are destined for raising livestock in such as way that he is not leaving much space for agriculture. For this reason he hopes to be able to purchase a larger property in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sesame seeds

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is married with a daughter, Aida. He lives with his family and his elderly mother in Kherson, in the south of Ukraine. Marat sells sports footwear in the central city market. He is very disciplined and likes to do things in an orderly and accurate fashion. These characteristics have helped him to stay afloat for 10 years in a row. Marat has 17,000 Grivnas invested in his business. He is getting about 8,000 Grivnas in income each month.

Marat knows how to manage his business and create favorable conditions for his customers. His successful operations are a direct result of availability of lending services through Nadiya Ukraine. Marat has taken and paid back 14 loans without any problems. This time he is seeking a 3600 Grivna loan to increase the assortment of inventory in his kiosk.

Note: this is a short-term, seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of his inventory

loans.name: Santo Domingo Acocro Group

texts.en:
Julia G. H. is a member of the community bank, Santo Domingo Acocro in Acocro, which is best known for its high production of grains. Unfortunately, there is not an easy way to access the fairs in the area, which is problematic because most vendors in Perú rely on the weekly fairs to sell their goods. Most businesses are based on the markets of agriculture and selling small animals.

Julia sells animals and soon she would like to begin selling adult and children’s clothing as well. She lives in Acocro with her husband and their 6 children. She will invest her loan of 600 soles into improving her quality of life and to purchase and to improve her business. She is currently saving to purchase a car which is one of her goals. Ensuring her children continue their education and become professionals is another dream of hers.

The community bank, Santo Domingo D. Acocro, needs a loan for 13,900 nuevos soles in order for 15 of its members to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To improve their businesses.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de Dios vive en la comunidad de Pakay, Municipio de El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia su casita es de madera, consta de un cuarto y una cocina, es muy humilde, hace 14 años que reside en la zona, en la cual ha estado cultivando las tierras para su producir maíz y maní ahora con el financiamiento de este crédito quiere aumentar su actividad a la crianza de ganado ovino. Vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, dos de  ellos se  encuentran estudiando en la escuelita de la misma comunidad y uno emigró a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mr Juan de Dios lives in the community of Pakay, in the Municipality of El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. His household is made of lumber, is very humble and is composed of a room and a kitchen. He has lived in the area for 14 years, during which he has cultivated the earth for the production of corn and peanut. Now, with the money from this loan, he would like to increase this activity with the raising of ovine cattle. He lives with his fine and their three sons, tow of which are studying in the community school and one which has emigrated to the nearby city.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ovine cattle and corn grain

loans.name: Elvis Ivan

texts.es: El Sr. Elvis O., vive en la casa de sus padres con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, su esposa vende comida en el mercado, hace  3 años que cuenta con dicho negocio. Tiene como actividad principal es el transporte urbano de taxi, con su propio vehiculo. Es un cliente que se encuentra en su segunda secuencia crediticia y el primer crédito fue hecho a través de un Bancos de emprendimiento, sin embargo ahora decidió independizarse. El destino del crédito será para adquirir un puesto en el mercado, para la venta de comidas que es la actividad de su esposa, su objetivo  principal es llegar a comprarle un puesto propio. La otra parte del crédito la utilizará para comprar llantas y hacer un mantenimiento de su automóvil.
texts.en:
Elvis O. lives in his parent's house with his wife and young son. His wife sells food in the market, a business she's operated for 3 years. He has his own vehicle and operates a taxi business. He is a second-time borrower. The first loan came from a [community?] bank for new businesses, but he's now decided to set out on his own. The loan will be used to get a market stall for selling food, his wife's business, and ultimately to buy a place. The rest of the loan will be used to service his car and buy new tires.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a market stall for wife's food business and new tires for taxi business.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana sells candy, bakery and sweets in a local market called “Progress” in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Her small vending kiosk is located very favorably in a nice part of the marketplace busy with potential customers. Oksana launched this business 5 years ago. Currently, she already has 18,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas.

Oksana’s business can boast high profitability. Groceries always sell well in any season and are always in high demand among customers. Oksana is dreaming about growing her business and eventually opening a whole network of small locations selling sweets and candy in different markets of her town. She is requesting a loan of 6000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: Increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Las Mosqueteras 1 Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: Las Mosqueteras 1 se encuentra situado en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia. El grupo esta en su tercer cilco crediticio, compuesto por 11 personas,como precidenta tenemos a la señora Claudia Neisa R. C. y tesorera Mercedes T. R., Jeidy A. R. como la secretaria, es un grupo mixto, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican ala costura, venta de cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrotes y venta de ropa las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias lunes en la casa de la señora tesorera. Estan conformes por trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 15 dias. 
La Sra Mercedes T. R. es tesorera del grupo, tiene 3 años de antigüedad en el rubro de venta de comida, trabaja 7 dias a la semana y 6 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mayormente  es el de atender a la gente que va por su comida diaria. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo. Ella quiere hacer estudiar a su hijos para que salgan profecionales. 
La Sra Claudia Neisa R. C. es lider del grupo, tiene 2 años de antigüedad en el rubro de venta de cosmeticos trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 5 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mayormente fuera del domicilio, de ambulante. Es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la va a defraudar ya que es la presidenta del grupo y tiene que dar el ejemplo. 			
La Sra Jeidy A. R. tiene 6 años de antigüedad en el rubro de venta de abarrotes trabaja 7 dias a la semana y 16 horas al dia , su meta es salir profesional, ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
The lending bank named "Las Mosqueteras 1" is located in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. This group is in its thrid cycle of loans, composed of 11 persons including Claudia Neisa Rocas C. as president, Merceded Teherina Rohas as treasurer, Jeidy A. R. as secretary. This is a mixed group, composed of women who are dedicated to sewing, sales of cosmetics, food, groceries and clothes. Meetings are held at the end of the day on mondays at the treasurer's home. They are satisfied to work with loans because they learn to save and share with their friends every 15 days. Ms Mercedes T. R. is the treasurer of the group, has three years of experience in food sales, and works seven days a week for six hours per day. Her work is largely comprised of attending to the customers who come over daily to purchase food. She is very responsible and accomplished. She would like to provide an education for her sons so they may become professionals. Ms Claudia Neisa R. C. is the leader of the group, has two years of experience in cosmetic sales, and works six days a week for five hours a day. She works mostly outside of the home, as a traveling salesperson. She is very responsible and polite and pleased with the opportunity from the lending bank. She will not disappoint you and as president of the group provides an example to others. Ms Jeidy A. R. has six years of experience in the sales of groceries, and works seven days a week for 16 hours a day. Her dream is to become a professional, and is currently studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: Virgen D. Fatima se encuetra ubicado en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz Bolivia, se encuentra en su 2do cilco crediticio y está compuesto por 16 personas, Se fundo el 12 D. Junio del 2008, por iniciativa D. un grupo solidario D. señoras, la señora Delicia V. M. es la presidenta del grupo, tesorera es la Sra Ruth Negri R. A. y Secretaria la Sra. Asunta G. V.; en el grupo mayormente se dedican a la  venta D. Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrotes, Empanadas, etc. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias miecoles a horas 9:30 AM en la casa D. la señora tesorera. Las Señoras estan conforme D. trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 dias. En el grupo en sus inicios Se conformo con con 16 personas D. las cuales 3 se retiraron por motivos personales e ingresaron otras 3 nuevas, a la fecha ha sido un grupo muy cumplido.			
La Sra Delicia V. M. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 8 años D. antigüedad en el rubro D. promotora D. cosmeticos y tejido a mano D. carteras, bolsones, monederos a lo que le dedica 8 horas al dia, Tiene 1 hija pequeña que todavia esta en colegio. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la defraudara. Tambien ella es unas D. las fundadoras y lider del grupo. 			
La Sra Ruth Negri R. A. es la Tesorera del grupo. Lleva 5 años D. antigüedad en el rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos y Ropa, trabaja 6 dias a la semana por 8 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mayormente fuera del domicilio, D. ambulante, su meta es D. seguir Trabajando con Emprender y tambien y ser Directora D. un Grupo D. promotoras D. cosméticos. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda el grupo y la Intitucion no la defraudara. Tiene 5 niños que estan en la escuela y con los ingresos que percibe pueD. ayudar en el sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
The loaning bank named "Virgen D. Fatima" is located in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, and is asking for its second cycle of loans. Funded on 12 June 2008 by the initiative of a group of singlewomen, the group is composed of 16 people including Ms Delicia V. M. as president, Ruth Negri R. A. as treasurer and Asunta G. V. as secretary. The majority of the members are dedicated to the sales of cosmetcis, food, groceries, empanadas, etc. Meetings take place at the beginning of the day on wednesdays, at 9:30 am, at the treasurer's house. The women are satisfied to work with Emprender as they learn how to save and share with their friends every 14 days. The initial group was maD. up of 16 people, 3 of whom left due to personal reasons and who were replaced by 3 new women, and today they have a full group. Ms Delicia V. M. is the president of the group, has eight years of experience in the sales and promotion of cosmetics and hand weaves bags, purses, etc for eight hours a day. She has one small girl who is still in school. She is very responsible and polite and will not dissapoint Emprender with the opportunity she is given. She is also one of the founders and leaders of the group. Ms Ruth Negri R. A. is the treasurer, has five years of experience in the sales of cosmetics and clothes, and works six days a week for eight hours a day. Her work is largely done outsiD. of her home, as a traveling salesperson. Her dream is to continue working with Emprender and one day become director of a group of cosmetic promoters. She is very responsible and polite and is pleased with the opportunity provided by teh group and will not disappoint. She has five children who are in school and with the profits she is able to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra F. I. Fausta is a member of community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She is married and has five children. She has a stand at the market where she works daily, selling cereals and grains. With her loan of 2500 soles, Alejandra will invest in her business by purchasing oatmeal, flaxseeds, and dried goods.

Alejandra hopes to continue working so she can save up for when she is older and can no longer work.

loans.use: With her loan of 2500 soles, Alejandra will invest in her business by purchasing oatmeal, flaxseeds, and dried goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more products to her mini-market.

loans.name: Rosa Nieves

texts.en:
Rosa Nieves R. F. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She has a stand at the market where she sells grains and dried goods.

She works daily at the market and will invest her loan of 2000 soles into her business by purchasing oatmeals, grains, flour and cereals. She is currently saving for the future when she finds herself unable to work because of old age.

loans.use: Purchase oatmeals, grains, flour and cereals.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas C. D. S. is a member of the community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She is married and has 8 grown children. Felicitas works daily at the market, selling dried goods and grains.

She purchases grain every two weeks from the market to sell at her business. She will invest her loan of 3000 soles ($1,000.00) in her business by purchasing oatmeal, corn, wheat and peas. She is currently saving so that when she can no longer work, because of old age, she will be able to cover her necessities.

loans.use: Purchase oatmeal, corn, wheat and peas

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo J. C. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which in Spanish means, “rebirth”. Consuelo is married with 6 children that are all attending school. After preparing food in her house, Consuelo sells meals in the market in Ayacucho by the stadium.

She makes traditional and common meals including puca picante, which is a dish including potatoes, and a special sauce. When she is not preparing and selling food, she also sells dried goods at the fairs. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will invest into her business and purchase oatmeal, peas, corn, oil, potatoes and other dried goods. Consuelo is saving to improve her business and also to spend it on something secret.

loans.use: With her loan of 1500 soles, she will invest into her business and purchase oatmeal, peas, corn, oil, potatoes and other dried goods

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca B. A. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which in Spanish means “rebirth.” Blanca is married with two children who are in school. With the help of her husband and sister-in-law, she runs a restaurant where she works daily preparing cebiche, a local dish consisting of raw seafood marinated in lime juice.

With her loan of 2000 soles, she will invest into her business by purchasing tables for her restaurant. She is saving to improve and make her restaurant larger.

loans.use: With her loan of 2000 soles, she will invest into her business by purchasing tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: Las Estrellas se encuentra situado en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, Bolivia, el grupo esta en su 1° ciclo crediticio. La precidenta es la señora Sonia M. D. Diaz y la tesorera Angela Guzman V., en el grupo las señoras se dedican a la costura, venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrotes y venta D. ropa. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias martes a horas 15:00 PM en la casa D. la señora Presidenta. Se sienten conformes y felices D. trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas.
La Sra Sonia M. D. Diaz es Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 años D. antigüedad en el rubro D. venta D. abarrotes, trabaja 7 dias a la semana y 10 horas al dia ,su meta es tener una tienda mas granD. donD. pueda vender y atender con más comodidad a sus clientes, es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo Su sueño es  hacer estudiar a su hijos para que salgan profesionales.		
La Sra Angela Guzman V. tiene 2 años D. antigüedad en el rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 5 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mediante la venta ambulante, su meta es D. tener su propio negocio, es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo, y le da gracias al grupo por confiar en ella y por aceptarla como socia.
texts.en:
The lending bank named "Las Estrellas" is situated in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. The group is on its first cycle of loans, and is comprised of the following persons: Ms Sonia M. D. Diaz as president and Ms Angela Guzman V. as treasurer. The women in the group are dedicated to sewing and to the sales of cosmetics, food, groceries and clothing. Meetings take place on tuesdays from 3:00 p.m. in the home of the president. They are satisfied and pleased to work with Emprender as they learn to save and share with their friends. Ms Sonia M. D. Diaz is the president of the group, has three years of experience in the sale of clothing and grociers and works seven days a week for ten hours a day. Her goal is to open a larger store where she will be able to sell more commodoties and attend better to her customers. She is very responsible and polite. Her dream is to proviD. education for her children so they can become professionals. Ms Angela Guzman V. has two years of experience in the sales of cosmetics and works six days a week for five hours each day. Her work is generally in the form of a traveling salesperson. Her goal is to own her own business. She is very responsible and polite, and is thankful to the group for believing in her and for accepter her as a member.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha Y. M. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which in Spanish means, “rebirth.” Bertha is married with two children who are studying. With the help of her daughter, she sells firewood and propane.

Every week she orders firewood and it is delivered to her in a truck. With her loan of 2500 soles she will invest in her business by purchasing more firewood and propane. She is currently saving so she can invest more into her business and continuing growing her business.

loans.use: With her loan of 2500 soles she will invest in her business by purchasing more firewood and propane.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina P. D. B. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She is married with four adult children. Dina has a grocery store in her house, where she works daily with the help of her daughter.

With her loan of 2000 soles she will invest into her grocery store by purchasing items such as soda, sugar, bread, oil and cookies. She is currently saving to travel.

loans.use: With her loan of 2000 soles she will invest into her grocery store by purchasing items such as soda, sugar, bread, oil and cookies

loans.name: Iris Gardenia

texts.en:
Iris Gardenia V. P. is a member of the community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. Iris is a nurse and also has a small kiosk that provides services including phone booths and groceries.

Iris will invest her loan of 1500 soles ($500.00) in her business by purchasing items like water, sugar, candies, toilet paper and bread. With the additional income she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional groceries and goods

loans.name: Milenka Escarle

texts.es: La Sra. Milenka Escarle G. Guzman tiene 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro de la venta de abarrotes,  nacio en la ciudad de Santa Cruz  y actualmente vive en el Barrio Calamade esta ciudad; vive en el domicilio de sus padres ya que aún no puede comprarse una casa propia. El presente credito será utilizado para incrementar su capital de trabajo y se entero de EMPRENDER por referencia de una socia, de esta manera solicitó su primer credito, hasta la fecha ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable. La Sra. Milenka con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio ayuda asus padres y cubre los gastos de sus estudios universitarios, su sueño es ser profesional.
texts.en:
Ms Milenka Escarle G. Guzman has worked for five years selling groceries. She was born in the city of Santa Cruz and lives in the Calamade neighborhood. She lives with her parents since she cannot afford to buy her own home. The current loan will be used to increase her business capital. It was through a friend that she learned about the ability to solicit a loan. Up until today she has been a punctual and responsible client. With the income from her business she helps her parents, as well as pays her own university expenses. Her dream is to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is married and has 6 dependants. She has received no formal education. Rose sells a special type of local doughnut which is popularly known as 'bofrot'. She uses flour, margarine and other ingredients to prepare the doughnuts at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1995. Rose uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and other family expenses. Rose will use the loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to increase production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more flour and other ingredients to increase production.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel Y. M. is a member of the community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. Isabel is married with two children and works from her house selling firewood.

She will use her loan of 1500 soles ($500.00) to purchase more firewood. With her savings she hopes to purchase a house and finance her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood

loans.name: Hagah

texts.en:
Hagah K. has a junior high education, she's married, and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a sprayer. Hagah has been selling groceries like Milo, milk, and others at Zion in Cape Coast since 2001.

Hagah uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills. Hagah will use the loan ($700.00) to purchase a variety of groceries to fulfill her customers' needs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hagah plans to help her husband pay for their children's education.

loans.use: Purchase groceries and sauce pans

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos Antonio R., tiene 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro del Transporte publico, nacio en la ciudad de cochabanba, Bolivia y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia donde refiere que tiene mejores perspectivas laborales. Vive en el domicilio de sus padres. El credito será para la reparacion del motor de su vehículo por lo que acudió a Emprender por recomendación de un amigo El Sr. Marcos Antonio R. tiene 2 hijos pequeños y con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo ayuda a mantener su hogar y a hacer estudiar a sus hijos es socio de la linea de micros 38 y trabaja con mucho esmero.
texts.en:
Mr Marcos Antonio R. has worked for 5 years in public transportation. He was born in the city of Cochabanba, Bolivia, and lives in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, where he believes exists the best prospects for work. He lives with his parents. The loan, of which he learned about through a friend, will be used to repair his vehicle's engine. Mr Marcos Antonio R. has two children. His income allows him to maintain his home and support his children's education. He is a member of the 38 micros and works with great dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle's engine

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El Sr. Lucas F.  tiene varios años de antigüedad en el rubro del Transporte urbano, vive en una pequeña casa en alquiler, junto a su familia. Nesecitaba un credito para la reparacion de su vehículo y acudio a Emprender, donde ya habia sacado un credito anteriormente, y lo había pagado con puntualidad, por ello es favorecido para ser financiado por los amigos de Kiva, el Sr. Lucas F. tiene un hijo pequeño y con los ingresos que percibe con su trabajo ayuda a mantener su hogar. Este credito es el segundo se le aprobó, esta vez para la reparacion de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mr Lucas F. has worked in public transportation for several years. He lives, along with his family, in a small, rented home. He asks for a loan to repair his vehicle. He seeks this loan through Emprender, from whom he sought a previous loan and paid back punctually. Mr Lucas F. has a small child, and with his income he supports his household. This second loan will help him repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Cecilia Sagoe

texts.en: Cecilia Sagoe H. is married and has 3 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high education. Cecilia Sagoe sells kitchen utensils at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1994. Her husband is a trader who sells used clothing. Cecilia Sagoe uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and other family expenses. Cecilia Sagoe will use the loan to purchase more goods to increase the quantity of kitchen utensils she sells to meet the increase in demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia Sagoe plans to help her husband in their children's education.

loans.use: Cecilia Sagoe will use the loan to purchase more goods to increase the quantity of kitchen utensils she sells to meet the increase in demand. She will also like to invest in the used clothing which is doing quite well.

loans.name: Basilia Yamilet

texts.es: Doña Basilia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Olor Palme, tiene 31 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y se desempeña como técnico en sonido, el negocio de la Sra. Basilia es la costura, vende ropa y productos de cosmético desde hace dos años, pues inicio, sola con la experiencia que adquirió en una empresa de la zona franca ya que cuando comenzó estuvo en las maquinas de coser, ya que era una fabrica de hacer ropa. También aprovechaba y vendía cosméticos a sus compañeras de trabajo lo cual vendía al crédito y al contado. Con la solicitud del préstamo quiere comprar ropa nueva, cosméticos y tela para hacer encargo de costura, pues ha logrado tener clientela y espera crecer más.  A largo plazo es poder tener un taller de costura con muchos trabajadores, tener un hijo ya que he tenido problemas para quedar embarazada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Basilia lives in the neighborhood called Olor Palme, in the capital city of Managua. She is 31 years old and her husband works for a private company as a sound technician. Mrs. Basilia has a dressmaking business, and also sells clothing and cosmetic products. She has been doing this this for two years and started her business on her own using the experience that she acquired working for a clothing factory in the duty free zone, where she worked using sewing machines. She also would sell cosmetics, on credit or for cash, to her co-workers. With the proceeds of this loan she wants to buy new clothing. cosmetics and cloth to fulfill her sewing orders, since she has obtained customers and hopes to further grow. In the long term, she would like to have a dressmaking shop with many workers, and she would also like to have a child, since she has not been able to get pregnant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing for adults and children and cloth to make dresses.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina A. sells buttons, lining, pans and other sewing materials at Zion Park in Cape Coast. Celestina has received junior high education.  She is married and has 4 dependants and her husband is a salesman. Celestina has been selling buttons, linings and other sewing materials since 1999. She is responsible for meeting the financial needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support in her children's education and also save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials and other goods of high demand for sale.

loans.name: Leticia Jackeline

texts.es: Doña Norma tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, que estudian la primaria, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación, su esposo trabaja como conductor de una ruta en la ciudad de Managua, lo cual sale desde horas muy temprano a su trabajo, la Sra. Norma se levanta desde horas muy temprano para mandar a su esposo desayunado, ya que su trabajo es agotador y riesgoso. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos en su casa, inicio con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior que tenia en la zona franca las Mercedes, lo cual lo invirtió en ropa para iniciar una etapa nueva en las ventas ya tiene dos años y logrado mantener su negocio. Con la solicitud de crédito es para comprar más inventario de ropa para damas y caballeros como ropa de niños, ya que tiene muchos encargos a la fecha y espera obtener buenas ganancias para poder ahorrar y comprar un terreno  propio ya que habita en la casa del suegro. A largo plazo es poder construir su casa digna para su familia y crecer con su negocio para poder seguir adquiriendo otro préstamo para hacer crecer su inventario y lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Ms Norma is 32 years old and has two children, 8 and 10 years old. Her children are in grammar school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliacíon neighborhood in the capital. Her husband works as a motorist of a route in the city of Managua. He leaves the house very early for work. Ms Norma also wakes up very early to make her husband's breakfast, especially since his work is grueling and dangerous. Ms Norma sells clothing and shoes in her home, a business she began when her previous job in the Mercedes free trade zone was closed. She began her clothing business as a new start, and has maintained this business for two years. She asks for a loan to purchase more inventory in clothing, especially since she has received many requests. She hopes to obtain a greater profit in order to save money and purchase her own territory to build a house. At the moment she lives with her father-in-law. In the future she hopes to build a proper home for her family and to build her business in order to continue soliciting loans to help increase her inventory and reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose C. is a single parent and has one child. She has received schooling through to junior high school. Rose sells groceries like Milo and milk. She also sells cosmetics and fabric at Atam in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. Rose uses her income to pay for school fees, utility bills and also food for the table. Rose will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more groceries, fabric and cosmetics for sale to meet her ever-increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to give quality education to her child.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more groceries, fabric and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Danelia tiene 47 años de edad, con cinco hijos los cuales tres trabajan y dos están estudiando, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Venezuela, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra en una empresa privada y cuando tiene libre trabaja por cuenta propia, es un trabajo duro pero se gana bien. Doña Danelia tiene una pulpería desde hace dieciocho años, lo cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo, y luego decidió hacer préstamos para invertir más en su inventario, lo cual hasta ahora ha podido mantenerse en las ventas pues con esta solicitud de crédito en AFODENIC es la sétima lo cual le permite crecer en las ventas con esta desea comprar productos de limpieza, productos enlatados y otros de variedad para ofertar a sus clientes. A largo plazo es comprar otro frezeer para vender más productos de carne roja como carne blanca, tener mejores ganancias y ver por su familia.
texts.en:
Daniela is 47 years old and she has five children, three are working and two are attending school. She lives in a district within the capital of Villa Venezuela. Her husband is a master labourer in a private company and when he works for his own account in his spare time - it's hard work but his earnings are good. Daniela has been running a convenience store for eighteen years. She started it with the help of her husband and later she decided to take loans to invest in her inventory which until now she has been able to maintain. This will be her sevent loan through Afodenic and it will permit her to increase her sales by purchasing cleaning products, canned foods, and other items to offer her clients. In the future she will purchase a freezer to sell products such as red and other meats. She wishes to have better earnings to look after her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned foods and cleaning products.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas B. is single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high education. Dorcas sells jewelry, laces and cosmetics and she is a hawker who travels to her customers to trade, which she has done since 2002. Dorcas uses her income to pay school fees of her child. Dorcas will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics, jewelry, fabric and other goods with high demand for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorcas plans to buy a piece of land to build a house for herself and her child.

loans.use: Dorcas will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more cosmetics, Jewelry, fabric and other goods of high demand for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add new clothing items to her inventory.

loans.name: Nakoja

texts.en: Nakoja N. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through to junior high education. Nakoja sells yams at Atobiase near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a commercial driver. Nakoja uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Nakoja will use the loan to increase the quantity of yams she sells to meet the increase in demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nakoja plans to increase her capital base to enable her to increase the quantity of yams she trades in.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of yams she sells to meet the increase in demand.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris Y. is married and has 3 children and has no formal education. Doris sells yams to local consumers at Prasu market in Elmina, which she has done since 1998.

Doris' husband is a preacher. She uses her income to help him pay school fees and utility bills. Doris will use the loan ($625.00) to purchase more yams for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to further her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase more yams for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells yams at Praso market in Elmina. Mary has received a junior high education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Mary has been selling yams since 1992. She is responsible for paying the family's financial expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy more yams to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Solidarias" is a big group of 37 people. Right now 15 members of this group would like a loan. For some members, this is their first loan. They hope it is their first step towards a better life. For other members, this is their 3rd or 4th loan, which they will use to continue growing their businesses.

Yoselin is the group representative and group leader. She is a very hard working mother of 3 young children who are all under the age of 10. She has a small business selling under garments. Yoselin said she is excited about continuing to grow her business.

Yoselin has dreams of being able to have her own house where she can provide her children a comfortable life. She hopes to have enough money to send her children to college and allow them to have a different life.

This whole group has stories of how hard life has been, but they are all ready to do something about it, They are very excited about this opportunity.

On behalf of Yoselin, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buy additional underwear and night wear for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more goods to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. has been selling yams at Praso market in Elmina since 1993. Felicia received a junior high education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader.

Felicia is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. Her loan ($525.00) will be used to buy more yams for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: nLa señora Margarita V. de Pereira es de Bº San Pedro, tiene casa propia, tiene 53 años de edad, casada con el Sr. Marciano Castillo Sánchez de 40 años de edad  y tienen 2 hijos.n       Es propietaria de una despensa con 3 años de funcionamiento, tiene clientela formada, ya que tiene buena ubicación, y son personas muy conocidas en la zona.nEl señor tiene una Gomería al lado de la despensa, y ambos tienen buenos ingresos mensuales. Entre las mercaderías que más vende se encuentra: carne, leche, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, artículos para el hogar, enlatados, etc. nn     El cliente quiere ampliar su local para surtir más de mercaderías y aumentar cada día sus  ingresos. En esta ocasión, adquirirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita V. de Pereira, from the San Pedro neighborhood, owns her own home and is 53 years old. She is married to Mr. Marciano Castillo Sánchez, 40 years old, and they have two children. For three years she has owned a small general store. The store has an established clientele because it is in a good location and the couple is very well-known in the area. Her husband has a tire shop beside the store, and together they have a good monthly income. Popular items sold at the store include meat, milk, vegetables, fruit, soda pop, items for the home, canned food, etc. Margarita wants to provide more products and thereby increase her daily income. She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, flour, vegetables, fruit, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto Carlos B., vive en Bº San Pedro, tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos.n Es propietario de una gomeria y ventas de cubiertas usadas, trabaja en este rubro hace 22 años, tiene clientela formada, y cuenta con buena ubicación, es muy conocido en la zona.n     El cliente quiere ampliar su local  para comprar màs cubiertas  ya que tiene buena venta con sus clientes. Con el crédito desea adquirir mayor variedad de cubiertas.n
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Carlos B. lives in the San Pedro neighborhood. He is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He is the owner of a tire shop that sells used tires. He has worked in this field for 22 years, has an established clientele, a good location, and is well-known in the area. Roberto wants to increase his inventory, since there is sufficient demand among his customers. With the loan he will be able to stock a greater variety of tires.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires of varying sizes

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi N. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through Senior High. Naomi sells yams to local consumers at Praso market in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a businessman. Naomi uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Naomi will use the loan to increase her capital to enable her to pay for transportation to the yam-producing areas to buy more yams at a cheaper cost for re-sale to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naomi plans to buy a piece of land to build a house for herself and the child.

loans.use: to increase her capital to enable her to pay for transportation to the yam-producing areas

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es: Cristhian tiene 44 años, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos. El, conjuntamente con su esposa elabora y vende en su domicilio las chipas que producen, y en algunos casos realiza venta en forma ambulante en su vehiculo por todo el dpto de la Cordillera, en su domicilio tiene una especie de kiosko dónde ofrece sus chipas, y en la misma registra muy buena venta y esto se debe  porque existe una muy buena circulación de gente frente a su local.n Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y hoy el maneja su propio negocio, el cual tiene una antigüedad de más de 12 años. Conjuntamente con su esposa se dividen las actividades,  la especialidad en elaborar las chipas es de herencia familiar. El local tiene una vista muy particular, uno cuando compra las chipas puede estar observando el momento de la elaboración, ya que el local es amplio y por sobre todo lo mas importante: es muy higiénico.n
texts.en:
Christian is 44 years old, he is married and has 2 children. He, alongside with his wife, makes and sells corn and cheese breads (chipas). Sometimes he sells his products with his car going throughout all the region of Cordillera. In his house he has a stand from where he sells his chipas and in he makes very good sales because he is located in a well travelled area. He learned his trade from his parents and today he runs his own business, and he has been running the business for the past 12 years. He and his wife share the duties. Making chipas is a family heritage. Their stand bears a very unique look because when clients purchase chipas they can also see them being made. The stand is large and very importantly, it is very clean.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase start, cooking oil, and cheese.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is married and has one son. He is a young entrepreneur who owns a store that sells cell phone and cell phone minutes. He also activates and repairs phones. Edgar tends the store himself. He told us that there is a lot of competition in the telephone business, and he has to offer great service to compete, especially by responding to the requests of potential clients as quickly as possible. Edgar has invested past loans in purchasing cell phone minutes and accessories. Because of this he’s been able to keep his store well stocked and offer a variety of products and services. Edgar is contemplating moving closer to the center of the city, because there is more traffic. He is asking for a loan to buy cell phone accessories and minutes.

Translate from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Edgar, es un microempresario joven, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo, el es dueño de un negocio que se dedica a la venta y activación de celulares, como así también tarjetas, en algunos casos también realiza reparación de celulares, el negocio lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad de Caacupé, la atención de la misma lo realiza el personalmente, comenta que en el rubro de la telefonía actualmente hay mucha competencia y para hacer frente a esto uno debe ofrecer una muy atención y por sobre todo debe evacuar lo mas rápido posible los pedidos de los potenciales clientes.nLos préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, lo invirtió en la compra de tarjetas para celulares y accesorios, esto le permitió tener bien surtido su negocio y así poder ofrecerle las variedades de productos y servicios que hoy día tiene el mundo de la telefonía celulares. nEl señor Edgar comenta que tiene pensado habilitar mas adelante una sucursal cerca de la basílica de Caacupé, ya que es el lugar mas visitados de la ciudad, por lo que la posibilidad de poder vender es mucho más que en cualquier otro lugar. nInvertirá su crédito en la compra de accesorios y saldo para celulares.n

loans.use: Buy phone cards and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Eteria

texts.es: Eteria, es madre soltera tiene una hija, y vive con sus padres, ella es propietaria de un despensa con ventas de bebidas de todo tipo, los principales productos que tiene en oferta son los de consumos diarios como azúcar, leche, carne, y bebidas de todo tipo,  inclusive ventas de helados artesanales.nnCon los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar una cantidad importantes de bebidas de todo tipo, como asi también helados, con esta cantidad de productos tiene pensado afrontar el verano que se acerca ya que son los meses dónde estos productos tienen buen movimiento de ventas.nnComenta Eteria, que la falta de trabajo en el país hace que las personas sean más creativas y busquen una forma honesta de subsistir, o caso contario deben migrar al exterior, menciona que tuvo oferta para viajar a España, pero decidió quedarse en el país y afrontar con creativa la crisis laboral existente en el país.n
texts.en:
