Eteria, es madre soltera tiene una hija, y vive con sus padres, ella es propietaria de un despensa con ventas de bebidas de todo tipo, los principales productos que tiene en oferta son los de consumos diarios como azu00facar, leche, carne, y bebidas de todo tipo, inclusive ventas de helados artesanales.nnCon los pru00e9stamos que le otorgo la Fundaciu00f3n Paraguaya pudo comprar una cantidad importantes de bebidas de todo tipo, como asi tambiu00e9n helados, con esta cantidad de productos tiene pensado afrontar el verano que se acerca ya que son los meses du00f3nde estos productos tienen buen movimiento de ventas.nnComenta Eteria, que la falta de trabajo en el pau00eds hace que las personas sean mu00e1s creativas y busquen una forma honesta de subsistir, o caso contario deben migrar al exterior, menciona que tuvo oferta para viajar a Espau00f1a, pero decidiu00f3 quedarse en el pau00eds y afrontar con creativa la crisis laboral existente en el pau00eds.n

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de gaseosas, cervezas, fideo, azúcar, carne,etc.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: La señora Felicita tiene 28 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella es propietaria de un  negocio que vende todo tipo de bebidas y productos de consumo diario y está dedicada a éste rubro hace más de 5 años.nElla comenta que estuvo enferma y con reposo por 1 mes aproximadamente y eso le generó mucho gastos y una descapitalización de su negocio, pero gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo nuevamente tener ese capital y así pudo comprar todo tipo de mercaderías como ser azúcar, leche, carne, bebidas de todo tipo, yerba, arroz, fideo, aceite, etc, hoy nuevamente esta  surtido su negocio, además posee  clientela formada que siempre está pendiente de los productos que ella vende.nTiene proyecta realizar trabajos adicionales y en paralelo al actual , esa actividad consiste en la venta de ropas para la temporada de verano, como asi también prendas deportivas.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is the owner of a business that sells all types of beverages and staple products, and she has been working at this business for more than five years. She says that she was sick and had to rest for one month. This generated a lot of expenses and her business lost money, but thanks to the loans that the Paraguay Foundation gave her, she was able to regain this capital and thus could buy all sorts of merchandise such as sugar, milk, meat, all types of beverages, yerba mate (tea), rice, noodles, oil, etc. Now her business is newly stocked, but she always has current customers who are waiting for the products that she sells. She plans to do additional work and at the same time run her current business. The additional work will be to sell clothing for the summer season, as well as athletic apparel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de galleta, azucar, leche, bebidas,yerba, carne, frutas, verduras, etc..

loans.name: Darren's Group
loans.use: D

loans.name: José

texts.es: El señor José tiene 50 años, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos y esta dedicado al oficio de ser carpintero hace mas de 30 años, comenta que realizar este trabajo actualmente tiene sus dificultades por el hecho de que hoy día hay poca materia prima ósea maderas, por lo que sus muebles en gran porcentaje esta hecho con la combinación de metal, su especialidad es la de fabricar muebles de cocina, cunas, cama, etc.nAlgunos de sus clientes son las mueblerías de las ciudades de  Tobatí, de Caacupé, Paraguari, como así también clientes en forma particular muy especialmente de la ciudad de Tobatí. Los prestamos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya lo invirtió en la compra de maderas, y varillas metálicas, así también logro comprar herramientas manuales. Tiene proyectado con uno de sus hijos incorporar al taller, el servicio de herrerías, para el efecto están pensando en un nuevo préstamo que le permita compra las  herramientasn
texts.en:
Jose is 50 years old, and is married with four children. He has been dedicated to the craft of carpentry for 30 years. He says that most recently finding work is difficult because raw materials, like wood, are hard to find. A high percentage of what he makes is made with a combination of wood and metal. His specialties are kitchen furniture, baby cribs, beds ect. Some of his clients are furniture retailers in the cities of Tobati, Caacupe, and Paraguari. The loans he obtained from the Paraguaya Foundation were invested in the purchase of wood, and metal support rods along with other manual tools. He is in the planning stage of opening a repair shop with his son, and with this newest loan it will permit him to purchase the tools he needs.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of specialty woods

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the community bank Atenas Portillanasu, located at Raul Porras Barrenechea Number 170 in the district of Yarina Cocha of the department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, a mother of 9 grown children, and married. Her husband works as a farmer. With the first loan of about $100 USD from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a grocery business. She has been working with the bank for 7 years. She owns two transport motorcycles and with the help of her two grandsons, who work daily providing transportation, she makes enough to repay her loan on time. With this loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, she can buy 4 tires, headlights, have the seats recovered, and fix and maintain the engines. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has realized one of her dreams, that of having two transport motorcycles of her own and thanks to them her financial situation has improved.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas”, ubicado en el Jr. Raúl Porras Barrenechea Nº 170 del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 9 hijos mayores de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica al trabaja de agricultor. Ana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con 2 motokar y con la ayuda de sus nietos, quienes trabajan todos los días en el manejo de su movilidad, brindándole ganancias para cumplir con el préstamo y pagar puntualmente.nnCon este préstamo de S/1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 4 llantas, focos, tapizar los asientos, arreglo de motor y otros mantenimientos. nnGracias a Manuela Ramos hizo realidad uno de sus sueños, tener 2 movilidades propias y gracias a ello su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.n

loans.use: Purchase tires, headlights and engine maintenance.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina tiene 45 años, es madre soltera, con 2 hijos, ella es una persona según manifesto, muy humildes, pero muy trabajadora, y  gracias a su sacrificio y con el acompañamiento de la Fundación Paraguaya en otorgarle créditos ella pudo hacerse de su negocio propio con el que mantiene su casa y a sus dos hijos, ya que cumple la función de ser papá y mamá a la vez.nUna de sus hijas de 18 años le acompaña en la actividad diaria que lo inician a muy tempranas horas de la madrugada a hacer las empanadas y chipas porque los cliente pasan a primera hora de la mañana a comprar sus productos.nSus principales clientes son los empleados de una fábrica de caña de azúcar que queda a una cuadra de su negocio a quienes también le prepara el almuerzo y el desayuno.nMartina, invertirá el préstamo que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya en la compra de carne, aceite, yerba, almidón, etc.n
texts.en:
Martina is a 45-year-old single mother of two children. She lives very modestly but is very hard-working. Thanks to her sacrifices, and with the support of loans from the Fundación Paraguaya, she has been able to start her own business and earn income to care for her home and children, since she now has to be both mother and father. Because her customers arrive first thing in the morning, Martina and her 18-year-old daughter must begin making stuffed pastries and cheese bread well before dawn. Martina's main customers are the employees of a sugar cane factory located a block away from her shop. She prepares breakfast and lunch for them, as well. She will invest the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya in the purchase of meat, cooking oil, tea, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for pastries and cheese bread, as well as soda pop, beer, tea, fruit, iced tea, herbal remedies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour, cheese, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Aquina

texts.es: La señora Aquina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas”, ubicado en el Jr. Miguel Grau Nº 150 del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre D. 3 hijos  mayores D. edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja como independiente. Madeline con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. golosinas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega en casa, en las mañanas se va al mercado y una D. sus hijas atienD. su negocio, por las tardes se dedica atender a sus clientes.  nnCon este préstamo D. S/2.000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 2 paquetes D. fideos, 2 paquetes D. aceites, detergentes, golosinas y otros.   nnGracias al apoyo del Banco su negocio ha crecido, y por enD. agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Aquina is a member of " La seu00f1ora Aquina pertenece al Banco Comunal u201cAtenas Portillanasu201d, ubicado en el Jr. Miguel Grau Nu00ba 150 del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 au00f1os y es madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja como independiente. Madeline con el primer pru00e9stamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. golosinas. Tiene 3 au00f1os trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega en casa, en las mau00f1anas se va al mercado y una D. sus hijas atienD. su negocio, por las tardes se dedica atender a sus clientes. nnCon este pru00e9stamo D. S/2.000 el cual seru00e1 pagado en 5 meses compraru00e1: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azu00facar, 2 paquetes D. fideos, 2 paquetes D. aceites, detergentes, golosinas y otros. nnGracias al apoyo del Banco su negocio ha crecido, y por enD. agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.n

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de diveross productos (abarrotes) al por mayor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. Los Mangos Nº.506 “San Fernando” del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años y es madre 2 hijos, menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja como Supervisor de Telefonía Básica. Elizabeth con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de kekes y pasteles. Tiene 1 año trabajando con el Banco. nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con la venta de Broastería, se levanta temprano para atender a sus hijos por las tardes se dedica a preparar lo necesario para salir a vender en las noches. nnCon este préstamo de S/1.200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 10 kilos de papa, 7 pollos, 3 kilos de arroz, 2 kilos de maíz morada, 5 docenas de huevos y otros.nnElizabeth agradece a Manuela Ramos porque su negocio ha crecido, desea seguir surgiendo en la vida por el bienestar de sus queridos hijos.n
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Amigas por Siempre" Communal Bank, located on Jirón Los Mangos San Fernando in the district of Manantay, department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and the mother of 2 children, who are minors and still her dependents. She is married and her husband works as a telephone supervisor. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/300 she invested in cakes and pastries to sell. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 1 year. She currently sells roasted chickens. She gets up early each day to take care of her children and in the afternoons prepares what she needs to go out at night to sell. With this loan for S/.1,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: 10 kilos of potato, 7 chickens, 3 kilos of rice, 2 kilos of purple corn, 5 dozen eggs and other items. Elizabeth is thankful to Manuel Ramos because her business has grown. She wants to continue improving in life for the wellbeing of her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies at wholesales prices.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es: La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo Nº 1021 del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 1 que aun depende de ella, es Viuda. Luz con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con la venta de golosinas, joyas y productos de belleza (UNIQUE) a domicilio, brindándole ganancias y poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. nnCon este préstamo de S/1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 1 caja de galleta, joyas (fantasía fina), y productos de bellezas. nnLuz manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres ucayalinas que tienen el deseo de triunfar en la vida.n
texts.en:
Luz belongs to “Mujeres de Éxito” ("Successful Women"), a community bank located at 1021 Colonel Portillo Lane, Callería, Ucayali. She is 51 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children (one grown and one still in her care). She invested her first loan from Manuela Ramos (for S/300, approximately US $100) in merchandise for a grocery store. She has been working with the bank for eight years. She now sells sweets and jewelry and is a sales representative for Unique brand beauty products. These activities will enable her to repay her loan on time. With this loan of S/1,500 (US $500), which will be repaid in five months, Luz will buy: 1 case of cookies, costume jewelry, and beauty products. Luz attests that Manuela Ramos is a great help for all of the women of Ucayali that want to triumph in life.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of jewelry and beauty products

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: La señora Madeleine pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas”, ubicado en el Jr. Atenas del Ucayali Nº 100 del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 4 hijos 2 mayores de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo se dedica al manejo de carros grandes “Chofer”. Madeleine con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de salchipapa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con 2 motokar como herramienta de trabajo, haciéndole trabajar día a día para tener otros ingresos y poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.nnCon este préstamo de S/1.200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 2 llantas, 4 focos, arreglo de motor, tapizar los asientos, etc. nnMadeleine manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para su familia y para todas aquellas mujeres trabajadoras. n
texts.en:
Madeleine belongs to “Atenas Portillanas,” a community bank located at 100 Atenas del Ucayali Lane, Yarina Cocha, Ucayali. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children (two grown and two still in her care). Her husband is a chauffeur. With the first loan that Madeleine received from Manuela Ramos (for S/300, approximately US $100), she began selling hot dogs and french fries. She has been working with the bank for two years. She now has two motorized carts that help her earn income every day and ensure that she will be able to repay her loan on time. With this loan of S/1,200 (US $400), which will be paid back in five months, she will buy two tires and four headlights, as well as upholster the seats and pay for engine repairs. Madeleine attests that Manuela Ramos is a support for her family and for all working women.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires, headlights, engine maintenance

loans.name: Ni Putu Okayoni

texts.id: Okayoni dan keluarganya sangat menggantungkan  hidupnya dari hasil mengolah tanah  pertanian, khususnya tanaman sayur kacang panjang. Okayoni merasa sangat  senang dengan pekerjaan yang ditekuni ini, terlebih lagi setelah mendapat pinjaman periode pertama dari Dinari. Okayoni merasa hasil yang di perolehpun semakin meningkat. Hal ini tak terlepas dari hasil kerja keras dan bantuan modal yang di peroleh untuk penyediaan pupuk maupun obat-obatan yang di butuhkan oleh tanamannya.                                    nPada panen yang lalu Okayoni mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan yaitu sebesar Rp 2.000.000.-  Hasil ini sudah merupakan keuntungan bersih setelah dipotong biaya bibit, pupuk, obat-obatan dan tenaga kerja. Namun  semua itu dikerjakan selama hampir 4 bulan dari pengolahan tanah sampai selesai panen. nBersama dengan I Ketut Sudi Utama, suaminya, Okayoni saat ini telah menanam kembali bibit baru untuk musim berikutnya dan sangat berharap masih mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari karena keuntungan yang didapat belum cukup untuk membiayai seluruh keperluan usahanya dan juga sebagian besarnya telah dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan biaya pendidikan 3 orang anaknya. Apalagi saat ini biaya kebutuhan  semakin naik, termasuk juga didalamnya Pupuk dan Obat-obatan. Untuk menunjang usahanya, Okayoni bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. n
texts.en:
Okayoni and her husband are long bean farmers. Their lives are depending on the result of their farm. In the last harvest season, she got a very good harvest. With this she can repay her loan that she got from DINARI foundation. She earned a net income of IDR 2 million (around USD 210) from her effort of farming for 4 months.

With her husband, Mr. I Ketut Sudi Utama, she wants to get another loan from DINARI to enable her to buy seeds for the next farming seasons. This is because her income is not enough to start up the next farming seasons after being used to pay school fees for her 3 children and also to pay daily necessities.

She wants to join a 6 month DINARI program where she can get a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will pay the loan at the end of the program.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide (Membeli bibit, pupuk dan anti hama)

loans.name: I Komang Muriada

texts.id: Mendapatkan hasil panen yang baik dan pendapatan yang lebih banyak merupakan impian bagi semua petani. Tak terkecuali juga dengan I Komang Muriada. Dari sebidang tanah milik orang tuanya yang ditanami dengan sayuran yaitu Kacang panjang, I Komang Muriada berharap mendapat hasil yang maksimal. Namun Karena keterbatasan yang ada, impian itu belum bisa I Komang Muriada wujudkan saat ini. nDari hasil panen periode pertama, I Komang Muriada hanya mendapat keuntungan yang sangat tipis yaitu Rp. 1.000.000 / 3 bln . Hal ini disebabkan karena faktor alam ( kekurangan air ). Namun begitu, I Komang Muriada tak patah semangat.  Bahkan saat ini tanah garapannya telah di tanami kembali dengan tanaman yang baru. Besar harapan I Komang Muriada musim kedepan ini hasil panennya akan lebih baik, dan untuk mendukung hal itu I Komang Muriada masih mengharapkan mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari untuk  tahap  yang ke dua. Pinjaman ini akan dipergunakan untuk biaya perawatan tanaman sayurnya seperti : untuk beli pupuk.dan obat-obatan. nUntuk menunjang usahanya, I Komang Muriada bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. n
texts.en:
To have a good harvest is every farmers' dream. This is also a dream of I Komang Muriada who is a long bean farmer. In the last harvest season, he only got a net revenue of IDR 1 million (around USD 105) for a 3 month farming period. This is due to difficulties in the irrigation system.

For this farming season, he wants to get a better result. He hopes that he can get a loan from DINARI foundation to enable him to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

He participated in a 6 month DINARI foundation program where he can repay the loan at the end of the program period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide etc (Membeli pupuk, anti hama dan ongkos tenaga kerja)

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.id: Dari pinjaman tahap pertama I Wayan Buda Memperoleh keuntungan yang cukup lumayan yaitu Rp. 1.800.000.- / 3 bln setelah di potong biaya- biaya perawatan tanaman dan ongkos kerja. Hasil yang cukup untuk biaya hidup 3 orang yaitu bersama istri dan seorang anaknya yang belum menikah.n Menanam kacang panjang dilakukan I Wayan Buda pada saat musim kemarau di saat sawah miliknya tak bisa di tanami padi. Jadi selang waktu menunggu musim hujan tiba inilah tanaman kacang panjang menjadi tanaman yang bisa menghasilkan pendapatan untuk keluarga. Dengan sumber air dari sumur bor dan mesin pompa air yang dibeli pada pinjaman pertama sangat membantu proses penyiraman kebun sayur milik  I Wayan Buda. nSaat ini kebun sayur I Wayan Buda telah hampir selesai panen dan telah mulai persiapan penanaman tanaman baru lagi. Untuk itu I Wayan Buda Masih memerlukan pinjaman lagi untuk tahap yang ke dua yang akan di pergunakan lagi untuk biaya pengolahan tanah , beli bibit, pupuk dan juga sebuah selang air untuk penyiraman. Untuk menunjang usahanya, I Wayan Buda bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. n            Dengan memiliki pompa air ini dalam  setahun Wayan Buda bisa melakukan proses penanaman kacang panjang 2 kali dan Wayan Buda sangat optimis hasil panennya kedepan akan lebih baik . nn
texts.en:
I Wayan Buda is a long bean farmer. He participated in DINARI foundation loan program in the last farming season. He can earned a net income of IDR 1.8 million (around USD 190) after a 3 month farming period. This income is used to finance his family of 3 (his wife and one kid) daily needs.

He wants to participate in the 6 month DINARI foundation program to enable him to buy seeds, fertilizer, and also water pump and water hose to enhance the irrigation to his farm. With this he is hoping to get a better harvest result.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer (Membeli bibit, anti hama dan ongkos tenaga kerja)

loans.name: I Komang Mertajiwa

texts.id: Setelah mengalami kesulitan dalam pinjaman tahap pertama karena terjadi kegagalan dalam panen tak menyurutkan semangat dari I Komang Mertajiwa untuk selalu berusaha untuk menyelesaikan pinjamannya. Dan I Komang Mertajiwa berharap untuk mendapat pinjaman lagi untuk memulai lagi usaha kebun sayurnya yang sempat terbengkelai akibat serangan hama yang sulit di kendalikanya.n I Komang Mertajiwa menghidupi kelurganya hanya dari hasil berkebun sayur-sayuran  yang di tanam di tanah  sakapan ( mengerjakan tanah orang lain dengan bagi hasil ) seluas 35 Are. Kegagalan panen baginya adalah suatu proses pembelajaran yang harus di hadapi untuk meraih kesuksesan yang tertunda. Dengan dukungan dari Desak Putu Pujawati, istrinya, I Komang Mertajiwa telah menanami lagi ladangnya dengan sayur kacang panjang dan tentunya dengan persiapan yang lebih matang termasuk juga Obat-obatan anti hama, pupuk dan perawatan yang lebih intensif. I Komang Mertajiwa tak mau usahanya mengalami gagal lagi  untuk itu dana yang di pinjamannya akan di pergunakan untuk membeli semua keperluan kebun sayurnya dengan begitu hasil panennya akan cukup untuk pengembalian pinjaman  dan juga bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Untuk menunjang usahanya, I Komang Mertajiwa bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. nn
texts.en:
I Komang Mertajiwa is a farmer. He took a loan from DINARI foundation in the last farming season. Unfortunately this farm was ruined by the uncontrollable pest attack. Even though his farming business was ruined, he is still trying to make the repayment to Dinari foundation. He works as a farming labor in another person farm. He is given responsibility to work out a 35 are land and he will be given a part of the proceed.

His failure in his farming venture is a learning process. His wife always supports him and encourages him to give it another try. Therefore I Komang Mertajiwa is applying for a 6 month loan program from DINARI so he can start again his farming venture. He will have longbean farm and he need money to buy fertilizer and pesticide so he can better prepared this time.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide (Membeli bibit, pupuk, anti hama dan biaya pengolahan tanah)

loans.name: I Made Ardana

texts.id: Di dusun Taman, Desa Tuwed, Bali barat, sebagian besar masyarakatnya hidup dari hasil bercocok tanam khususnya tanaman jangka pendek seperti: padi, palawija dan sayur-sayuran. Begitu juga yang di tekuni oleh I Made Ardana. Meskipun tak memiliki lahan sendiri, suami dari Nyoman Desi ini juga sibuk mengurusi kebun sayur kacang panjang yang ditanam dilahan yang di dapatnya dari menegrjakan tanah orang lain dengan sistem bagi hasil. Tanah seluas kurang lebih 20 Are telah ditanami kacang panjang dan telah menyelesaikan panen pertama dan mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan. Namun I Made Ardana merasa sangat kecewa karena dari hasil yang di dapatnya habis untuk mengembalikan modal yang dia dapat pinjam dari seseorang dengan bunga yang sangat tinggi. Untuk itulah untuk periode penanaman berikut ini I Made Ardana ingin bergabung dengan Dinari untuk meminjam  modal dengan sistem pengembalian di akhir periode    yaitu 6 bulan. Modal ini oleh I Made Ardana akan di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit, pupuk dan biaya –biaya lain yang di perlukan dalam perawatan kebun sayurnya. Dengan begitu I Made Ardana bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih baik dan tentunya dapat merasakan hasil jerih payahnya.
texts.en:
Most of the people in Taman village of Tuwed West Bali are farmers. They mainly farms paddy, beans and veggies. I Made Ardana is also a farmer. However he doesn't have his own land, so he work as a farming labor on someone else farms. He works on a 20 are land. He will then get a part of the proceed from the farm. He is not satisfied with the result that he get so far as his part of the proceed usually goes for the repayment of loan that he took to finance his farming activities. The loan that he took charged a very high interest rate.

Therefore he wants to join the DINARI's 6 month program so he can get cheaper funding to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He really hopes to be able to get a better result this period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide (Membeli bibit, anti hama, pupuk dan biaya pengolahan tanah)

loans.name: I Nengah Wenda

texts.id: I Nengah Wenda adalah seorang petani tulen yang hampir seluruh penghasilannya selama ini di dapat dari hasil bertani. Sejak  menikah laki-laki yang hanya mengenyam bangku sekolah SMP ini langsung terjun menggarap tanah yang di wariskan kepadanya. Berbagai tanaman telah dia coba dan kembangkan dilahanya. Ada yang berhasil dan juga kadang ada yang gagal. Keahlianya dalam bercocok tanam sebenarnya tidak perlu diragukanlagi karena I Nengah Wenda banyak belajar dari pengalaman yang pernah dia terapkan . Begitu juga halnya dalam menanam sayur sayuran dan cabai. Tanam ini sudah sering Dia tanam bahkan hampir setiap musim kemarau dimana sawahnya tak cukup air untuk menanam padi tanaman ini selalu menjadi pilihan sambil menunggu musim hujan turun . nSaat ini I Nengah Wenda bermaksud untuk menanami lahanya dengan tanaman sayur kacang panjang lagi, namun terbentur oleh modal yang dimiliki tak cukup karena sekarang harga barang-barang naik. Untuk itu I Nengah Wenda kembali mengajukan pinjaman ke Dinari dengan sistem pengembalian diakhir perioda dan jangka waktu selama 6 bulan. Pinjaman ini akan di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit kacang, pupuk, obat-obatan dan untuk membayar tenaga kerja yang diajak untuk mengolah tanah maupun memetik hasil panen nanti.    n n
texts.en:
I Nengah Wenda is a very hardworking farmer. He only finished middle school education and farming is the only source of his earnings. He started working on the land inherited to him after he got married. He tried to plant various kinds of crops, some of them were successful, some others are not. I Nengah Wenda developed his farming skills mostly through experience. He started with planting chili and vegetables one summer when his field does not obtain sufficient water for rice. At this time, I Nengah Wenda wishes to plant green beans however, he does not have enough funding to buy the seeds due to the ricing prices. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to DINARI to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and to pay contract laborers to help him plant and harvest.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides

loans.name: Agung Ayu Putu Wirati

texts.id: Situasi ekonomi yang tidak menentu seperti sekarang ini sangat dirasakan oleh Agung Ayu Putu Wirati bersama suaminya, apalagi suaminya hanya bekerja sebagai seorang petani yang mana penghasilannya tidak menentu sehingga terkadang tidak bisa  mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya. Karena desakan kebutuhan hidup yang semakin besar maka Agung Ayu Putu Wirati bersama suaminya berusaha untuk mengembangkan usaha ternak babi yang selama ini sudah mereka jalani sekitar 5 tahun yang lalu. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan, Agung Ayu Putu Wirati bersama suaminya biasanya memelihara 3 sampai 5 ekor tergantung modal yang mereka miliki dengan keuntungan yang mereka dapat antara  Rp. 250.000,- sampai Rp. 300.000,- dan dari hasil tersebut ibu Agung Ayu Putu Wirati menggunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Ibu Agung Ayu Putu Wirati juga mengakui karena keterbatasan modal usaha sehingga terkadang mereka kesulitan dalam membeli pakan apalagi untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dengan kemudahan yang didapat dari DINARI melalui pembinaan dan pinjaman Modal Usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayarannya dilakukan setelah akhir periode pemeliharaan, maka Agung Ayu Putu Wirati yakin bahwa usahanya kedepan bisa dikembangkan dengan baik sehingga ekonomi keluarganya juga bisa meningkat.
texts.en:
Agung Ayu Putu Wirati and her husband is feeling the effect of the current volatile economic situation. Her husband works as a farmer with uncertain income. To gain additional income stream, Agung Putu Wirati and her husband tried to grow their pig farm that they started 5 years ago. In a 5 month cycle, Agung Ayu Putu Wirati usually farms 3 to 5 pigs, and earns about $25-30 profit. She uses the earnings to pay for daily living expenses. Mrs Agung Ayu Putu Wirati feels that limited funding availability is restraining them from purchasing additional feed to grow her business. With DINARI's funding and training assistance, she is applying for $475 6-month loan. Agung Ayu Putu Wirati is certain that she can grow her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Feeds

loans.name: Sayu Kade Sumatri

texts.id: Sayu Kadek Sumatri  ternasuk salah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang bijaksana, selain mengurusi keluarganya Sayu Kadek juga mau membantu suaminya bekerja. Karena suaminya hanya bekerja sebagai seorang petani membuat Sayu Kadek Sumatri memilih untuk beternak babi agar bisa membantu suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Ditambah lagi dengan harus membiayai keperluan sekolah 2 orang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku pendidikan SMP dan SD. Setelah mengetahui tentang program DINARI yang disosialisasikan oleh pembina, maka Sayu Kadek Sumatri memutuskan untuk meminjam modal ke DINARI agar bisa mengembangkan usaha ternak babi yang sudah lama ia tekuni selama ini. Dengan pinjaman awal yang di dapat sebesar Rp.5.000.000,- dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman, Sayu Kadek Sumatri menggunakannya untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan sisanya untuk membeli pakan. Dengan pendampingan  dan pinjaman tersebut Sayu Kadek Sumatri berharap usahanya bisa lebih berkembang sehingga hasil yang didapat juga akan lebih meningkat dari keuntungan yang diperoleh sebelumnya Rp. 250.000.- per ekor setelah dipotong pelunasan pada akhir periode sehingga  mampu meningkatkan ekonomi keluarganya.nn
texts.en:
Sayu kadek Sumatri is a wise housewife. She wants to help her husband to pay all her family's need. Her husband works as a farmer. Sayu Kadek Sumatri chose to start a pig farm to help pay for ever increasing daily living expenses, especially that now she has to pay tuition for her 2 children that is studying in a local middle school and grade school. After learning about DINARI's program, Sayu Kadek Sumatri decided to apply for a loan to grow her pig farm. She is applying for $475 6-month loan. Sayu Kadek Sumatri plans to use the loan to purchase piglets to be fattened and feeds. With funding and training assistance from DINARI, Sayu Kadek Sumatri hopes to expand her business. Currently she projects that she can earn about $250 profit per pig after loan payment.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets to be fattened

loans.name: Ni Ketut Murti

texts.id: Usaha beternak babi ini sudah lama ditekuni oleh Ni Ketut Murti usaha ini dilakukannya untuk membantu suaminya membiayai kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Murti tinggal berdua dengan suaminya karena anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing -masing. Ni Ketut Murti mengaku selama ini  ia sangat berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usahanya, namun hal itu sulit dilakukanya karena modal usahanya yang pas-pasan sementara kebutuhan hidup keluarga yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Dengan kandang yang sederhana Ni Ketut Murti memulai usahanya. Saat ini Ni Ketut Murti memelihara 1 ekor induk babi dan dalam waktu 6 bulan  sudah bisa menjual hasil ternaknya yaitu anak dari induk tersebut dengan sekali beranak bisa 8 sampai 10 ekor. Melalui program DINARI Ni Ketut Murti mendapat  pendampingan serta pinjaman modal usaha  sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjamamn. Dengan tambahan modal tersebut Ni Ketut Murti menggunakan untuk membeli pakan dan satu bibit babi lagi sehingga Ni Ketut Murti berharap usahanya bisa lebih maju dan berkembang sehingga bisa mendapat panghasilan yang lebih meningkat dari hasil sebelumnya dan kehidupan keluarganya bisa lebih baik.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Murti has been farming Pigs for a long time to help her husband pay for daily living expenses. Currently she only lives with her husband as her children have gotten married. Ni Ketut Murti has expressed her willingness to grow the business, however it is difficult due to limited funding and rising cost of living. Ni Ketut Murti started with simple pig pens. Currently she farms 1 breeder pig, and in 6 month, she hopes to sell the piglets. In one breeding cycle, her pig can produce 6-8 piglets. Ni Ketut Murti is seeking training and a 6-month $475 loan from DINARI. Ni Ketut Murti Plans to use the loan to purchase feeds and an additional breeder pig. She hopes that her business will grow to give her higher income in the future for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase breeder pig

loans.name: Ni Made Suartini

texts.id: Kehidupan keluarga Ni Made Suartini sangat sederhana, suaminya yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu terkadang tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari mereka, namun hal ini tidak membuat Ni Made Suartini patah semangat, sebagai seorang istri  ia berusaha untuk membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dengan beternak babi. Saat ini  Ni Made Suartini memelihara 1 ekor babi  penggemukan dengan periode pemeliharaan selama 5 bulan dan keuntungan yan didapat sekitar Rp. 300.000,-. Dalam menjalankan usaha Ni Made Suartini mengaku sangat sulit untuk mengembangkan usahanya karena kekurangan modal untuk membeli pakan dan menambah bibit penggemukan serta pengobatan apabila babinya sakit. Melalui program DINARI, Ni Made Suartini mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan pakan untuk mengembangkan usahanya agar bisa meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya.nNi Made Suartini saat ini sangat senang dan berterimakasih kapada DINARI yang mau memberikan pendampingan serta pinjaman modal usaha  dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6  bulan serta pembayarannya dilakukan di akhir periode pinjaman. n
texts.en:
Ni Made Suartini's family lives a simple life. Her husband works as a seasonal labor at local farming industry. She wants to help the family's economy by raising pigs.

At the moment she is raising a breeding pig for a 5 month period. She is hoping to be able to earn a net profit of IDR 300 thousand (around USD 28) from this. She got the capital from DINARI in the form of working capital loan of IDR 5 million (around USD 475). She is very grateful to DINARI who also provides continuous support such as training and consulting to her.

She will repay the loan to DINARI at the end of her 6 month loan program.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy breeding pig (Membeli anak babi untuk penggemukkan)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kasih

texts.id: Pada pinjaman sebelumnya Ni Ketut Kasih merasakan manfaat dari pinjaman yang diperolehnya dari Dinari. Usaha ternak babinya bisa berjalan dengan baik . Dalam situasi ekonomi yang serba sulit dan harga barang yang semakin meningkat membuat Ni Ketut Kasih harus bisa mengatur keuangannya dengan bijaksana baik untuk keperluan rumah tangga maupun untuk kepentingan usahanya. Rencananya untuk memperbaiki kandangnya belum bisa dilakukannya karena terbatasnya dana yang dimilikinya sedangkan harga pakan untuk ternaknya semakin meningkat. Walaupun demikian Ni Ketut Kasih tetap tekun menjalankan usahanya ini karena tetap ada peluang untuk memperoleh keuntungan yang lebih meskipun tidak terlalu banyak. Kalau sebelumnya keuntungan yang bisa diperolehnya sekitar Rp 100.000 sekarang bisa mencapai Rp 150.000 per ekor untuk pasar babi guling. Saat ini Ni Ketut Kasih mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dengan sistem pelunasan pada akhir periode pinjaman.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Kasih took a loan from DINARI once before and she obtained a real benefit out of it. Her pig farming activities work quite well.

In the middle of economic crisis, she has new challenges as she has to be able to allocate her money wisely. She has to put on hold her plan to build a better hut for her pigs as she allocates the money to increasing prices of pig foods. She is still hoping to get a profit of IDR 150 thousand (around USD 14) from this season.

She is in the DINARI loan program where she can pay the loan at the end of the loan period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig foods (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Tusabe Mukama Group

texts.en:
Resty S. is a 31-year-old married mother with two children, aged 8 and 10. She also cares for her deceased sister's four orphans and her brother's two children. Resty operates a hair salon in her home. Her specialty is applying braid extensions that she buys in bulk quantities each week in Kampala's wholesale markets. All of her business is earned through referrals by existing clients. Resty enrolled in vocational school four years ago to learn her new trade and fulfill her goal of becoming a hairstylist. She began with just a chair in her sitting room; now, thirteen loans later, she has a complete salon attached to her home. Resty uses the proceeds from her loans to purchase braids and other supplies for her shop. Resty services five women on average each week and makes a fixed profit of 10,000 UGX per client. By injecting her earnings back into her business, Resty is on her way to realizing her ambition of building a salon on her village's main street so she can attract more clients, and launching a wholesale hair and beauty distribution business.

Resty was elected chairperson of the Tusabe Mukama lending group because of her leadership skills, business acumen and friendly personality. With a family that includes two children and six orphans, Resty's household depends upon her income to pay for school fees, food and clothing.

loans.use: Purchase braids and other supplies for her shop

loans.name: Ni Made Widani

texts.id: Usaha ternak babi yang dikelola Ni Made Widani terbilang cukup berhasil, karena rencananya untuk mengembangkan usahanya yang semula hanya memelihara penginduk dengan menambah penggemukan bisa dilaksanankan lewat pinjaman yang diperolehnya dari Dinari walaupun belum bisa memberikan hasil maksimal karena biaya operasional usahanya semakin meningkat seiring naiknya harga barang tetapi baginya sudah cukup karena pendapatannya bisa bertambah yang semula Rp 950.000 menjadi Rp 1.200.000.. Namun hal ini tidak mengurangi semangatnya dalam berusaha karena selain usaha ini sudah ditekuni cukup lama juga bisa membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Ni Made Widani saat ini mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dan akan dilunasi pada akhir periode.nn
texts.en:
Ni Made Widani is one of the participant in DINARI loan program. Her pig farming business works quite well even though she is having difficulties with the increasing operating costs recently. However she is still hoping that she can earn a revenue of IDR 1.2 million (around USD 114).

She will repay her loan to DINARI at the end of the loan period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig foods (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Nengah Budiastri

texts.id: Hidup di desa membuat Nengah Budiastri berkeinginan untuk memelihara babi. Supaya bisa membantu menambah penghasilan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh yang pendapatannya pas-pasan.Nengah Budiastri memiliki seorang anak perempuan yang bernama Ni Kadek Yudiantini baru berumur 4 tahun. Kebetulan lewat organisasi yang ada di desanya yang bekerja sama dengan Dinari Nengah Budiastri mengajukan pinjaman ternak. Adapun jangka waktunya 6 bulan dan pembayaran pada akhir periode pinjaman. Nengah Budiastri sangat mengharapkan agar dana yang dibutuhkan bisa cepat direalisasikan.Karena sampai saat ini dana belum diterimanya rencana kalau dananya sudah diterima Nengah Budiastri ingin memelihara 2 babi penggemukan untuk persiapan anaknya kalau sudah bersekolah.
texts.en:
Nengah Budiasrti wants to be in the business of raising pigs. She wants to do it to help her husband who only earns small income. They have a 4 year old daughter named Ni Kadek Yudiantini. Nengah is now participating in a 6 month loan program. She has not received the loan money yet but she is already making plan to use the money to buy 2 breeding pigs. She wants to use the proceed to help her finance her daughter education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig foods (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! 

This is 30-year-old Regina K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 4 children: Peter (10), Noella (7), David (4), and the newest addition, Lilian (1 2/12). Regina has been running her grocery store since May 2008. A typical Tanzania grocery store (genge) is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. She works at the business for 1-4 hours a day, 3 days a week as she is employed as a teacher for the remainder of the week. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase additional inventory. Regina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Antonia L. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with 2 children: Anaslome, who is 10 years old, and Sarah, who is 8 years old. She is also responsible for caring for Silvesta, who is 8 years old, and Raphael, who is 6 years old, whose mother is deceased and their father is unable to care for them.

Antonia has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Antonia works 5-8 hours a day, 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more material in bulk. Antonia thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional material in bulk

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Hawa M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 14. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because their parents had passed away due to HIV/AIDS.

Hawa has been running a kuku (chicken) business since 2007. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing, they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

She works at the business 16+ hours a day, 7 days a week, with the help of her children when they are home from school. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to build a chicken coop so she has more room for more chickens to expand her business. Hawa thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To build a chicken coop

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Hidaya B. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, aged from 13 to 23 years old. Since 2007, Hidaya has been running a shop that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase additional inventory at bulk prices in order to expand her business. She thanks you in advance for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional material in bulk in order to expand her business

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania!

This is 33-year-old Lulu R. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 2 children: Hussein who is 13 years old, and Swalene, who is 11 years old. Lulu has been running a beauty salon since 2004. Hers is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to expand her business. Lulu thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe Group

texts.en: Viola N. is a member of Twekembe women's group in Bulenga and has run a retail shop in her area for 4 years. She is a married woman with children and works with her husband for the upkeep of their family and children's school fees. Since joining her lending group, her loans have helped her so much in transforming her shop in a way that she is now able to make a higher profit compared to before the loans because now she has much to sell in her shop. She still plans to develop it more with this loan, so that she can stock goods that are lacking right now, like eggs, baking flour, and others.

loans.use: To buy sugar, eggs, and baking flour for her shop

loans.name: Nyikira Okole Group

texts.en:
Betty N. is the leader of the Nyikira Okole group in Kikajjo, a village a few kilometers outside of Kampala. She is the 28-year-old married mother of two children, aged 2 and 5. Betty is also the foster mother of her deceased sister's two children.

Betty owns and operates the Seaman Bar, a popular beer tavern 6 kilometers away on the main highway, that features a jukebox that plays traditional African music. She inherited this establishment from her sister when she died three years ago. Betty depends upon the income from her bar to care for the needs of her extended family.

Betty uses the proceeds from her loan to purchase crates of beverages for her bar, and also to buy replacement glasses and chairs for her patrons. Each crate has 25 bottles and costs 35,000 UGX. On a typical day, Betty sells 8 crates and earns a profit of 20%. Since starting in this business, Betty can afford better food and clothing for her family, and she recently bought a plot of land. With the future savings from her business, Betty hopes to build her own home. One day, she would like to sell the bar and begin a wholesale beverage distribution business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, chairs and glasses for her bar

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. is married and has 3 dependants. She has received no formal education. Grace sells yams to local consumers at Praso market in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband works at the press. Grace uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and other utility bills. Grace will use the loan to purchase more yams for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to increase her capital base to enable her increase the quantity of yams she sells.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to purchase more yams for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy, tiene 32 años, está casada  y tiene 2 hijos, todos van a la escuela que queda cerca de su domicilio, ella es fabricante y vendedora de chipas en forma ambulante y su pequeña fábrica lo tiene en su mismo domicilio que con la ayuda de sus hijos y su marido realizan la producción de la chipas. nComenta Nancy, que gracias a éste trabajo ella y su marido pudieron hacerse de una casa propia con todas las comodidades mínimas, con sus ganancias diarias le permite cubrir los gastos de la familia, como ser la comida, los pagos de los servicios, agua, luz, y la educación escolar de sus hijos. nCon los préstamos que solicita hoy a la Fundación Paraguaya desea comprar buena cantidad de materia prima como ser, almidón, aceite, quesos entre otros productos, lo que le permitirá  obtener un precio mucho menor que lo de costumbre por sus compras en cantidades grandes.n
texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old, is married and has 2 children. All of her children go to the school that is near their house. Nancy is a street vendor. She makes and sells "chipas" (cheese or corn breads made of yucca). She makes the chipas in her house with the help of her children and her husband. Nancy says that thanks to this work she and her husband could afford their own home with all the basic necessities. With her daily profits, she can cover the expenses of her family, such as food, utility bills and schooling for her children. With this loan she is requesting from Fundacion Paraguaya she hopes to buy a large quantity of raw materials, such as starch, oil, cheese, among other products. This loan will allow her to purchase these goods in large quantities, and therefore obtain a lower price.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy starch, oil and cheese for bread business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase starch, vegetable oil, wood and other ingredients.

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.es: El señor Patrocinio 46 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su taller está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia al costado de la ruta 2 en km. 66 de la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala, se inició en el oficio estudiando en un instituto en la ciudad de Capiatá y posteriormente en forma práctica con su padre y un tío quiénes tenían un taller mecánico en la ciudad de Caacupé allí trabajó durante 10 años dónde adquirió la experiencia necesaria como para sentirse  seguro dentro de lo que es su oficio.nActualmente Patrocinio ya cuenta con su propio taller en su domicilio, con los equipos más modernos, que lo fue adquiriendo gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, el inicio fue difícil porque los clientes tenían que conocer su trabajo, pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus propios clientes, vecinos, amigos, hoy día ya cuenta con una clientela formada, su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber asumido riesgos y lograr la independencia laboral.n
texts.en:
Mr. Patrocinio is 46 years old, married and has 2 sons. His auto shop is located in a zone where competition is fierce: at the 66th kilometer mark on route 2, in the city of Eusebio Ayala. He began his career by taking classes at the town's trade institute and later by working hands-on with his father at the shop they owned in the city of Caacupé. For ten years he worked there, and he only left when he felt he had obtained the experience necessary to do his job comfortably. Currently, Mr. Patrocionio owns a home-based auto shop that is equipped with modern tools, which were purchased with loans he received from Fundacion Paraguaya. It was hard in the beginning because customers wanted to become familiar with the quality of his work, but thanks to clients', neighbors' and friends' recommendations, now he has a solid clientele. He says that his main accomplishment has been taking risks to achieve his professional independence.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lubricants, parts and other accessories.

loans.name: Nyikira Kikajjo Group

texts.en: Halima N. is a proud member of the Nyikira group and has a tailoring business in Namasuba. She has been in this business for five years now, making ladies' and children's clothes of all kinds for a fee. She buys the materials and people come in to book, buy so that their orders are made to their satisfaction. She needs a loan to help her buy more clothing materials, threads and scissors for her business, since the profits she gets help her to repay back her loans as well as to cater for her four children plus pay their school fees. She has a dream of one day owning more sewing machines to expand her business, as well as starting a tailoring school.

loans.use: Halima Nakawooya will buy clothing materials, threads and scissors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand the covered area in his auto shop.

loans.name: Toffa

texts.en: Toffa N. is a member of Tusabe mukama women's group in Kamwokya. He is 29 years old and owns a retail shop in Kamwokya. Toffa is not married and has no kids but cares for his siblings and parents back in his village of Bushenyi in Western Uganda. He joined his lending group two years ago with a purpose of transforming his shop and he has been able to stock it with more goods like sugar, maize flour and wheat flour which he now buys in bulk. He was unable to do this before because he did not have enough capital to make it possible. Toffa needs a loan to be able to restock his retail shop so as to realize his dream of building his own house in the plot of land he bought recently as well as continue looking after his parents.

loans.use: Toffa needs a loan to buy more sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour to sell so he can care for his parents and siblings.

loans.name: Nazigo Group

texts.en: Zaidi S., 35, is our client at Pearl Microfinance. He has had a business for the past 10 years of buying mukeneu, a small silvery fish, and dried fish from the fishermen at his neighboring landing sites in Nazigo. He is married with 5 children, who are still in school, and he takes care of 1 orphan. He is so proud of the trend that his business is taking after he joined his lending group, whereby he now buys good quality fish in greater numbers compared to before the loans. He is seeking a loan to be able to buy more fish so that he will be able to sell more for greater profits.

loans.use: He will buy more fish with the loan.

loans.name: Andreya

texts.en:
Andreya has one child. She lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine and sells different retail items in the local market. Her assortment is very diversified: household chemicals, beauty items, toys and different small necessities. Andreya is very cheerful and friendly. Her first goal is to please her customers, which has added a lot to the success of her business.

Andreya has been an entrepreneur for 2 years. Loans she has received and repaid from Nadiya Ukraine have also had a big part in the growth of her business. Presently, she has about 10,000 Grivnas in inventory. Monthly net profit is about 2,000 Grivnas. Today Andreya is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase assorted inventory. This financial assistance will help her increase her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it help Andreya get the necessary inventory and attract more customers, but it will help her meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

loans.use: Increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Nazigo Group2

texts.en: M. Emma, S. Yahaya, and S. Livingistone are all members of Nazigo Group in Kayunga and they would like each to boost their own business. Emma is a butcher and he would like to buy more goats for meat. Yahaya is a fish seller and he would like to buy more fish for sale, while Livingstone is a newspaper vendor and he would like to buy more newspapers for sale. They are all new in their lending group having been introduced to it by a friend.

loans.use: Emma will buy goats for meat, Yahaya will buy fish and Livingstone will buy newspapers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: K. Moses is a member of Kiwamirembe Group in Kigombya. He has owned and operated a general store for 4 years. He is a married man with two children of whom one is in school.  He plans to see his children have the best education possible through his efforts.  When he started getting loans, life was difficult for him with almost nothing to sell in his shop but now things are better because he is able to care for his family and parents, who live nearby in the village. He was able to buy a plot of land recently and now plans to buy a large piece of land to start a farming business. Moses needs a loan to buy more goods for his shop.

loans.use: Buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: n           La Sta.  Graciela  vive en la compañía  Tayy Loma de Carapeguá tiene  35  años  y  es  madre soltera  de  dos niños  uno  de 6  y otro  de 3  años  y vive hace 6 años en pareja  con el  Sr.  Nelson. nntSe trata de una persona  muy emprendedora , teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos a cuotas, su  zona  de trabajo es la  localidad  de Capitán Bado ciudad distante a unos 500 km. de su ciudad natal , su  colocación y recuperación  lo realiza  una vez al  mes . Su pareja se dedica a la construcción de  obras (albañilería) y juntos llevan adelante   su familia.nntSolicita el préstamo para la compra de  hilos de distintos colores para tejer variados diseños.nnnnnnnnnnn
texts.en:
Ms. Graciela lives in the Tayy Loma region of Carapeguà. She is a 35-year-old single mother of two children ages 6 and 3. Her domestic partner is Mr. Nelson. She is a very enterprising person who knits blankets and handmade table cloths. She sells them in installments. Her work area is the locality of Capitan Bado, a city that is 500 km away from her hometown. She distributes her merchandise and collects payments once a month. Her partner works in construction (bricklaying), and together they help their family move forward. She is reqesting a loan in order to purchase assorted colors of thread so that she can knit several different designs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase knitting materials

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 35 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos y vive en la compañía Beni Loma de la ciudad de Carapeguá.nntDesde temprana edad empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar las colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, hoy en día ella misma elabora y  lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias al  ingreso que  le  genera esta actividad logró construir una modesta casa y brindar  comodidad a sus  hijos.  tnnSolicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles  y sábanas.n            nn
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a 35-year-old married mother of 3 children. She lives in the Beni Loma region of the city of Carapeguà. At a young age, she started to help her mother—who taught her this craft—create handmade bedspreads. Today, she makes and sells those products, with the help of her husband, in the capital zone of the country. Thanks to the money generated by this business, she managed to build a modest house and give comfort to her children. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise such as bedspreads, blankets, table cloths, and bed sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads, blankets, table cloths, and bed sheets

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: El Sr. Dario tiene 37 años de edad vive en concubinato con  la Sra. Amelia Dure, tienen 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar.nnHace mas 10 años que trabaja en la curtiembre, desde joven  hacia trabajos de curtiduría como  personal y  recibía una remuneración  en  forma semanal, mas adelante  gracias a su sacrificio y buena ideología pudo reunir  una capital e iniciar esta actividad  pero  ya como propietario alquilando un predio ajeno.nnEl Sr. Dario manifiesta que su sueño es adquirir un terreno  propio para  instalarse en  forma definitiva con  todas sus  maquinarias, para  trabajar junto con su hijo.nSolicita  un préstamo d para  compra de cueros. n
texts.en:
Dario, 37, lives with his partner, Amelia Dure; they have 3 school-aged children. He's worked at the tannery for more than 10 years. He started working as a tanner when he was young, an employee with a weekly wage. Later, thanks to his sacrifice and sense of purpose, he was able to pull together enough money to start his own tannery business but he has to lease land from someone else to operate it. Dario says that his dream is to buy property of his own and set up a proper operation with all of his tools and equipment where he can work with his son. He's applying for a loan to buy hides for making leather.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hides for making leather.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es: nLa Sra Nilsa tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Calixtro es divorciada  con dos hijos, uno es mayor de edad que actualmente esta trabajando con ella, y la otra está en edad escolar.nnSu actividad principal es la venta de leche, ella comenta que es un trabajo que realizaba desde pequeña ya que siempre  le gusto la ganadería  actividad  a la que dedicaban  sus padres, al fallecer su  padre  ella quedó encargada de llevar adelante  esta  actividad que  es la que  le genera  el ingreso  necesario para   hacer estudiar a sus  hijos ya  que  es la responsable de su  educación  y  formación.n.nSolicita un préstamo para compra de una vaquilla.nnnnntnt n
texts.en:
Nilsa is 52 years old, divorced, and lives in Calixtro with her two children: an adult son who currently works with her and a school-aged daughter. Nilsa's main activity is the sale of milk. She has been doing this since she was a young girl. She has always enjoyed raising cattle, which is what her parents did for a living. When her father died, Nilsa was entrusted with the business which has been her main source of income, allowing her to pay for her children's education and training. Nilsa will use the loan to buy a young cow.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos es de la Localidad  de Quindy, tiene 25 años  de edad,  es soltero y  propietario de  un  local  comercial  que  se dedica a la venta  de ropas  y  zapatos. Es un  joven  muy emprendedor y  sacrificado ya que a  su corta  edad  ya  toma  con  mucha  seriedad  su labor. Tiene  varias aspiraciones en la vida  entre  ella  esta  la de llegar a  ser un  profesional. nnSe  encuentra  estudiando en  una  Universidad  local la  carrera de administración.nnSolicita  el préstamo  para  compra  de  ropas   .nnnn
texts.en:
Originally from Quindy, Marcos is 25 years old, single, and owns a store where he sells clothing and shoes. He is a very enterprising and hard-working young man who at his young age takes his work very seriously. He has several goals in life, one of which is to become a professional. He is studying Administration in a local university. He is asking for this loan in order to buy clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Bushra Parveen Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is the wife of Abdullah K. and lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. Bushra baji completed her education till 5th standard. She couldn't continue her education due to her father's low income. Bushra baji is a mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has an engine oil selling business. The next to him has a fruit selling business. The younger to him is in 7th standard. Her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her elder daughter is in 5th standard and her younger daughter is in 3rd standard. Bushra baji's husband is a milk seller and has been selling milk for the past 10 years. Bushra baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Bushra baji has a dream of giving her children a good education. The reason behind this dream is that she wanted to get higher education herself but due to her father's low income, she couldn't fulfill her wish. Now she has the opportunity to fulfill her dream through her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her son so that he is able to expand his business and earns good profits.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy marbles for her marble selling business. Kaneez baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy more shoes for their shoe selling businesses. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Ghafooran M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran baji is the wife of M. and lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son completed his education till 5th standard and started a business of selling woods. Her younger is a daily wage laborer. Ghafooran baji's husband has a bangle selling business. He has been selling bangles for the past 2 years.

Ghafooran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more bangles for her husband's bangles selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes and tools) for her sanitary business. Azra baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils for her utensils selling business. Samreen baji wants a loan to buy CDs for her CD shop. Jameela baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more bangles to resell

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: A 49-year-old woman, Hamda lives with her husband and children in Jib Jenin in the Bekaa valley. Hamda began her small business by producing and selling homemade food supplies from her house to local residents. Following a growing demand of her products, she opened her own grocery store in 2004 and added a bigger array of products, such as spices and bottled food supplies. She requests a loan of $1,000 to buy supplies from which she would be able to produce her goods.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es: Doña Norma tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, que estudian la primaria, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación, su esposo trabaja como conductor de una ruta en la ciudad de Managua, lo cual sale desde horas muy temprano a su trabajo, la Sra. Norma se levanta desde horas muy temprano para mandar a su esposo desayunado, ya que su trabajo es agotador y riesgoso. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos en su casa, inicio con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior que tenia en la zona franca las Mercedes, lo cual lo invirtió en ropa para iniciar una etapa nueva en las ventas ya tiene dos años y logrado mantener su negocio. Con la solicitud de crédito es para comprar más inventario de ropa para damas y caballeros como ropa de niños, ya que tiene muchos encargos a la fecha y espera obtener buenas ganancias para poder ahorrar y comprar un terreno  propio ya que habita en la casa del suegro. A largo plazo es poder construir su casa digna para su familia y crecer con su negocio para poder seguir adquiriendo otro préstamo para hacer crecer su inventario y lograr sus objetivos.nn
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and has two children, 8 and 10 years old who attend elementary school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of the capital, Managua. Her husband drives a route in the city of Managua, and must leave home very early to get to work. In order to make breakfast for her husband whose work is exhausting and dangerous, Norma also gets up very early. Norma's business is the sale of clothes and shoes from her home. She started this business two years ago with a settlement from a previous job in the duty-free zone "las Mercedes": she invested the money in clothing to begin a new stage in sales and her business has been successful. The loan will be used to increase her inventory of ladies', men's and children's clothing as she has many orders to fill and hopes to make enough money to be able to save and buy her own land as she lives with her father-in-law. Her long-term goal is to build her own home worthy of her family and increase her business in order to request future loans to increase her inventory and reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy adult and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Yaritza Yurie

texts.es: La Sra. Yaritza tiene 26 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene dos hermosos hijos que cursan la primaria, su esposo es albañil a veces trabaja por contrato y otras independiente es un trabajo bien cansado pero se gana bien, muy temprano se levanta doña Yaritza para mandar a su esposo desayunado a parte que le aliña el almuerzo ya que la comida esta muy cara en los comedores. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace siete años lo cual comenzó con dinero propio de una liquidación de su trabajo que trabajaba como obrera y con ayuda también de su esposo, con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en inventario en compra de productos variados como granos básicos, golosinas, productos de limpieza para ofertar a su clientela pues los préstamo que ha hecho ha podido hacer mas grande su negocio gracias a la confianza y esfuerzo con AFODENIC ya que con este crédito es décimo y espero seguir trabajando para prosperar mas en la pulpería y así poder a ayudar a mis hijos con los gastos del colegio.
texts.en:
Yaritza is 26 years old, lives in Laureles Sur, a neighbourhood of the capital Managua, and has two beautiful children who attend elementary school. Her husband is a bricklayer who works at times on contract and at other times as an independent. It is tiring work, but pays well. Yaritza wakes up early in order to make her husband breakfast and lunch as restaurant food is very expensive. She owns a grocery store, which she opened seven years ago with monies from a settlement from her previous work as a labourer, as well as with her husband's help. She will use this loan to increase her inventory with a variety of products, such as staples, candies, and cleaning products to offer to her clients. She has used previous loans to increase her business. She is thankful for the trust and help AFODENIC have given her as this is her tenth loan. She hopes to continue working so that her grocery business may flourish and therefore be able to help her children with the cost of high school tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staples and candies

loans.name: Socorro Del Rosario
