texts.es: Doña Socorro es una mujer de 39 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene tres hijos d 3,9 y 20 años los tres estudian el mayor esta en la universidad publica, su esposo trabaja en las ruta urbana de la Managua en la ruta 167, desde horas muy temprana salen los dos a trabajar,  ya que ella también vende en un mercado de la capital que se llama Mercado Oriental y tiene que tomar la ruta temprano para aprovechar a los clientes desde la horas de la mañana que se vende bastante su negocio es la esencia aromáticas y otros productos de variedad, en un local ya que es herencia de su mama que le dejo ya que ella vende desde los once años, comenzó vendiendo agua para ayudar a su mama y hasta la fecha ha superado y mantenido el tramo, con la solicitud quiere invertir en comprar productos de esencia y otros para captar mas clientes y generar mayores utilidades, a futuro es ampliar el tramo y vender otros productos, y poder dar estudios a sus hijos.nn
texts.en:
Doña Socorro is 39 year-old woman who lives in the neighborhood called Laureles Sur. She has three children, who are three, nine, and twenty years old. All three of them study and the oldest one is in the public university. Her husband works on the city roads of Managua on Route 167. In the early hours of the morning, they both leave to work since they also do sales in the market of the capital, called Mercado Oriental; she has to work early to take advantage of the clients available in the morning. Her business mostly sells aromatic essences and other products of variety in a stand that she inherited from her mother. She was left the stand because since age eleven she has been doing sales. At that young age, she began selling water to help her mother and to this day has bettered her self. With the requested loan, she wants to invest in purchasing essence products and other products to attract more clients and generate greater profits. In the future she aims to increase her business and sell other products and be able to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aromatic essences and other products

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Fatima tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un niño de 5 años, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, es madre soltera y trabaja en control y calidad desde hace nueve años consiguió esa plaza por que su currículo lo tenia la empresa y espero la plaza. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la reparación del techo y cambiar una puerta que esta en mal estado, para tener mejor seguridad con su familia, a futuro es poder casarse para que su esposo la apoye con los gastos a si como ganar mas en su trabajo para ahorrar y seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa.nn
texts.en:
Fatima is 28 years old and she has a 5-year old son. She lives in a region in the capital city of Managua called Ilama Laureles Norte. She is a single mother and she has been working in quality control for the past 9 years. She got this position because her family had the businessa and she waited for the position. With the loan she is requesting she will use the funds to repair the infrastructure of her house, especially the roof and she needs to change a door that is in poor shape, to provide her family with better safety and security. In the future she hopes to get married and she dreams of having her husband help her with the expenses. She hopes to save more money from her work to keep making improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the roof and buy a new door.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene 57 años de edad, con dos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, uno de ello estudia y el otro trabaja en el país de Costa Rica, debido a que  aquí se le hizo difícil hallar trabajo, y le manda remesa gracias a eso he podido ayudarme mucho, ella trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos, y alquila un cuarto lo cual le genera ingresos. Con la solicitud de crédito es para infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para alquilarlo y poder tener mas clientes como mas ingresos, a futuro es poder acondicionar los cuartos al gusto y necesidad del cliente, poder tener salud para apoyar a sus hijos  ya que desea que su hijo regrese pronto ya que se le hace difícil no tenerlo junto a ella oh cerca.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Sur of the capital, Managua. She is 57 years old with two children who are 20 and 25 years old. One of them studies and the other works in Costa Rica because it's difficult to encounter work here. He sends her money and has been able to help her a lot. She works in a house in domestic services, and she also rents a room which generates an income for her. The requested loan is for construction of a room to rent in order to have more tenants for more income. In the future, she aims to furnish the rooms to the tastes and needs of her client. She wants to be able to support her children because she really wants her son to return home soon since it's hard for her to not have him with her or at least near to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La Sra. Maria habita en un barrio que se llama Batahola Norte, tiene 53 años de edad, con una hija de 15 años de edad y tres hijos varones que ya trabajan y le ayudan, es madre soltera y ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, vende golosinas y helados, inicio vendiendo ropa, pero decidió vender golosinas ya que se consume bastante por los estudiantes y le genera mas ingresos. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de cerámica para ponerle a un porche que tiene es de tierra y desea tener mas comodidad con su familia. A futuro es tener un cafetín de comidas rápidas para no enfocarse en un solo producto.nn
texts.en:
Maria lives in a neighborhood called Batahola Norte. She is 53 years old with one daughter, who is fifteen, and three sons who are already working and helping her. She is a single mother and has succeeded in improving the lives of her children. She sells candies and ice creams. She started out selling clothes but decided to sell candies since the students eat a rather lot of these and it generates a better income for her. The requested loan is for purchasing ceramic to apply to her porch, which is currently made of dirt and she wants to give her family more comfort. In the future she wants to have a small cafe of fast foods so she's not focused on just one product.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ceramic to put on her porch

loans.name: Santos Tomas

texts.es: nLa Sr. Santo tiene 47 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah II, su esposa es ama de casa y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad, , el negocio de don Santos es la venta de productos de ambientadores y venenos para insectos, inicio estas ventas con dinero propio de una liquidación anterior de trabajo en donde vendía solo productos de limpiezas. Con la solicitud de crédito es para comprar más productos de limpiezas para ofertar a sus clientes  lo cual espera obtener mejores ganancias y captación de clientes. A largo plazo es captar otros mercados y llegar a nuevos segmentos con productos de calidad y de bajos precios, a si como hacer mejoras en su casa.n
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old. He lives in a neighborhood of the capital of Managua, which is called Hialeah II. His wife is the stay-at-home mother and they have two children, who are ages two and three years old. The business of Santos is selling air freshener and insect poison products. He began these sales with his own money through a liquidation of a previous job in which he sold cleaning products. The requested loan is to buy more cleaning products to offer his clients in hopes of obtaining better earnings and attracting more clients. In the long run he hopes to take up more markets and work in new areas offering products of quality and low prices, and in this way eventually make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cleaning products

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 20 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, es madre soltera de una bebe de 18 meses, le ha tocado dejarla con su mama que se la cuide ya que esta trabajando en una agencia de pollo Tip Top despachando comida rápida, es un trabajo duro ya que desde hora temprana sale de su casa para tomar una ruta que le lleve a su trabajo, empezó a trabajar desde hace quince meses ya que su marido falleció en un accidente, y tenia que buscar una alternativa para sastifacer sus necesidades como su bebe. Con la solicitud de dinero la quiere para invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para vivir aparte con su hijita ya que habita en la casa de su mama. A largo plazo es poder tener otro trabajo que le genere más ingresos y poder ahorrar para poder hacer su casa ya que es el sueño de toda mujer, poder tener salud para ver a su niña
texts.en:
Maria is twenty years old. She lives in a neighborhood of the capital, Managua, which is called Memorial Sandino. She is the single mother of an eighteen-month old baby, who she leaves with her mother to care for her little daughter while she is working in a chicken agency, Tip Top, serving fast food. It is a hard job since she leaves at an early hour from her home to get to work. She began working here fifteen months ago since her husband died in an accident and she has to find an alternative way to satisfy the needs of her baby. With the requested loan she wants to invest the money in constructing a room to live separately with her daughter since she currently lives in the house of her mother. In the long run, she wants to have another job that will give her a better income and be able to save money to make her home since that is the dream of every woman and to see her daughter with good health.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: nEn la ciudad de Quiindy, en la Compañía Comandante P. distante a 18km de la Oficina de Carapeguá, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa, buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.nEstas personas crecieron gracias a este programa. Necesitan esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivas microempresas y lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.nLas actividades que realizan estas señoras son:n1-tRAMONA V.: VENDEDORA   n2-tMA-SIXTA R. DIAZ: VNTA DE CHIPAn3-tNANCY BARRIOS: VNTA DE BEBIDASn4-tESTELVINA R. DIAZ: VNTA DE VERDURAS n5-tERMELINDA R. DIAZ: ALMACENn6-tOLGA C.: VNTA DE BEBIDASn7-tCLARA C.:VTA DE PRODUCTO AVON n8-tPETRONA P.: VNTA. DE REMEDIOS YUYOS n9-tMA-ELIA CABELO: VNTA DE FRUTASn10-tMIRIAN L.: VENDEDORAn11-tNORMA B.: VNTA DE REMEDIOS YUYOSn12-tDELICIA G.: CANTINA EN ESCUELAn13-tCARMEN G.: VNTA DE QUESO Y HUEVOn14-tMA-LOURDES C.: VNTA DE VERDURASn15-tESTER P.: COPETINn16-tJULIA M.: VENDEDORA AMBULANTE.n17-tVIDALIA C.: COSTURA DE PELOTASn18-tVIDALIA R. DIAZ: COSTURA DE PELOTASn19-tLUCIANA F.: ALMACENnNo estan en la fotonVidalia R. DiaznLuciana Fleitasn
texts.en:
In the city of Quiindy, in the Compañía Comandante P. 18 kilometers from the Oficina de Carapeguá, a few women of scarce resources found out about the committee of Mujeres Emprendedoras, "Enterprising Women," and decided to join together to get more information about this program, searching for more support to boost their family incomes by way of credit and improve their quality of life. These people grew thanks to this program. They need this credit operation to invest in each of their micro-businesses and achieve a sustainable growth that lets them grow as a group and as individuals. The activities that these women do are: Ramona V.: vendor Sixta R. Diaz: chips sales Nancy Barrios: drink sales Estelvina R. Diaz: vegetable sales Ermelinda R. Diaz: grocer Olga C.: drink sales Clara C.: Avon product sales Petrona P.: herbal remedy sales Elia Cabelo: fruit sales Mirian L.: vendor Norma B.: herbal remedy sales Delicia G.: school snack bar Carmen G.: cheese and eggs sales Lourdes C.: vegetable sales Ester P.: drinks and appetizer sales Julia M.: peddler Vidalia C.: balls seamstress Vidalia R. Diaz (not in photo): balls seamstress Luciana F. (not in photo): grocer

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads, hammocks, table cloths, threads

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es: nEn la ciudad de Carapeguá, en la Compañía Cerrito distante a 13km de la Oficina de Carapeguá, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. Buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida, decidieron formar un comité. nEstas personas crecieron gracias a este programa. Necesitan esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivas microempresas y lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.nLas señoras que forman este comité son todas tejedoras artesanas. La ciudad de Carapeguá es la cuna de los tejidos artesanales de nuestro país. Entre los tejidos más populares que realizan estas mujeres están las mundialmente conocidas hamacas paraguayas. Todos sus tejidos, inclusive el hilo que utilizan, son hechos totalmente a mano. En esta ciudad el 90 % de la población se dedica a esta actividad y venden sus productos a otras ciudades e incluso lo exportan. nEstas señoras han logrado vender en grandes cantidades sus productos, tienen una gran cartera de clientes que semana a semana les solicita variedades de los productos que ellas tejen. Es por eso, que para abastecer su gran demanda, ellas solicitan un crédito que lo invertirán en la compra de hamacas, colchas, manteles, entre otros ya hechos de otras artesanas, además de comprar materiales como hilos de algodón para seguir tejiendo a la par.n
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the Cerrito Company 13 kilometers from the Carapeguá Office, a few women of scarce resources found out about the committee program of Mujeres Emprendedoras, "Enterprising Women," and decided to join together to get more information about this program. Searching for a little more support to boost their family incomes by way of credit and improve their quality of life, they decided to form a committee. Their numbers grew thanks to this program. They need this credit transaction to invest in their respective micro-businesses and achieve a sustainable growth that makes them grow as a group and as individuals. The women that form this committee are all artisan weavers. The city of Carapeguá is the birthplace of the artisan weaves of our country. Among the most popular weaves that these women make are the Paraguay hammocks known worldwide. All their weaves, including the thread that they use, are made totally by hand. In this city, ninety percent of the population is dedicated to this activity and sells these products to other cities and exports them. These women have come to sell their products in great quantities and they have a large portfolio of clients, who week to week request various varieties of the products they weave. This is why, to meet the great demand, they are requesting a loan that they will invest in purchasing hammocks, bed spreads, table cloths, and other things made by other artisans, as well as purchasing materials like cotton yarn to continue weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bed spreads, table cloths, blankets, hammocks, cotton yarn, ponchos, etc.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: El Sr. Emilio Rodríguez tiene 28 años e inicio su negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios hace aproximadamente 3 años, siendo empleado de su actual empresa. Empezó siendo secretario del negocio, y ante la indisposición del propietario de seguir atendiendo el local por falta de tiempo ya que contaba con otros locales, ofreció al Sr. Emilio venderle a cuota y éste acepto ya que vio una buena posibilidad de negocio. nHace un año que el Sr. Emilio es propietario del negocio, desde entonces gracias a su trabajo fue creciendo económica y comercialmente. Vio una oportunidad para trabajar con nosotros y hoy día solicita un  crédito para la compra de mercaderías ya que se quiere preparar para el gran movimiento comercial que se viene de aquí a fin de año.n
texts.en:
Emilio R., 28, started his business selling cell phones and accessories about 3 years ago, a then employee of the business he now owns. He began as an assistant in the business and when the owner decided to focus on others of his businesses, he offered to sell this one, on installments, to Emilio who accepted what he saw as a good business opportunity. Emilio has now owned the business for a year and, thanks to his hard work, it has grown economically and commercially. He saw a chance to work with us and is applying for a loan to buy merchandise because he wants to prepare for the rush of sales that will come at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra.  Felicia Vázquez tiene 37 años y esta casada con el Sr. Jorge García de 41 años que trabaja como chofer  en una empresa de transporte de cargas internacionales. Tienen un hijo de 6 años que inicio sus estudios primarios este año.nLa Sra. Felicia Vázquez se dedica a la confección de prendas de ao poí, un tejido típico del Paraguay hecho totalmente a mano, desde hace 10 años, pero en forma independiente lo hace desde  hace 4 años , ya que anteriormente trabajaba para la prestigiosa empresa de confección de Cecilia Fadul.nLa misma desea  invertir el préstamo solicitado en la compra de telas por fardo para la confección de distintos tipos de  prendas de ao poí y de esa manera abaratar los costos de las mismasny tener mayores ganancias por las prendas que confecciona.n
texts.en:
Felicia V. is 37 years old and she is married to Mr. Jorge Garceda, aged 41 years old, and he works as a driver for an international transport company. They have a son aged 6 years and she started primary school this year. Felicia V.'s occupation is the sales of dresses, handmade in Paraguay. She has been running this business for the last 10 years, but she has been doing this in an independent basis for the past 4 years. Previously she worked in a prestigious company called Cecilia Fadul. She wishes to invest the funds of this loan in the purchase of fabrics in large lots and of different types to cut the overhead costs and improve her earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Lutengo Development Group

texts.en:
Karid S. is a client of Pearl Microfinance and a proud member of the Lutengo Group in Lugazi. He is married with 4 children and has a motorcycle "boda boda" business that he has owned for 5 years.

He joined his lending group with a bid to develop his business and so far, he was able to buy a new "boda boda" to replace the old one that he had.

His family life has changed with the increased profits and now his children go to school with some ease as regards school fees. Karid needs a loan to be able to buy another "boda boda" to be given out for hire so as to bring in more income every day.

loans.use: buy another "boda boda" to hire out

loans.name: Inca Sevillanos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “INCA SEVILLANOS”, se fundo en septiembre del 2005, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo de la segunda etapa, esta conformada por  12 socias, 8 mujeres y 4 hombres del distrito de Accha.nEl distrito de Accha de la provincia de Paruro, Dpto de Cusco, se encuentra aproximadamente a 3 horas  de la ciudad del Cusco.nLas socias son mujeres campesinas dedicadas a labores agrícolas principalmente (cultivos de maíz, papa y habas, crianza de vacunos y ovinos), la mayoría de las socias combinan las actividades agrícolas, con las comerciales (venta de productos agrícolas) realizando las transacciones en la feria local del pueblo, en los centros poblados y comunidades aledañas como comerciantes acopiadoras y vendedoras.nLa oportunidad de acceder a servicios de crédito y ahorro es muy valorada, porque les permite generar ingresos, con el que,  contribuyen al presupuesto familiar. En la misma medida valoran las actividades de capacitación, que  se orientan a mejorar las relaciones familiares, con esposos e hijos.n
texts.en:
The "Inca Sevillanos" community bank was founded in September 2005 and is currently in its third loan cycle. It is made up of 12 members — eight women, four men — from Accha, Peru, about three hours from the city of Cusco. The female members are hard-working country women dedicate primarily to farming (cultivating corn, potatoes and beans) and raising livestock (cattle, sheep). The majority of them combine their agricultural activities with commerce, selling their products at the local market, in population centers and villages. The opportunity to access credit and savings is very valuable for them because it helps them generate income, which they put toward the family budget. They also value the training activities designed to improve familial relations with their husbands and children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell their agricultural products — potatoes, corn, small animals (guinea pigs, pigs, hens) — on a small scale at the different local markets.

loans.name: Munafan Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed M. M. and Mohamed K.. They named their group Munafan. Their previous loans with Kiva through SMT were a great help to these entrepreneurs. Those loans enabled them to expand their businesses. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

Mohamed is the leader of this group. He was born in Farandugu village, about 15 miles from Kabala. He is 37 years of age. Mohamed is married with 4 children. His wife does some petty-trading. Mohamed has been in business for over 8 years now. He sells a number of assorted goods in his shop located at his village of Farandugu. The items he sells include cigarettes, batteries, mints, toothpastes and tooth brushes, soaps and a lot more.

Mohamed often makes a lot of sales in his village.  However, these days, sales are a bit difficult because of the current rainy season. The rainy season is coming to an end in October, so he expects to good sales to come again soon. Thus, the loan comes at the right time for Mohamed. With improved sales, he will make more profit.  Furthermore, with increased profit, Mohamed can meet the priorities of educating his children and improving the overall living condition of his family.

loans.use: Buy more packs of cigarettes, batteries, mints and other goods to sell

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Xuân năm nay 48 tuổi.Gia đình chị có ba con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2000 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị Xuân còn đầu tư mua thêm máy cày  để phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và làm máy cày gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua dầu chạy máy cày và đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan Thi D. is a 48 year old woman. She has 3 children who have grown up. In 2000, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in livestock. Her husband is still working and contributing to the family’s income. Besides, the family also have a plough driving business, which also brings in some money, stabilizing the family’s finance. She plans to make the next loan of 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy oil for the plough and invest more in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and business

loans.name: Lanh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lành năm nay 35 tuổi. Năm 1998 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Ngoài chăn nuôi chị còn làm thêm nghề chài lưới vì thế thu nhập của chị luôn đạt mức 2.500.000đ/ tháng.Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị rất nghèo đến nay qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị  đã sắm sữa được thêm tiện nghi trong gia đình và mua được xe máy  phục vụ đi lại kinh tế ngày càng ổn định hơn.nVòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ  để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và chăn nuôi.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Lanh Thi N. is a 35 year old woman. In 1998, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in livestock. Besides, she also did fishing. Therefore, the family’s income level reached 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Before joining the TYM fund, her family was very poor. Since 1998, her family’s financial situation has been improved. She was able to afford more living facilities and bought a motorcycle, now used as the family’s main transportation mean. She plans to make the next loan of 12,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the farm

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuân năm nay 48 tuổi. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Chị Xuân tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 1998 và vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ việc vận chuyển hàng bằng xe công nông. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/  cuộc sống của gia đình chị Xuân đã ngày càng được cải thiện.nVòng vốn tới chị Xuân xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và mua xe công nông nhằm phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan Thi N. is a 48 year old woman. She is living with her husband and 2 children in Hung N., Nghe An. Mrs. N. joined the TYM fund in 1998 and borrowed money to invest in livestock. Now, besides livestock, her family has the income from transporting goods by “cong nong”, a transportation means commonly used in Vietnamese countryside. The income level of 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month helps them afford a better living condition. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in livestock and buy more “cong nong”, while the demand for transportation service increases.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and business

loans.name: Sambour

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambour E. is a villager in Roluos Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Sorn, have a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. In this agriculture, they now face an obstacle because their field is infertile which has a bad effect on their crop.

In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sambour E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to amend her field to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Sambour E. is 47 years old and the mother of four children; two are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to make her field more fertile

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lượng 48 tuổi là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 2.000.000đ để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.  Hiện tại ngoài kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá chị Lượng còn đầu tư chăn nuôi để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập bình quân đạt 3.500.000đ/ tháng, kinh tế gia đình chị Lượng đã ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Lượng xin vay 15.000.000 để đầu tư mua thêm bánh kẹo, bia rượu về bán cho người dân địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luong Thi N., a 48 year old woman, has been an active partner of the TYM fund since 2004. Receiving the first loan of 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong she used it to open a small grocery store. At the moment, besides the business, Mrs. Luong is also raising some live-stock to increase the family’s income. The income level of 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month helps stabilizing the family’s financial situation. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more supplies for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more supply

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly S. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hang San, are farmers who can get little rice revenue because they own only a small piece of land to cultivate rice on. They have five children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Ly S.'s  family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions so Mrs. Ly S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Phi Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Phi năm nay  50 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng mất sớm một mình chị phải nuôi 2 con nhỏ. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ và vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh gạo. Nhờ có thu nhập ổn định từ công việc kinh danh nên chị  đã nuôi được hai con trưởng thành, kinh tế gia đình ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện tại chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để kinh doanh lúa gạo, một phần chị đầu tư thêm vốn mở cửa hàng kinh doanh điện thoại di động tạo công ăn việc làm cho các con.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phi Thi N. is a 50 year old woman. Before joining the TYM fund, her family faced many difficulties; her husband passed away early, leaving her alone with 2 small children. In 1998, she joined the fund and borrowed money to start selling rice. With the income from the business, she could take care of her children, who are now grown up. Her family’s financial situation is stabilized. She plans to make the next loan of 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to expand her business and start selling cell phones, creating jobs for her children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling rice and cell phones

loans.name: Mao Thi

texts.vi: Chị Mão  năm nay 57 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Gia đình chị có hai con trong đó có một con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi ngan gà và trồng trọt. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng  việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình chị cũng có rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ để đầu tư  sang chuồng trại ,  mua thêm giống ,  thức ăn phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mao is a 57 year old woman. She joined the TYM fund in 2000. She has 2 children, one of whom started going to school. At the moment, the family’s income comes mainly from raising poultry and farming. With the income level of 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month, she is able to pay back the loan. She plans to make the next loan of 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm, buy more poultry, food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Khann

texts.en:
Mrs. Khann N. is a villager in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who earns only a little rice revenue. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Nhoeb Ur, is a construction worker who can earn only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Khann N. is 41 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Tinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Tình năm nay 28 tuổi. Hiện tại  chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 1998 chị Tình tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh chăn nuôi gia đình chị Tình còn sử dụng máy cày để đi cày ruộng thuê cho người dân địa phương với thu nhập 15.000.000đ/ vụ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một chiếc máy gặt lúa mới để kinh doanh nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tinh Thi N. is 28 years old. Currently she lives with her husband and two young children in Hung N., Nghe An. In 1998 Mrs. N. joined the Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Besides the livestock business, the family also uses a tilling machine to run a tilling service for local farmers; the business brings an income of 15,000,000 VND per job. In the coming round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in buying a wheat harvesting machine with the goal of increasing the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new harvesting machine

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mr. Tha C. was born in 1980 and he now lives in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. He is an ice-cream seller who can make only a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Seth Ny, is a farmer. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her crop has been destroyed by insects.

To deal with this problem, her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insect and he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to make a better crop. Mrs. Tha C. has two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers to make a better crop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 22 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Liên là chăn nuôi và lương thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Liên đã ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  12.000.000đ, một phần chị sử dụng để mua thêm 1 con bò về nuôi, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua máy gặt lúa về  phục vụ bà con địa phương để phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 22 years old, has been participating in the Fund since joining in 2002. Currently her family's main source of income is raising livestock and her husband's construction work. With and income of 3,500,000 VND per month, the family's finances are becoming more stable day by day and is also improving. In this round of funding, she would like to receive a loan of 12,000,000 VND; a portion of this will be used to buy one cow to raise, and the remaining amount to invest in a wheat harvesting machine to provide a service for the local people, with both aims to develop the family's finances.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new wheat harvesting machine

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun S. is a villager in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Khen Mao, owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Although Mrs. Saroeun S. and his wife have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Saroeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig feed to start a pig-breeding business. Mr. Saroeun S. is 45 years old and the father of five children, one of whom helps on the plantation while the others are attending the local school. Both husband and wife are in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig feed to start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đoàn Thị Cúc năm nay 47 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2002 chị Cúc tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi, gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập ổn định từ công việc làm thuê của chồng. Với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị Cúc rất thuận lợi, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn có điều kiện đầu tư cho các con ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị Cúc mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn nái về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Đoàn Thị Cúc is 47 years old. She has 3 children, 2 are still in school. In 2002, she became a TYM fund member to borrow capital for her pig raising business. Her husband is employed. His salary and the revenue form the pig business provide them with a stable income. Together they gain 3.500.000 VND a month so they have no problem making the weekly payment. They are able to provide good education for their children. This time she is requesting 12.000.000 VND to repair the pig pen and to buy breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on in Rong Village in Takeo Province. In this plantation, she now has an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mom C. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend her field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Arth Rith, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Mom C. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun M. was born in 1975 and she now lives in Taok Doung Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small store where she sells coffee to villagers. Her husband, Mr. Leam Ny, is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells those ducks.

Mrs. Savoeun M. is 33 years old and the mother of two children who are both enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Trúc năm nay  41 tuổi . Chị Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999n Với 500.000đ được vay ở vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng để dầu tư cho chăn nuôi, sau 3 tháng công việc chăn nuôi đã đem lại cho chị thu nhập 1.000.000đ. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị Trúc còn đi làm thuê hàng tháng cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một con bò và 1 con bê về nuôi.n
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Tran, 41 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 1999. With the 500,000 VND that she borrowed in the first round of funding, she invested in raising livestock. After 3 months, the livestock business had brought her an income in the amount of 1,000,000 VND. Besides livestock, Mrs. Tran also works as labor for hire with an income of 2,000,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to invest in buying a cow and a sheep to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, sheep

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn N. is a villager in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Thil Noeurn, is a farmer who can get a small rice revenue to support her household. Although they have different businesses, the family still lives in poor conditions.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Thorn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. Thorn N. is 45 years old and the father five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are three and five years old. Husband and wife are both in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuân năm nay 62 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được hơn 10 năm. Trong suốt thời gian vay vốn của Quỹ để kinh doanh sản xuất chị Xuân luôn hoàn trả vốn đúng theo quy định và thực hiện tốt các quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng tháng chị còn có lương hưu và nhận được sự hỗ trợ của con trai đã trưởng thành và có công việc ổn định.Vì thế cuộc sống của chị và các con ngày càng được cải thiện.nVòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi. n
texts.en:
Mrs. X. Thi Nguyen is 62 years old. She has been participating in the Fund for over 10 years. In all the time in which she has borrowed from the Fund to do business, Mrs. Nguyen has always made repayments according to the loan terms and has abided by all other terms and conditions. Currently, besides income from the livestock business, she also receives a monthly pension and financial support from her adult son who has a stable job. Therefore, the family's quality of life is improving day by day. In this round of funding, she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in buying more chickens and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, feed

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Thanh năm nay  49 tuổi gia đình chị có 5 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2002 chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương để có thêm vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Đến nay ngoài nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt hàng tháng gia đình chị còn  có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm bảo vệ xã của chồng và sự hỗ trợ thêm của các con đã đi làm nên kinh tế gia đình chị  ngày càng ổn định hơn. Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị Thanh cũng rất thuận lợi.nVòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Thi V. is 49 years old. She has 5 children, who are all grown adults. In 2002, Mrs. V. joined the Fund to have more capital to invest in raising livestock to improve the family's finances. Currently, besides the income from the livestock and tree farming businesses, the family also has income streams from her husband's security job and her children's salaries. The family's finances are becoming more and more stable with time. With a total income of 2,500,000 VND per month, Mrs. V.'s repayments are proceeding very favorably. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in buying more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Soin's Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of twenty-five people is located in Moan Haeur Village in Kampong Cham Province and Mrs. Soin E. is the village bank president wH. has been selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller wH. sells in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit in order to meet her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Rin R., helps her in the current business.

Mrs. Soin E. is 58 years old and the mother of five children wH. are all employed in different businesses. This is a village bank loan consisting of partly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Thet Eng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Trapeang Reang Village in Kampong Cham Province make up this village bank and Mrs. Thet E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells grocery goods to the local villagers. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to meet the customers' demand.

Her husband, Mr. Oem Vibol, is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Mrs. Thet E. is 57 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the younger one is 13 years old and attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for re-sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S., 42, and her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Sor, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of their children study in local schools.

Sok has been selling Khmer traditional medicine since 2002. Her husband is a Khmer traditional medicine maker. He learned his skill from his master at Kou Len Mountain in Seam Reap Province. Now he has started another business as a carpenter for one year. Sok is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a carpenter's planing machine for her husband to use in his carpenter's business.

loans.use: To purchase a carpenter's plane

loans.name: Samith's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people in Prey Kokir Village in Takeo Province make up this village bank and all the members will use their share of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Samith N. is the village bank president and she is a farmer who owns 1.8 hectares to cultivate rice on to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a breeder who is raising two pigs. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her business. Mrs. Samith N. is a 47-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the younger one is attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Thoern Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of eleven people is located in Prey Kokir Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Thoeurn P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare to cultivate rice on. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Rom, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Aside from this activity, he is a breeder who is raising two pigs.

Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to for breeding in order to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Thoeurn P. is 32 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets  for breeding

loans.name: Srey Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Hong M. is the group leader for five who all live in Srei Chey Village in Takeo Province. She has 0.5 hectare plot where she can cultivate rice. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Srey Hong M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend her field to make it more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Uk Thon, is a laborer who can make US$ 2.50 per day which is very little to support the family. Mrs. Srey Hong M. is 45 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the younger one is attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the other two have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Rony

texts.en:
Mr. Rony S., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Sajaros El, 29, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in the local school, and the fourth is at home, too young to yet begin school.

Rony, a fisherman since his youth, fishes from the Mekong River and the lake near their village to sell to the middleman who then resells the fish in Phnom Penh City. He has also been a boat builder for almost ten years, while his wife raises fish to sell. Rony is now requesting a loan of $1000 to repair his fishing materials.

loans.use: To repair his fishing materials.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mrs. Sony Y., 43, and her husband, Mr. Noy Vanny, 43, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and five children: two sons and three daughters. Their eldest daughter is a silk weaver and other four children study at the local school.

Sony has been a silk weaver since 1987, a skill she learned from her neighbor, while her husband has practiced the craft since 1993. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Sony is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Amnas

texts.en:
Mrs. Amnas S., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sen S., 51, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have five daughters. Their two eldest daughters are factory workers, two others study in local school, and the youngest stays at home, yet too young to begin her education.

Amnas has been selling grocery items for two years, buying them from Prek Anchan market about five kilometers from her home for resale in her village. Sen has been selling cows for one year, buying them from his village to sell in the nearby province. Amnas is now requesting a loan of $700 to add to her own money for her husband to buy additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To add to her money to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Nasriniso

texts.en: Nasriniso has sold fabrics for women's clothing at the market for many years. Her fabrics are some of the best at the market. By now she has many clients. She knows her business very well. She is a mother of 5 kids. Her husband works as a cook. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods for selling and thus make more profit with which she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more fabrics and expanding her business

loans.name: Mrs. Rim Meak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people in the Krang Ta Chan village in the Takeo province are requesting a group loan. Mrs. Rim M. is the village bank president. She is a rice farmer, and owns 0.5-hectare, and also breeds pigs. This business is going well, so she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. U. Voeurn, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Rim M. is 43 years old and the mother of six children; two children help their mother in the pig-breeding business; three children attend the local school; and the youngest one is 5 years old.

Mrs. K. Sitha's husband is also requesting a loan (pictured here). The other members of this group loan have a variety of businesses for which they are requesting a loan.

loans.use: Buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Seu Suon Village Bnak Group

texts.en:
Eleven people in the Trapeang Chaeng village in the Takeo province in Cambodia have applied for a group loan. Mrs. Seu S. was selected by the members to be the group leader and bank president. Mrs. Seu S. is 45 years old and the mother of three children; two children are construction workers, and the youngest is enrolled in the local school. She is a pig breeder, but her pig is ill. To solve this problem, Mrs. Seu S. is requesting a loan to buy medicine to cure her pig. Her husband, Mr. Sin Pov, is a farmer and owns 1.2-hectare, which he cultivates to earn an income.

This group loan consists of requests for a variety of businesses for the group members.

loans.use: Purchase medicine to cure the pig and continue breeding business

loans.name: Mrs. Aun Preab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people in the Trapeang Chaeng village in the Takeo province in Cambodia, make up the village bank group loan and all the members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. P. AU. is the village bank president. She is 29 years old and the mother of six children; three children are employed in a garment factory, two attend the local school, and the youngest is 4 years old.

Mrs. P. AU. has 1.5 hectares on which she grows rice and earns a living. She is also a pig breeder. This business is going well, and she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keo Vorn, is a construction worker, and earns a small income that helps support his family.

loans.use: Buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sameth's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sameth C. is a group leader with four people, who all live in the Damank Trayueng village in Takeo province in Cambodia. She is a rice farmer, and owns 0.5 hectare that she cultivates and earns a living. This plantation faces a small problem, because the field has poor soil, which has a bad effect on her crop. Mrs. Sameth C. requests a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field and improve productivity.

Mrs. Sameth C. is a 47-year-old widow with three children. One child works in Malaysia, another one is employed at the Sokimex Gas Station, and the youngest one works in a garment factory.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the field to make the rice crop more productive

loans.name: Khuthea

texts.en: Mrs. Khuthea C. is 38 years old and lives in the Ra village in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has six children who all attend the local school. She is a lottery seller. Her husband, Mr. Phon Phoen, is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice. They do not earn much money. Thus, Mrs. Khuthea C. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase the revenue from growing rice to support her household.

loans.use: Buy land to cultivate rice to earn a better living

loans.name: Younos

texts.en:
Mr. Younos S. (pictured with his daughter and hammocks), 45, and his wife, Mrs. Aisas Tres, 43, live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Their eldest daughter assists her mother in sewing hammocks to sell, while the rest study in the local school.

For ten years Younos has been selling cloth hammocks sewn by his wife and daughter. He is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additional cloth with which to make more hammocks.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mr. Mat Sos, 49, and his wife, Mrs. Mary Les, 48, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1985 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two sons are fishermen while the other two sons study in the local school.

Mat, a fisherman since his youth, catches fish from the Mekong River and the lake near his village for his wife to sell at the village market about three kilometers from home. He is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one motor and fishing nets for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor and fishing nets for fishing business.

loans.name: Nath

texts.en: Mrs. Nath A. lives in Poek village in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children; one attends the local school and the younger child is too young to attend school. She is a laborer and her husband, Mr. Kim Korn, is a farmer (pictured on the left). They own a plot of land and cultivate rice. They face a problem in their field because of poor soil. Thus, Mrs. Nath A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the field to make her crop more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the soil in the field to make the rice crop more productive

loans.name: Srineang

texts.en: Mr. Srineang C. is a 33-year-old widower and now he lives in the Roka Khdouch Choeng village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. He is a farmer and owns a plot of land and cultivates rice and vegetables. He does not earn enough money to live on. Thus, Mr. Srineang C. is requesting a loan to grow cassava. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living condition.

loans.use: Buy supplies to grow cassava to increase income

loans.name: Simul

texts.en: Mrs. Simul Y. lives in the Poek village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is the 39-year-old mother of two children, who are attending the local school. She breeds pigs, and she owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sarom, is a farmer (pictured on the left). The productivity of his land has been affected by poor soil and the plantation is not going well. Thus, Mrs. Simul Y. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the soil to make the crops more productive.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make crops more productive

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha S. is 32 years old, has one child, and lives in the Poek village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. Mrs. Chantha S. breeds pigs and takes care of her house. She and her husband, Mr. Hom Ngon, are farmers. (Mr Hom Ngon is pictured on the left.) They own a plot of land and cultivate rice and vegetables. They face some problems with their fields because of poor soil, and the plantation is not going well. They do not earn much money. Thus, Mrs. Chantha S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make the crops more productive.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the soil and the productivity of the fields

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom R., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Pok, 48, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three sons, all of whom study in local school.

Mom and her husband have been growing cauliflower on their farm for three years, selling to the middleman in the village. Mom is now requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticide for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Mrs. Pom S. lives in the Poek village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 29 years old, and the mother of a child who attends the local school. She is a laborer in off-farm. Her husband, Mr. Seng San (pictured on the right), is a farmer and owns a plot of land and grows rice. The soil is poor and the farm is not producing crops well. Thus, Mrs. Pom S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make the fields produce more crops.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve the soil in the field to produce more crops

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang C. lives in the Siem Bauy village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 27 years old and the mother of two very young children. She sells fish and her husband, Mr. Lok Long, is a fisherman. They do not earn much money. Thus, Mrs. Sang C. is requesting a loan to buy a boat to support her husband's fishing business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy a boat to support her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy U., 25, and her husband, Mr. Vichit Mom, 29, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have two children, one son and one daughter. 

Thavy, who has been a silk weaver for almost ten years, a skill she learned from her parents, sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh.  Vichit is a mason and wooden house builder. Thavy is now requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Zareena Rustam Ali Group

texts.en:
Zareena Baji is the daughter of R. A. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She is unmarried. She has three brothers and three sisters. Two brothers are in the food business and her younger brother sells wood. Her sisters attend school. Zareena Baji does household work and helps to take care of her family.

She has successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy groceries for her brothers grocery shop. She is joined in her loan group by other members. Parveen Baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her cosmetics business. Naseem Baji is requesting a loan to buy materials (shaving and cutting tools) for her barber saloon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en:
Mr. Bunny N., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Koy, 30, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1995 and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three of their children study in local school and the youngest one is at home, yet too young to begin school.

Bunny has been a mechanic for almost 20 years, having learned his skill in Phnom Penh, while Chanthy has been a silk weaver for three years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. Currently, the couple lives with Chanthy’s parents; Bunny is requesting a loan of $900 to add to their own money in order to buy a house for the family.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a house.

loans.name: Zikran M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the past 30 years. Zikran baji is the mother of three sons; the older two are in the wood selling business and the youngest is still in school. Zikran baji's husband has been selling wood for the past 15 years. Zikran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

She successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her family business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sajida baji, Sakina baji, Husna baji and Razia baji are each requesting loans to buy wood for resale. Shakooran baji is requesting a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Zahida baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy more wood for resale.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San S., 52, a widow with two daughters, lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. San has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. Now she spins thread for her daughters to weave silk. and sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who resells them in Phnom Penh.

San is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk materials for her daughters’ weaving along with zinc and other materials to roof her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and roofing materials for the house.

loans.name: Nasreen M.sabir Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is a wife of M. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in this city for the past 35 years. She has one 22 year old son named M. Ishtiaq. He has been running a CD shop for the past 3 years. He buys CDs from a famous market, Shahalmiu, in the city of Lahore. Nasreen bajius husband has a book stall where he sells different kinds of books (religious and story books). Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Nasreen baji has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her sons CD shop. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khalida baji is requesting a loan to buy additional animals (goats and sheep) for her animal selling business. Mafi baji is requesting a loan to buy goats for her meat selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To purchase CD's for CD shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin A. is an entrepreneur who runs a small general store offering an assortment of sweets, soft drinks, juices, vegetables, chips and other items.  The store, u2013, is located within walking distance of his home in the city of Sabirabad, in southern Azerbaijan.  u2013 is a true family business.  His wife and two sons actively help him with selling.  

Shahin, 50, is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  His perseverance and clear vision are key factors for success in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Mrs. Sinat C. is 38 years old and she lives in the Chambork village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is a duck breeder. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, so her husband, Mr. Chim Ven, is a farmer. Mrs. Sinat Chhom has six children; three children are construction workers, and the other three children attend the local school. Even though Mrs. Sinat Chhornu's family members work in different businesses, they still do not have enough money to support a good living condition. Thus, Mrs. Sinat C. is requesting a loan to buy ducks and food for the ducks. She hopes to increase thier income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy ducks and food for the ducks to breed more ducks and increase income

loans.name: Irshad  M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is the wife of M. I. and lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son sells wood. Her younger son is in the 3rd standard grade. Her daughter is in kindergarten. 

Irshad baji's husband is a delivery man by profession. He loads fruits and vegetables on his donkey cart and delivers them to different areas of the city. Irshad baji is applying for a loan to buy another donkey cart because their old cart has broken and become unusable.

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Rahmat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Shakooran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for loading

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn U. is a villager in Kraing Sromor village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a seller in the local market. She is a 51-year-old widow and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other three children are enrolled the school. They still do not enough money to make ends meet. Thus, Mrs. Choeurn U. requests a loan to buy timber to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house.

loans.name: Mut

texts.en: Mrs. Mut M. is a villager in Kraing Sromor village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Phoung Py, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Mut M. is 41 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker while the other three children attend the local school. Despite the revenue, they barely make ends meet. Thus, Mrs. Mut M. requests a loan to buy cow to add her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy cow to add her husband's business.

loans.name: Sreyloth

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyloth C. was born in 1978 and now lives in Prey Cha Kroav village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study.  She owns a plot of land and cultivates both rice and vegetables. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Ly Sophoung, is employed as a driver. Mrs. Sreyloth C. faces a problem with her production and does not have enough money to support her field. Thus, Mrs. Sreyloth C. requests a loan to hire laborers to prepare the field to grow cassava. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To hire laborers to prepare the field to grow cassava.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mr. Leng T. is a villager in Prey Cha Kroav village in Kampong Cham Province. He is 58-year-old and the father of a child who is blacksmith. He is employed as a fish breeder at a large company. His wife, Mrs. Choun Thuch, is a fish breeder. Her business needs more working capital to support production. Thus, Mr. Leng T. requests a loan to buy fish foods to support his wife's business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fish food to support his wife's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en: Mrs. Savat S. is a 50 year old widow and now lives in Lvear Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are attending the local school. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. She has a problem because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Savat S. requests a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom P. is a villager in Lvear Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She is 50 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one is a motor repairer while the other four are attending the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Tang Tork, are farmers. They own a small piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. However, their fields do not have an irrigation system nearly. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Rom P. request a loan to buy a pump to support her fields. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to support their fields.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi N. is a villager in Kork Doung village in Takeo Province. She is 22 years old and the mother of a young child.  Her husband, Mr. Khun Kunthea, is a construction worker. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. However, her field is infertile and she must hire laborers with oxen to plow her field. In order to deal with the field problem, Mrs. Yi N. requests a loan to buy fertilizers and hire laborers with oxen to plow herrice field.  Her husband is presented on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire laborers with oxen to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem K. is a villager in Samroung village in Takeo Province. She is a 44 year old widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the other two children attend the local school. She owns a small piece of land for cultivating land. Even with these jobs, they still do not earn enough money to survive. Thus, Mrs. Saroem K. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun L. was born in 1949 and now lives in Moen Tomrang village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. L. Chhorn, are farmers. Mr. L. Chhorn also is a vice president of the village. They own a plot of land to cultivate rice. The income does not produce enough money to support their lives. Thus, Mrs. Sun L. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en: Mr. Doeun H. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He is 57 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other four attend the local school.  He and his wife, Mrs. Torn Nem, are farmers. They own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even with the revenue, they do not make enough money to make a living. Thus, Mr. Doeun H. requests a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding.  Thewoman who presented on the right of the picture is his wife.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy buffalo for breeding.

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Touch T. lives in Ampil village in Takeo Province. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children. Her oldest child is employed in a garment factory, her second attends the local school, and her youngest is too young for work or study. She is a housewife who enjoys cooking and taking care of her family. Her husband, Mr. Pha Sanleang, is a motorbike driver. His business is suffering, however, because his motorbike needs many repairs and is often in the shop.

Thus, Mrs. Srey Touch T. decided to ask for a loan to buy her husband a new motorbike. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Mrs. Chean T. was born in 1979 and lives in Thom village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Man Rorn, are duck breeders. They have four children; three of whom attend the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study. With their current revenue, they do not make enough money to support their lifestyle.

Thus, Mrs. Chean T. decided to request a loan to buy more breeding ducks to increase their business. She hopes to improve their profits and their standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase for ducks for their breeding business.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en: Sabiha was born in 1953. She lives in Graučanica, a small village in Bosnia.  She is married and runs a cleaning service with her husband, which earns about 500KM/month (about $330 USD). Sabiha has an adult son, who continues to live in her home. The income from the cleaning service is not enough to sustain her family, so Sabiha also raises cows, selling the milk and milk products at a local market. Sabiha hopes to focus her time on raising cows, as she is getting too old for the manual labor required by the cleaning business. She requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a cow
