loans.name: Sam-Ang

texts.en:
Miss Sam-ang C. (pictured with her niece), 49, is single and lives with her elderly mother, brother, nephews and nieces on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sam-ang, a silk weaver for over 10 years, having learned the skill from her mother, sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and purchase construction materials for her brother, who is a mason.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and construction materials for her brother.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N., 46, and her husband, Mr. Nhaun Kheav, 47, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have five children, four sons and one daughter. The oldest son is a footwear garment factory worker in Phnom Penh; the second son studies in high school; their daughter stays at home while the two youngest study in the local school.

Mrs. Kong has been a vegetable and meat seller for six years, buying her products from Phnom Penh for resale in the village. Her husband has been a construction worker for ten years, always working far away from home. Kong hopes that in the future she will able to open a small mini mart at her home, and now is requesting a loan of $1200 both to purchase a motorbike to transport the vegetables and meats to her village and to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry vegetables and meats to sell and to repair her house.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat Y., 56, who lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of the children are married, but one son stays with her, weaving silk at home. She also has two grandchildren living with her.

Sinat has sold silk fabric since 1997, buying the finished products from weavers in Ta Keo province and some from her village for resale. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan A. lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She is 56 years old and the mother of four children: two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the younger two attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Touch, are farmers. They own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and cassavas.

Recently, however, their crops have been poor because of problems with infertile soil. As a result, Mrs. Phan A. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help improve their soil and make their crops more productive. They would also like to purchase a cow for breeding to increase their overall business.

loans.use: To buy fertizers to improve their soil and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Som-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Som-ol C., 61, and her husband, Mr. Chheng Pong, 59, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for over 30 years and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives outside the family home while two sons study in the local school and the other is a farmer and silk weaver.

Som-ol has been a weaver for almost 40 years, having learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband, a rice farmer since 1960, also raises cows. Som-ol is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay the fee for rice planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang L. lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She is a 59 year old widow and the mother of two children. Both of her kids are employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Lang L. owns a plot of land where she cultivate rice to earn a living. Recently, however, her crops have been poor due to infertile soil which affects her business.

Even though Mrs. Lang L.’s children have employment, they still do not earn enough money to support their lifestyle. Thus, Mrs. Lang L. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her soil and make her crops more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improver her soil for growing rice.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn Aier was born in 1960 and lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She is 48 years old and the mother of six children: two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two of whom attend the local school, and two of whom are too young to work or study. She and her husband, Mr. Huch Phal, are farmers. They own a plot of land on which they cultivate both rice and cassavas. Recently, however, their crops have been poor because of problems with infertile soil.

As a result, Mrs. Sorn Aier decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help improve their soil and make their crops more productive. They would also like to purchase a cow for breeding to increase their overall business production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for their soil and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sov

texts.en: Mrs. Sov P., a 50-year-old widow and the mother of two children, one a farmer and the other a student, lives in Rolus Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living, but because her field is currently infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to revitalize it.  Sov hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her rice field.

loans.name: Ye

texts.en:
Mr. Ye Y. resides in Trapaing Toem Village in Kampong Cham Province where he cultivates rice on a small piece of land that he owns. His wife, Mrs. Seng Soen, is a duck breeder upon whose behalf Ye is requesting a loan to buy duck food. He hopes to increase family income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Ye is 45 years old and the father of four children, one a garment factory worker, another a boxer, and two students in the local school. His wife is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase duck food.

loans.name: Progress I Group

texts.en:
This is the Progress Group: Thaimu C., Fatmata M., Fatmata B., and Mahawa C.. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00 to help them expand on their businesses.

Thaimu is the leader of this group. He is 42 and married to a businesswoman. They have two children, who are both attending primary school. Thaimu sells medicine and has been in the business for the past twenty years. 

He will use this loan to invest in his business by increasing his stock. He usually travels to Freetown (570 miles round trip) to buy stock of medicine. With more goods to sell, Thaimu will not have to travel to Freetown as much and he will also likely see more profit. With increased profit, Thaimu's life will become better. He will be able to pay his children's school fees and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mr. El S. (pictured with his daughter), 66, and his wife, Mrs. Siasas Chres, 57, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have three daughters, all married, but only one lives outside the family home. One daughter is a grocery seller and another is a fisherwoman.

El has been fishing since he was young, having learned the skill from his parents. He catches fish to sell from the Mekong River and the lake near the village. His wife is a fortune teller, an art she learned from her mother. El is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one boat motor for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for fishing.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy T. and her husband, Mr. Tuy Ty, residents of Rolos Village in Takeo Province, are farmers who own a small piece of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Unfortunately, their field is currently infertile, so Thy is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to make the field more productive.

Thy is 49 years old and the mother of two children, one a farmer and the other a student at the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Chron

texts.en:
Mrs. Chron M., born in 1981 and residing in Rolos Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Since her field is currently infertile, Chron is requesting a loan to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the land and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to make it more productive.

She is the mother of three children, two attending the local school while the third is yet too young to be a student. Her husband, Mr. Hoo Dang, a construction worker, is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow her field and to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Drivers Group

texts.en:
This is the Drivers Group. Its members include Alusine J., Alusine B., Musa J., Chernoh A. B., and Fatmata B.. This is their first time seeking a loan from SMT and they are requesting Le 2,000,000 to help them strengthen their businesses.

Alusine J. is the leader of the group. He was born in Fadugu, about 23 miles from Kabala. He is 32 and married with two children, who are not yet of school age. Alusine has fifteen years of experience as a driver. Presently, he travels between Kabala and Makeni in a Renault 29 automobile that carries nine passengers. The fare per passenger is Le 14,000.

Currently, Alusine faces a lot of constraints because his vehicle's engine is too old and breaks down. When the engine fails, he is not able to work for the remainder of the day and sometimes even two days until a spare part is bought from Freetown. He will use this loan, along with his savings, to buy a new engine for the Renault 29. Alusine's greatest desire is to then save money for a brighter future in which he can build himself a house and feed himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Slamas

texts.en:
Mrs. Slamas M. (pictured with her husband and children), 62, and her husband, Mr. El M., 59, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have ten children; three sons and seven daughters. Six of their children are married and live outside the family home, and two work in a garment factory.

Slamas has been selling fish for the past four months, buying from her neighbors and reselling on the other side of the Mekong River. Prior to this, she was a cake seller. Her husband has been a fisherman since he was young and also works in construction. Slamas is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase fishing materials such as nets and a boat motor to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Naza

texts.en: Naza was born in 1965. She currently lives in Gračanica, but she is a war refugee from Srebrenica. She is a widow, with two children. Her adult son works as a driver, and her younger daughter attends secondary school.  To support her family, Naza has a vegetable garden and raises chickens seasonally. Naza requests a 1,500KM ($975 USD) loan from Women for Women International, which she will use to buy chickens and chicken feed. The additional income will be used to meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Lanaya Group

texts.en:
This is Adama B., Fatmata B. and Amie K.. They named their group Lanaya. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Kabala. This is the fourth time they've received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one in the group received a loan of Le 600,000.00. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children's school fees in case things were difficult for their husbands. They could also add to the daily allowances that their husband's give them for food. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 700,000.00 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Adama B. (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-two years of age. She was born in Kabala and she is married with five children. Two of her children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary levels. The fifth is currently learning a trade. Her husband is the tribal head for the Fullas in Kabala. Amongst other activities, he arbitrates amongst the Fullas. Adama has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed clothes, often with fabricated designs) for the past seven years now.

With this new loan, Adama will expand on her business by buying about 4 "pieces" of white cotton (thirty yards make a piece). She will buy an additional number of inks, caustic soda and powder. She will also be able to pay workers who design the clothes. A piece of white cotton costs her Le 120,000 in Freetown, where she often sends someone to buy her the materials she needs. Prices for the inks vary depending on the color, ranging from Le 40,000 to Le 60,000. She sells the gara clothes (gara lapper) between Le 25,000 and Le 30,000. To Adama and colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means buying more dresses for themselves and solving household problems that may arise.

loans.use: Buying cotton, inks, powder and caustic soda for clothing design

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
Mr. You Y., 36, and his wife, Srey-yem Tann, 25, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two daughters. The oldest daughter is in Grade Two and the youngest is at home, yet too young to attend school.

You has been a fisherman for ten years, having learned the skill from his parents. He fishes from the Mekong River and the lake near the village, and his wife sells the catch at a market about ten kilometers from home. Now You is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fishing materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials for his business.

loans.name: Musidal Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed B. J., Mohamed J., and Fatmata N.. They are business people in Kabala in the Koinadugu District of northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Musidal, a Fullah word meaning family. They have received loans in the past from Kiva through SMT, and have repaid them successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 500,000 for each member of the group. This enabled these entrepreneurs to do a lot of good things for themselves. Using the proceeds they got from their businesses, they were able to feed themselves and their children and pay their children's school fees. The leader of this group, Mohamed B., has also almost completed building a house.

Mohamed B. was born in Kabala about forty-two years ago. He is married with three children. One is in secondary school and two are in primary schools. He sells cattle and has been in this business for the past eight years now. He buys the cattle in villages surrounding Kabala, including Bindi and Gbentu. The prices for cattle vary depending on the size of the cattle. Usually, prices range between Le 70,000 to Le 100,000 in the villages. The cattle business is a very lucrative business in Kabala.

Notwithstanding, he faces some few challenges in his business as a cattle trader. Sometimes, when vehicles are not available he has to walk a very long distance to the villages to buy the cattle. This can be very difficult as he may spend an entire day traveling by foot. With this new loan, Mohammed B. is expecting to make increased profits that he will use to complete construction of his new home.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to trade.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom S., 58, and her husband, Mr. Lun Phoeng, 58, live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four daughters; three of them are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter weaves silk at home.

Mrs. Khom S. has been a silk weaver since she was 12 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband spins thread for neighbors to get extra income. He has been farming since he was young.

Mrs. Khom is requesting a loan of $600 to build a fence for her house and purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving of silk.

loans.use: To build a fence for the house and purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Noah Group

texts.en:
This is the Noah Group: Fatmata F. and Marie K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Kabala town who have each received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. The loans were a great help to these hard-working women, enabling them to take good care of their homes by feeding, clothing, medicating, and schooling their children. They are requesting a new loan for Le 1,600,000 to further empower them by strengthening their businesses and livelihood.

Fatmata is the leader of the group. She was born in Mayamba in eastern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-one and married with two children. One of her children is in secondary school and the other in nursery school. Her husband is an architect and the two work hand-in-hand in running the home.

Fatmata has been selling underwear for ladies for the past eight years now. She buys her goods in Freetown, about 570 miles round-trip from Kabala. Prices range between Le 250,000 to 300,000 per bale. Her greatest challenge now is to build her family a house with two rooms and to provide education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase underwear for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Makprang

texts.en:
Mrs. Makprang K., 37, and her husband, Mr. Leangtheng But, 43, live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have five daughters. Two of their daughters are medicine sellers in Phnom Penh, the other two daughters study in primary school.

Mrs. Makprang has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She sells her finished product to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Makprang is requesting a loan of $1000 which she will use for weaving business and some amount for building her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and build her house.

loans.name: Samera

texts.en: Samera was born in 1984. She was previously a war refugee, but now lives in Rašljeva, a village in Bosnia.  She is married and has a two-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a driver and she raises sheep; together they make about 1,300KM/month (about $860 USD. The Muslim holiday called Eid Al-Adha commemorates the story of Abraham. Muslims traditionally slaughter a lamb or sheep on this holiday and divide the meat for their family, friends, and the poor. Samera has raised sheep to be sacrificed on Eid ul-Adha, but she needs to pay an animal doctor to analyze the blood and health of the sheep before she can sell them to her neighbors. She requests a 1,000KM ($650 USD) loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to pay the veterinarian for his services.

loans.use: To pay a veterinarian to check sheep before they can be sacrificed for the Muslim holiday Eid Al-Adha

loans.name: Orujali

texts.en:
Orujali A. is a 49 year old a father of 4 children.  He has a small business raising cattle.  He raises the cattle and then sells them at the market.  His kids also help him out in his business.  He buys cattle at a lower price from the markets and, after fattening them for a month or two, sells them. 

He also has a car, which he uses to take local people to the center of the region, but his main financial source is cattle breeding. 

He plans to increase the number of his livestock but doesn't have a cow-shed that is big enough.  With the help of a loan, he wants to construct a comfortable cow-shed for his cattle and purchase two calves.  Let's do our best to help this hardworking man!

loans.use: To purchase two calves and build cow-shed

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
This is the Sababu group: Manty S. and Mabinty K.. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. The last loan they received was for Le 600,000 each. Previous loans have made a meaningful impact in the lives of these people. Nevertheless, they still need additional loans of Le 800,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Mabinty is the leader of this group. She was born in Falaba, about forty-two miles from Kabala. She is married with five children. Three of her children are in secondary schools and one in primary school. The eldest is now a housewife. Mabinty's husband is a diamond miner in Kono in eastern Sierra Leone.

Mabinty has been selling cooked rice for over eight years now. She intends to use this new loan to buy bags of rice, barters of palm-oil (five gallons make a barter), and other cooking materials. This will prevent her from buying these items from the market in more expensive amounts. As a result, she will be able to make more profit from the materials she sells. Higher profits will solve most of her challenges, which include feeding the family, educating the children, and providing medical care in case any member of the family becomes sick.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials, rice, and palm oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny M., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Chea, 39, who live along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, one son and three daughters. All their children study in local school.

Mrs. Ny has been farming for many years. She grows cabbages and spinaches in the farm near her house. She sells her products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband cooks for wedding ceremony and other ceremony in the village and in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ny is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a water pumping machine, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for her vegetables farm.

loans.use: To purchase one water pumping machine, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for faming business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali Q. is a hard-working person who makes an effort to give his four beloved children the best. He works as a teacher in the local school, but his salary is not enough to cover his family's basic needs. That is why in 1995 Ali decided to begin a sheep breeding business. With experience gained over thirteen years in the purchase and sale of sheep, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

Ali would now like to expand his business, and create more income for his large family, by purchasing twenty sheep. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $1200. Ali thanks you very much for your support.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sheep to expand his business.

loans.name: Enaradela Group

texts.en:
This is the Enaradela group: Masse S. and Tenneh S.. They have been with SMT for the past three years. The previous loans have made meaningful impacts in their lives. The last loan was for Le 500,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Masse is the leader of the group. She was born in Koindu in the Koinadugu District in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-nine and married with seven children. Four of her children are already married, two are in secondary schools, and one is in primary school. Her husband is a retired soldier, now working as a security guard in the government hospital. 

She has been in business for over twenty years. She buys husk rice before it is pounded and cleans it before selling. She buys a pan of husk rice from villages surrounding Kabala at Le 2,000.00 and sells at Le 3,000.00. Masse uses part of her profit to repay the loan, part to feed herself and her family, and the rest to buy cattle. She rears the cattle and keeps them as collateral. In an emergency situation, Masse can then sell the cattle.

loans.use: To purchase husk rice.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib B. is 46 years old and is married with three daughters.  Habib has always opted to make his living on his land, work hard and grow with it.  That is how he decided to rear cows and now dedicates himself to livestock breeding.  He has six years of experience in this field.  

Today, he wishes to increase his number of cattle and would like to buy a cow and 2 calves in hopes of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him.  For this reason, he has applied for $1,200.  Extend your solidarity to Habib so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 2 calves

loans.name: Bahdainya Group

texts.en:
This is the Bahdainya group: Nenneh S. and Sallamau S.. (Between them is SMT Credit Officer, Foday Lamin). They have received previous loans from Kiva through SMT, which were of great help to these entrepreneurs. The last loans were for Le 800,000 each and they repaid them successfully. They are requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000 each.

Nenneh (on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Kabala. She is fifty-two and married with five children. Three of her children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools. She pays for their education with proceeds from the cooked rice she sells in the market. Her husband is the Chief Imam in the Kabala Central Mosque (which is an unpaid position in Sierra Leone).

Nenneh has been in business for over thirty years now, five of which have been selling cooked rice. With this loan, she will buy gallons of palm-oil, bags of rice, and other cooking material wholesale. This will prevent her from having to buy these materials in bits from the market, thereby saving money. She will be make higher profits from the bags of rice, gallons of palm-oil, other goods, and the cooked rice she sells. She usually cooks fifty cups of rice in a day. In four days time, she finishes off an entire bag of rice. She owns a shop at the centre of town with a steady amount of customers who want her product. Her challenge in life now is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale palm oil, rice, and other cooking materials.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil H. is 28 years old and lives with his elderly parents.  He is not married yet.  

He likes his livestock business very much.  He has 2 calves for fattening, which is how he supports his family.  He also works as a teacher in the local school, but his salary is too small even to cover his basic needs, and Ramil needs to think about his parents too.  That's why, seven years ago, he decided to start his own business.  

To expand his business Ramil has applied for a $1,200 loan to purchase four calves.  Ramil wishes to marry his fiance, but he wants to wait to increase his income during the winter season as it is the high period when people need meat.  

Your help will support Ramil's current and future families.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Debaia Group

texts.en:
This is the Debaia group: Fatmata M., Sonny S., and Bangali M.. They have received previous loans from Kiva through SMT that were of great help to these entrepreneurs. The last loan was for Le 800,000 each. They repaid it successfully and are now requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000 each.

Fatmata (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. She was born in Fadugu, about twenty-five miles from Kabala. She is forty and married with five children. Four of her children are in secondary schools and one is in primary school. She pays for their education with proceeds from the market foods she sells in the market. Her husband is now too old to fend for the family so it is incumbent on her to take care of their children. 

Fatmata has been in business for over ten years. She sells market food at the Tender Hill market. With this loan, she will invest in market foods like onions, margi (used in sauce), peppers, salts, oil, sugar, and more. She buys most of these items in Kabala town. When they are scarce in Kabala, she will send to Freetown (about 570 round-trip) where prices for the goods are relatively cheaper. With higher profits, Fatmata will be able to assist her children in their education, feeding, and clothing and provide them with medical care when anyone falls sick.

loans.use: To purchasing food for resale in the marketplace.

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en: Afqan K. is 54 years old, married and has four children. He lives with his entire family, as well as his parents, on a one-hectare property where he breeds sheep and sells them for meat production. He started his sheep breeding business in 1995 as there was no other financial source. In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD, which will be used to purchase 20 sheep to help to sell more sheep during the winter period and improve his living conditions. Afqan and his family appreciate your help!

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Albarka Group

texts.en:
This is Patrick A. K., Kadiatu C., Mary P. K., Aminata K., and Marie L.. They call their group Albarka, a Temne word for thank you. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT and have repaid them successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 700,000 each and that loan helped them a lot. They were to make higher profits and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for Le 5,000,000 (or Le 1,000,000 each) to add to their businesses.

Patrick (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. He was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-five years of age and married with ten children. Two of his children are in secondary school, four in primary school, and four are now adults. He has been a businessman for the past thirty years now. He sells palm-oil by the gallon.

With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Patrick will buy about fifty to a hundred batters of palm-oil to add to his thirty batters that he is trading with today. (Five gallons make a batter.) He buys the palm-oil in a village called Yele that is about thirty-five miles from Makeni. He sells the palm-oil in Makeni. The price of a batter is not fixed. It ranges from Le 30,000.00 to 50,000.00 depending on the season and the availability of the palm-oil in the market. 

The only challenge he is facing in his business is that of transportation. It is sometimes very difficult to get a vehicle to transport the palm-oil to Makeni. His greatest desire now is to be able to make higher profits to be able to meet some of the demands of his children, especially their education fees.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu T. and Kadiatu C.. They call their group Tamaraneh III, a Temne word that means, "Let us help each other." They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT and always repay them successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 500,000 each and this helped them a lot. They were able to earn more profit after the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to add to their businesses.

Isatu (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-three and a widow with two children. One of her children is in secondary and one in primary school. She has been a businesswoman for the past ten years now. She sells ground-nuts.

With this loan of Le 500,000, Isatu will now be able to buy a one and half bags of ground-nuts to add to her business. Before now she could buy only baskets of ground-nuts because of low capital. She travels to Bamoi near the neighboring country of Guinea to buy the ground-nuts. The price per bag for a ground-nut is Le 300,000.

Though the ground-nut business is a lucrative one, ground-nut dealers, like Isatu, some times encounter difficulties in running their businesses. They may discover rotten ground-nuts in the sealed bags, which could lead to a loss of profit. Again, they have to travel to villages like Bamoi to buy the ground-nuts and sometimes vehicles are difficult to find to transport the goods. Terrible weather can also hinder Isatu's ability to obtain her goods. Notwithstanding the difficulties she faces as a business woman, she believes in her business as it the only means through which she can survive. Out of the profit she makes, she is able to feed herself and children, pay their school fees, and give them medical attention when any one of them is sick.

loans.use: To purchase ground-nuts for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en:
Qabil S. is 41 years old and married with three sons.  Qabil is a hard-working man who is running a cattle breeding business.  He started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment.  He is also working as a teacher in the local school, but the salary is too small even to cover the monthly basic needs of his family. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 16 years ago. 

Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business.  Therefore, Qabil is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase four additional cattle to sell.  More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing.  

He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mammy Group

texts.en:
This is the Mamy group: Mohamed F., Aminata K., Assanatu K. and Musa Thollah. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT and always repay their loans successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 800,000 each and this helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 to add to their businesses.

Mohamed (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. He was born in Kolisoko village, fifteen miles from Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-two and married with six children. Four of the children are in secondary school and two in primary. He has been a businessman for the past eighteen years.

With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Mohamed will buy two quality bales of second-hand clothes. A good quality bale of second-hand clothes costs him Le 600,000, while lesser quality clothes go for Le 300,000 or Le 400,000. Bales of second-hand clothes are sold only in Freetown (360 miles round-trip). Out of his business and with the help of SMT loans, Mohamed will be able to build himself a house. His priority is feeding, educating, and clothing his children, and providing them with medical care in case any of them become sick.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Ansorbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Asiatu K. and Fatu K.. They call their group Ansorbeh, a Temne word for "hard work." They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT and always repay their loans in full. Their previous loan was for Le 500,000 each. This helped them a lot. They were able earn more profit after the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to add to their businesses.

Asiatu (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-two and married with five children. Two of her children are in secondary school, two in primary school, and the last is not yet of school age. She has been a businesswoman for the past fifteen years. She sells market food like rice, palm-oil, salt, and onions.

With this loan of Le 800,000, Asiatu will buy more of the above items to add to her business. She usually buys these items in a business center called Faredugu. To ensure that she always pays her loans on time, Asiatu enrolled into an Osusu. This is an informal savings account wherein each member of the Osusu group (usually made up of eight, ten, or fifteen people, depending on the number of people willing to join) contributes an agreed amount of money to another member on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis. She always ensures that the receipt of her portion of the savings coincides with her monthly repayment schedule. She uses part of this money to repay her loan to SMT and part of it to solve her numerous problems.

loans.use: Tp purchase rice, palm oil, salt, and onions to sell in the market.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Qullu

texts.en:
Qullu A. is a 49 year old man who owns his own food store.  He is married and has 2 sons who are both schoolchildren.  

He started his business in 2000 when he realized that there was only bread to feed his sons.  So, he borrowed money from his neighbor and started his business.  Now he sells various food stuffs such as tea, mayonnaise, sweets, etc. 

Qullu has applied for a $1,200 loan to purchase more inventory to stock his shop and increase his income.  You can be a helping hand for Qullu's business development.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Lanaya Group

texts.en:
This is the Lanaya Group: Sundu D., Abu K., Manty K., and Manty M.. This will be their fifth loan from SMT and they always repay the principal successfully. Previous loans have enabled these entrepreneurs to pay for their children's school fees, food, and clothing. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000.

Sundu is this group's leader. She was born in Kabala. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in secondary schools and one in primary school. She and her husband are responsible for their schooling. 

Sundu has been dealing in local produce now for the past fifteen years. Most often, she buys the produce in villages surrounding Kabala, including Firama and Gberfe. With the profit she makes, Sundu educates, feeds and clothes her children.

loans.use: To purchase produce to sell in the market.

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Amil P. is 22 years old. He's a very optimistic guy who is full of energy! He owns a small shop in the little village where he was born. He lives with his parents, who are on pension now.

Amil started his business in 2005, as soon as he finished high school. His father supported him financially in starting up his business. The store now provides a stable monthly income but just enough to cover basic family needs and not to expand the business. Amil has applied for a loan of $1000 to purchase more inventory for his shop to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his shop.

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira  D. is a 61 year old woman who keeps a small shop.  She is married and has five children to whom she wishes to give the very best.  This business is the only source of income in her family. 

Zemfira has been running her store for 20 years.  She sells different kinds of textiles, bath and bed accessories, etc. Zemfira is very dynamic and cares for her family. She tries to give her family as much money as possible to cover the school expenses of her children because her dream of for all of them to be well educated.  

Today, Zemfira wants to expand her business and increase her working capital for purchasing new goods to sell.  For this purpose, she requests $1,200 to expand her business.  Zemfira promises to manage this loan without any violations.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana A. is a hard working woman and mother of eight wonderful kids.  She has her own business selling perfume and other small items.  She rents a shop where she gets many clients.  

She usually goes to other towns to buy goods and sells them at the market where she lives.  But, since everything has been getting so expensive, the money she uses for business isn't enough.  So, she decided to borrow more money to buy more goods to sell.  This way, she can have more profit and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid B. is a 29 year old trader who keeps his store, which he has already had for 8 years.  He is married and has 2 sons.  He sells drinks, home stuff, hair coloring, etc. 

Zahid doesn't have a permanent job, which is why this shop in the only own source of income for his family.  His wife actively helps him.  Zahid dreams of providing the best education to his children. 

He applied for $1,200 to purchase more inventory to stock his shop and increase his income.  Let's do our best to make Zahid's dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to stock his shop

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham A. is an entrepreneurial cattleman who is married and has four children.  He yearns to make his small business into a big family business so that he can improve the quality of life for his wife and children.  

He currently has three calves.  He grows his own food for them in order to feed them.  His desire to grow his business has led him to improve his production techniques so that he can distribute the milk to his clients in a timely manner. 

Ilham wants to buy an additional four calves to increase the amount of meat he sells at the local livestock bazaar.  For this purpose, Ilham applied for $1,200.  With your help, Ilham will be able to improve the cattle feed.  Let's work together so that Ilham can make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Qismet

texts.en:
Qismet O. is a married man and has a small business of his own in order to feed his family.  He buys construction materials from other cities and sells them.  But, as he doesn't have a place at the market, he sells them from a rented garage on the outskirts of the city. 

Now that he has so many clients, he wants to build a small store at the marketplace.  So, he wants to take out a loan to earn more profit and, by saving his money, have enough to build a store.

loans.use: To expand his business by building a store at the marketplace

loans.name: Bahram

texts.en:
Bahram B. is the loving father of three sons. He works as a postmaster, but this job is not permanent and it comprises only 10% of his income. His wife is housewife. 

For almost 10 years, Bahram has had his own business raising livestock. He buys cattle, fattens them, and then sells them. He started his business with a small amount of money. He was also able to use money he made to expand his business. 

He wants to borrow money to buy more hay for the winter season. Because meat is very popular, Bahram would like to purchase four calves, fatten them, and then sell them during winter season. Bahram would like to be able count on you for your help!

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en:
Afqan S. is 22 years old and the young father of one daughter. He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his father when he was 17 years of age. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. 

In addition to the animals, he also buys and sells agricultural goods to raise more profit. 

Today he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He is requesting a loan of $1200 which he's promising to repay within 15 months. From the profit of his business, Afqan wants to improve his family life conditions. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase  four calves

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu K. is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She and her husband are unemployed and raising cattle for sale, which is their only financial source to feed five children. Gullu`s children are also engaged in helping their mother with cattle. 

Gullu raises cattle and then sells them at the market. She also provides her family with milk products. Gullu buys cattle almost twice each week. After fattening them, she sells them.

With the help of this loan, she plans to increase her livestock and construct a comfortable winter cow-shed for her cattle. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves. She and her family are counting on your help!

loans.use: To purchase two calves and build a cow-shed

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es: La sra. Inocencia de 42 años de edad, viven el ciudad de Ñemby hace 15 años , enviudó hace 10 años , y de su primer matrimonio tuvo 4 hijos, de 22, 17, 15 y 12 años , cuenta que su hija de 15 años es una niña especial (es enferma).nActualmente está casada hace 3 años con el sr. Odilón Villar quien se desempeña como operador de máquinas  en una Hilandería (fabrica de hilos) en la ciudad de San Antonio, de este matrimonio tiene un hijo.nLa sra. sigue contando que sus dos hijas mayores están trabajando en España, y que le están ayudando desde allá.nElla dice que desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio ya que había empezado a vender mercerías (ropas) por su barrio casa por casa, más adelante puso un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en su domicilio.nCuenta que con la obtención de su crédito, ella ha mejorado mucho, ya que le posibilitó construir una casilla de material frente a su casa, y eso ayudó para que ella volviera a vender ropas, zapatos y artículos de bazar en su casa, y de esa manera se queda más, y puede estar también con sus hijos. nEl crédito que ahora solicita será para la compra de compra de bebidas, helados y reparación  del techo de su casa.n
texts.en:
Inocencia is 42 years old and has lived in the city of Ñemby for 15 years. She was widowed 10 years ago, and from her first husband she has four children — ages 22, 17, 15 and 12. She tells us her 15-year-old daughter has special needs. She has been remarried for three years with Mr. Odilón Villar, who makes a living as a machine operator at a textile factory in the city of San Antonio. She has one son from this marriage. Inocencia says that since she was very young she made a living in commerce, first selling fruits and vegetables grown at her home. She adds that with the help of credit her situation has vastly improved, and it made it possible to build an extra room in her home. It also helped her move to selling clothes, shoes and bazaar items out of her home, allowing her to be around more and be closer to her children. The loan she's currently requesting will be used to purchase drinks and ice cream treats as well as to repair the roof on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, ice cream treats and repair the roof on her home

loans.name: Qurbat

texts.en:
Qurbat K. is 45 years old. He is married and has five children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life have made him recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 20 years, he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening them, and selling them. Qurbat is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. Qurbat wakes up early every morning to feed his cows and calves, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. 

Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy four calves to expand his business. Let's support Qurbat who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad A. is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. Mahammad is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work at another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. But, over time, livestock breeding has become his main financial source. 

He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 12 years ago. With time, he has increased his sales. Now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well and which he would like to continue to grow. 

Mahammad is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy four calves. He is offering to repay the loan in 15 months. With the profit from this loan, he wants to support his children with their education. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them to give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Dunyamali

texts.en:
Dunyamali A. has four children. He is metal craftsman, but his main source of work is cattle breeding.  For almost 8 years, Dunyamali has been buying cattle, fattening them, and then selling them at the cattle market. His profit is hardly enough to cover his family's basic needs, because Dunyamali parents also live with them. 

He has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase four additional calves to increase his income. Your helping hand is needed!

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila Q. is a 44-year-old married woman with 2 sons. Jamila sells cosmetics, such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, and perfumes. She started her business in 2002. The idea of starting her own business came to her when she realized that there is unemployment everywhere and no other way to feed her family. Jamila is not alone in her business.Her husband helps her by purchasing and bringing goods from other cities. 

Now Jamila would like to expand her business and purchase more goods to sell. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1200. Jamila would like to count on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh K. is a 48-year-old trader who has been in business for more than ten years. He is married and has four sons who actively help him with his trading business. Taleh sells tea, candies, rice, and other foods. He wishes to provide his children with a good education and, for this reason, he works very hard. 

His working day begins at 8:00 in the morning and finishes at 10-11 at night. Taleh tries his best, because his shop is the only financial source for his family. Taleh would like to increase his business by diversifying and purchasing more inventory for his shop. Taleh and his family appreciate for your help very much.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Señor Martin S. de 37 años de edad esta felizmente casado hace 10 años con la señora Cristina Benítez de 28 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, el primero está en el segundo grado y el otro en el primer grado.nEl señor Martin se dedica a está actividad desde que tenía 20 años , siendo soltero, luego se casó formando su propio hogar y continuo en el mismo ramo, ademas incursiono tambien a la venta de pescado. Cabe mencionar que el señor dispone de una moto en la cual diariamente sale para ofrecer sus mercaderias cubriendo la zona aledañas a la ciudad.nEl cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, pantalones, ropa interior, sulfa carbón, 25 tetra , apirón, lascamicetina, dolanet, todos medicamentos de venta libre. De esta forma aumentar su stock de mercaderias y asi ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad  de productos a  sus clientes.nnnnnnnnnn
texts.en:
Martin S. is 37 years old and has been happily married for 10 years to Cristina Benítez, 28. The couple have two children, ages 8 and 6. The eldest is in second grade and the youngest in first. Martin has made a living in commerce since he was 20 years old and single, and continued after he got married and started his own household. He has also added fish to his business. It's worth mentioning that Martin has a motorcycle, which he uses daily to offer his merchandise to the surrounding areas of his city. He is requesting the loan to purchase T-shirts, pants, underwear, and various over-the-counter medicines to increase his inventory and offer a wider selection and high-quality products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase T-shirts, jeans, underwear and various over-the-counter medicines.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. It has been hard to provide for her family after she lost her husband and became a widow. She sells bedding, towels, terry cloth robes and other bath accessories in the central city market. Yelena started this venture with the help of her friends who had lent her the amount she needed to get going. 

Yelena has been in business for 8 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 10,000 Grivnas. Monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas. Yelena loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her children. 

We are hoping the current loan of 1,500 Grivnas will help Yelena’s business in this busy season when markets in Kamenka are flooded with potential buyers. Yelena has promptly repaid 25 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Note: this is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: open an additional vending facility and purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es: El  Señor Gaspar de 41 años de edad, esta casado con el Sra. Dionica de 44  años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos el varon ayuda a su padre en el negocio y la nena esta cursando sus estudios primarios.nDon Gaspar es propietario de un taller de vehiculos en el cual se inició en el año 1999, Tambien se dedica a la compra y  venta de vehiculos.  Ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención  que les ofrece a sus clientes, los cuales quedan muy satisfecho  por el buen servicio que él ofrece nDon Gaspar como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio y llegar a abrir una playa de venta de vehiculos.nEl clienta esolicita el préstamo para.la compra de una camioneta para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Gaspar is 41 years of age and is married to Mrs. Dionica, who is 44 years of age. They have two children, a son who helps his father with the business and a younger child who is undergoing his primary education. Don Gaspar owns a vehicle workshop which he started in 1999, and he also focuses on the purchase and sale of vehicles. He already has a well-educated clientele thanks to the good attention that he offers his customers, who are very pleased with the good personal service that Don Gaspar offers. He wants to expand his business and to open a beach for vehicle sales. He asks for a loan for the purchase of a pickup truck for later sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pickup truck

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime V. tiene 22 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Maria Morinigo de 21 años y estan en la dulce espera de su primer hijo.n El cliente tuvo que viajar al exterior en busca de trabajo para juntar un pequeño capital que lo utilizó para iniciar su propia microempresa que se dedica a la venta de ropas, ademas recibe una pequeña ayuda de su hermana que le provee de mercaderias. Actualmente cuenta con 2 años de antiguedad en el rubro y ya tiene clientela formada.n El dinero del prestamo será invertido para la compra de remeras en oferta ya que se inicia la temporada de calor y hay buena venta de dicho producto.n Para nuestro pais; espera que la gente tome mas conciencia de la importancia de trabajar unidos por un mismo objetivo para lograr todas las metas. nn
texts.en:
Jaime V. is 22 years old and is married to Maria Morinigo, 21, and they are happily awaiting their first child. Jaime had to travel to the outer reaches of the country in search of work to raise a small amount of capital, which he used to start his small business selling clothes. He also received a little help from his sister, who provided the merchandise. He currently has been in the trade two years and already has a clientele. The loan will be used to purchase T-shirts since the hot season has started and the shirts are in high demand. Jaime hopes that everyone has more consideration for the importance of working together toward the same objective and achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase T-shirts

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Señor Juan P. tiene 31 años de edad y esta casado con la Señora Antonia Garcete  de 29 años, son padres de un hijo de 5 años.n El cliente se dedica a la fabricación y venta de carbón vegetal, comenzó con un horno de barro y en la actualidad ya cuenta con 10 hornos y produce 20.000 Kg de carbón al mes. Además esta montando una pequeña despensa en su domicilio razón por la cual se acercó a esta institución para solicitar un prestamo, el cual será invertido en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.n Desea un pais con mayores fuentes de trabajo y mayor oportunidad para los jovenes.nnn
texts.en:
Juan P. is 31 years old and married to Antonia Garcete, 29. They are the parents of a 5-year-old son. Juan makes a living making and selling charcoal. He started with a single clay oven and currently accounts for 10 ovens and produces 20,000 kilograms of charcoal a month. Furthermore, he's trying to open a small convenience store in his home, the reason for which he approached our institution in hopes of a loan. He plans to invest in the purchase of products of primary necessity. He wishes for a country with better sources of employment and more opportunities for the youth.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products of primary necessity

loans.name: Safija

texts.en: Safija was born in 1943 and she lives in Orahovica, a village near Gračanica. She is a widow and has no children. She receives 400KM/month (about $265USD) from her husband's retirement pension, which is not enough to meet her basic needs. In order to survive, Safija sells milk and milk products to a local factory. She requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women, International, which she will use to purchase a second cow.  The additional income will help her improve her standard of living, and possibly save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es: La Señora Pabla de 38 años de edad, esta casada hace 12 años con el Sr. Jose Sosa de 43  años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene dos hijos los cuales estan cursando sus estudios primarios. nDoña Pabla es propietaria de una despensa y merceria en el cual se inició en el año 1999. También salen por la campaña a ofrecer sus productos de merceria. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención que les ofrece a sus clientes. En dicho negocio, recibe la ayuda de su Marido quien viaja con las mercaderia para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.nLa sra Pabla como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer mas variedades de productos para que su clientela quede satisfechos con la atención  y los productos que les ofrece.nLa clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias y bebidas en general: arroz, fideos, verduras, frutas y la compra de Granos de maiz, ya que tiene mucha de demanda de dichos productos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Pabla is 38 years old and has been married to Jose Sosa, 43, for 12 years. The couple have two children, both of whom are in elementary school. Pabla owns a general store and haberdashery that she started in 1999. She also goes out to the fields to offer her products. She now has a well-established clientele thanks to her good customer service. Her husband helps her with the business, traveling with products to sell to customers. A personal dream of Pabla's is to expand her business so she can offer a wider variety of products so she can keep her customers satisfied with her service and selection. She is requesting a loan to purchase beverages and general merchandise such as rice, noodles, vegetables, fruits and cornmeal, since those products are in high demand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, rice, noodles, vegetables, fruit and cornmeal

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira was born in 1972. She lives in Lukavac, a small village in Bosnia. She is married and her husband is a coal miner. She has two sons, ages 13 and 16. Elvira raises chickens, and earns about 200KM/month (about $132 USD). Elvira is requesting a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy a computer for her sons. She hopes that the computer will help her sons in school and encourage them to pursue higher education.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela C. de 25 años, esta acompañada por el señor Victor Villalba de 26 años. n   Ellos trabajaban como empleados de una casa de empeños, teniendo un objetivo que es de trabajar por cuenta propia y para ello necesitaban  capital, ahorraron parte de su salario por un buen tiempo, y aproximadamente en el año 2.006 empezaron con la compra y venta de mercaderias; gracias a ese emprendimiento en la actualidad ya tienen su clientela bien formada.n   La solicitud de crédito es para comprar mas mercaderias como: ropas, championes, etc, teniendo en cuenta que la mayor parte de su venta es a crédito.n   Ellos creen que la educación es la base fundamental para el fortalecimiento, crecimientony progreso del pais.   nn
texts.en:
Ms. Graciela C. is 25 years old and is accompanied by Mr. Victor Villalba, who is 26. They used to work in a pawn shop, but they had the goal of working for themselves, so they needed the capital to do so. They saved up a part of their salary for a long time, and around 2006, they began buying and selling merchandise. Thanks to this enterprise, they have a strong client-base. They are requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as clothing, athletic footwear, etc., keeping in mind that they sell most of their products for credit. They believe that education is the fundamental base for the strengthening, the growth, and the progress of their country.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothing and athletic footwear)

loans.name: Nadira

texts.en: Nadira was born in 1974. She lives in Lukavac, a small village in Bosnia. She is married and has two children who are in primary school. Nadira owns and works at a convenience store. She requests a loan of 1,200KM ($800 USD) from Women for Women, International. She will use the loan to buy cigarettes and chewing gum for her store. She expects that by increasing her product offering, she will attract more customers and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes and chewing gum

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es: La Sra. Silvina C. de 27 años, es soltera y  madre de un niño de 3 años.n   Doña Silvina trabajaba como empleada de una empresa, durante mucho tiempo, ella ahorraba parte de su salario con la idea de que algun dia llegara a tener un capital y poder trabajar por cuenta propia, aproximadamente en el año 2004,   decidió emprender su propio negocio de compra y venta de mercaderias varias.n   La solicitud de crédito es para comprar mas mercaderias como: perfumes y ropas, atendiendo que tiene mucha demanda y gracias a la buana atención y precios accecibles ya tiene una clientela bien formada.n   Ella cree que con el esfuerzo, dedicación e inteligencia podemos progresar.nn
texts.en:
Silvina C. is 27 years old, she is single and the mother of a little boy aged 3. Silvina is employed and she has been working for a long time. She saved part of her salary with the idea of one day having enough capital savings to be able to work by her own account. Around the year 2004 she decided to set out and start her own business in purchasing and selling various merchandise. Her request for a loan is for purchasing merchandise such as: perfumes and clothing, because she sees great demand and thanks to her good customer service and affordable prices she has a good clientele base. She believes that with her efforts, dedication and intelligence she will be a success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (perfumes and clothing).

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Señor Luis O.,  de 41 años de edad, vive acompañado con la Sra. Apolinaria Candia, viven en casa propia y  tienen 2 hijos menores en edad escolar.nEl tiene montado un copetín ya hace mas de 3 años, con la venta de comidas frías, tales como empanadas, milanesas, sándwiches y bebidas en  general, cuentas con clientelas bien formadas, ya que el copetín  esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico y bien poblado de la ciudad, gracias a su esfuerzo, y con el ingresos de sus ventas, pueden solventar los gastos de la casa, el estudios de sus hijos y así  elevar su nivel de vida económica.nEl  préstamo solicitado es para la compra de carne, pan, verduras etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis O., 41 years old, lives with Mrs. Apolinaria Candia. They live in their own house and have two young school-aged children. Three years ago he built a deli selling cold meals such as pies, milanesas (breaded meat fillets), sandwiches and drinks in general. He counts on his loyal customers, his shop's strategic location and a well-populated city for his success. Thanks to his hard work and the income from his business they are able to afford their household expenses, their children's studies and improve their economic standing. The loan request is to purchase meat, bread, vegetables and other such items.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, bread, vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Pedro M., tiene 41 años, esta casado con Elsa Franco de 37 años,  la pareja con  5 hijos menores tres de ellos en edad escolar.nViven en casa propia gracias a una herencia que recibió de su abuelo que hoy día es su vivienda y su local de trabajo.  nDesde muy joven trabajo en una carpintería  realizando trabajos   como empleado, viendo la necesidad y las ganas de salir adelante mas aun ya casado y con hijos  en el año 2002,  su abuelo decidió apoyarlo con un capital y así poder montar su propia carpintería.nCon su experiencia y buenos trabajos se pudo hacer muy rápido de una buena cantidad de clientes.n Hoy día gracias al ingreso de su negocio el puede solventar los gastos de la casa y el estudios de sus hijos y  elevar su nivel de vida.nLa solicitud de préstamo obedece a la necesidad de aumentar  el stock de maderas.  Y así brindar  una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro M., 41 years old, is married to Elsa Franco, 37 years old. The couple has five children, three school-aged. They live in their own house thanks to an inheritance received from his grandfather. Today the house is both his home and his workplace. Since he was very young he worked in carpentry working first as an employee. Seeing the need, wanting to get ahead and being married with children, in 2002 his grandfather decided to support and invest in him and that is how he built his own carpentry business. With his experience and hard work he was able to very quickly gain many customers. Today, thanks to the income from his business he is able to afford the household expenses, his children's studies and to improve their quality of life. The loan is needed to increase his lumber supply to provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his lumber supply

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La Sra.  Nilda A. tiene  59  años de edad, esta casada con  el Sr. Antonio Otazu de 63 años de edad, tienen una hija mayor de edad. nElla nos cuenta que  hace  10  años   se dedica a la despensa y panadería, para iniciar el negocio tuvo que vender una propiedad que le había regalado su suegro, con este capital y con el ahorro  que pudieron juntar gracias al  trabajo de su cónyuge como empleado en una  fabrica en Encarnación  comenzaron su negocio, gracias al esfuerzo que emprendieron juntos lograron salir adelante, se ayudan  mutuamente, y con el ingreso de las ventas lograron  pagar los gastos del estudio de su hija, que hoy día ya es una  profesional Docente, quien con su ingreso también ayuda con los gastos de la casa y así poder vivir dignamente. nEl crédito solicitado es para aumentar el stok de arroz, azúcar, fideos etc.  Y así brindar  una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nilda A. is 59 years old, married to Mr. Antonio Otazu, 69 years old, and they have an older daughter together. She tells us that 10 years ago she started a bakery and pantry. In order to start the business she had to sell a property that had been given to her by her stepfather. With this money and what they were able to save thanks to her husband's job in a factory in the city of Encarnación they began their business. Thanks to their hard work together, they managed to get ahead. They helped each other out. And with the income from their sales they managed to pay for the costs for their daughter's studies. Today she is a professional teacher who, with her income, also helps with the household expenses and is able to live with dignity. The loan request is to increase their supply of rice, sugar, noodles, etc. And this will help them to better serve their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods (rice, sugar, noodles, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two grown children. She sells womenu's clothing, bags and purses in the central marketplace in Pavlograd. She has two vending facilities and has been running them successfully for about 12 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnas and her income is about 8,000 Grivnas a month. 

Irina can be characterized as a reliable and stable client. She treats her customers with all due respect and politeness. This business has been the only source of income for her family. Irina has contributed much effort, energy and commitment to success of her venture. She is ready to move on and achieve even higher goals. 

She is seeking a 1500 Grivna loan ($275 USD) to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosks.  

NOTE: This is a short-term, seasonal loan that will be repaid in one month.

loans.use: To purchase bags and purses

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo San Marcos estammos ubicados en el municipio de Danli, nosotras nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntas, somos vecinas de nuestra comunidad, nnuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:nElsa del Carmen S.: soy la coordinadora del grupo me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de comida, venta de refrescos, mi especialidad son las golosinas y los almuerzos, tengos varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad.nAda Linda M. R.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comidas, refrescos. sus clientes son el personal que trabaja en la tabacalera Plasencia, tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y atraves de ella ha logrado adquirir parte de lo que hoy posee en su casa, tambien le ayuda a su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.nEvelyn T.: la actividad de ella es la elaboracion y venta de comidas, este negocio le permite ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa.nTodas nosotras hemos salido adelente durante varios años, esto se debe a la buena administracion que tenemos en nuestos negocios.
texts.en:
Hello, we are from the group San Marcos. We are located in the municipality of Danli. We know each other very well and we have always worked together. We are neighbours in our community and our group is made up as follows: Elsa del Carmen S.: I am the coordinator of the group and I prepare and sell foods, and soft drinks, although my specialty is snacks and breakfasts. I have many years of running this business. Ana Linda M. R.: her occupation is the preparation and the sales of foods and soft drinks. Her clients are the employees of the Plasencia tabacco compnay. She has more than 5 years at this activity and throughout she has managed to acquire part of what is in her home. She also helps her husband to cover the household expenses. Evelyn T.: she prepares and sells foods. This business allows her to help her husband cover the household expenses. All of us have been able to make it past many difficult years, and this is thanks to the sound administration of our businesses.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foods.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Senderos De Luz Group

texts.es: Hola nosotras somos el grupo Senderos de Luz, estamos ubicadas en el municipio de Las Trojes, nosotras siempre hemos trabajado juntas ya que somos vecinas de nuestra comunidad, nuestro grupo se integra asi:nSandra Suyapa V.: soy coordinadora del grupo, me dedico a la venta de verduras y golosinas, actividad que tengo de realizar hace 3 años, este negocio me permite tener ganancias para contribuir con los gastos de mi hogar.nMaria B.: ella y su esposo cuentan con un foto estudio, tienen varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos y necesitan varios materiales para poder sacar adelante a su negocio.nJuana R.: la actividad principal de ella es el comercio, ella vende ropa americana, tambien vende rosquillas y pan, ella tiene 2 años de estar haciendo esta actividad, este negocio le brinda los recursos economicospara contribuir con los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros adquiridos, ella no cuenta con capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de ropa.ntodas necesitamos un credito para poder capitalizarnos y asi invertir en nuestros negocios, tambien queremos implementar nuevos servicios que nos generen muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Senderos de Luz (Paths of Light) group, we are located in the municipality of Las Trojes. We have always worked together as we are neighbours in our community. That is how our group formed. Sandra Suyapa V.: I am the group coordinator. I sell vegetables and sweets and have been doing so for three years. The business' profits allow me to help with the household expenses. Maria B.: She and her husband have a photo studio. They have had it for several years. This is their only source of income and they need some materials in order to improve their business. Juana R.: She is in sales. She sells American clothing. She also sells donuts and bread. She has been doing this for two years. The business gives her the economic means to contribute to family expenses and other financial commitments. She does not have the money to invest in buying clothes. We need the loan to be able to invest in ourselves and in our businesses. Also, we want to offer new services that would generate good income.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food, clothing and materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Futuro Presente Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Futuro Presente todas somos mujeres nos llevamos muy bien, somos muy luchadoras y tenemos muchas ganas de superanos, somos vecinas cercanas y tenemos mucha experiencia en lo que hacemos, nuestro grupo se integra de esta manera:nDoris F.: soy la coordinadora del grupo me dedico a la venta de ropa, compro fardos de ropa americana, tengo 4 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, en estos momentos necesito comprar varios fardos de ropa ya que esta temporada es muy buena y las ventas son excelentes por la navidad.nMaria M.: ella es una señora de la tercera edad, ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, en estos momentos ella necesita comprar frutas de la temporada como ser uvas, manzanas y bananos ya que son buena venta para estos ultimos meses del año,.nFrancisca R.: ella es una señora que vende tortillas desde hace varios años, ella necesita el credito para arreglar su lugar de trabajo, remodelar el fogon y las planchas donde prepara las tortillas.ntodas necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
Hello! We are members of the Futuro Presente (Present Future) group. We are all women and get along well. We are hard-working women with the desire for self-improvement. We are neighbors and have many years of experience doing what we do. Our group is comprised of the following members: Doris F.: “I am the coordinator of the group. I sell clothing, purchasing bundles of American apparel. I have been in the business for 4 years. At this time, I need to purchase several bundles of clothing because sales are excellent during the Christmas season.” Maria M. is an elderly woman who makes and sells tortillas. At this time, she needs to purchase seasonal fruits like grapes, apples and bananas because they are good products to sell during the last months of the year. Francisca R. is a woman who has been selling tortillas for several years. She needs the loan in order to repair her workplace, and remodel the wood burning stove and griddles on which she prepares the tortillas. “We all need a loan in order to help move our businesses forward.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, corn and fruit

loans.name: Un Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Un Nuevo Amanecer somos tres señoras muy entusiastas, responsables y muy luchadoras con muchos deseos de mejorar en nuestros negocios y nuestra calidad de vida.nnuestras actividades son las siguientes:nGloria M.: soy la coordinadora del grupo me dedico a la venta de mercaderia, mi proposito al solicitar un credito es para mejorar mis ganancias y asi mismo ayudarle a mi esposo con el sustento de nuestros hijos. nMariela M.: ella vende mercaderia y productos para uso personal, ella necesita el credito para ampliar mas su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.nYeny E.: ella se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de donas, ella su producto lo vende en un puente peatonal que es muy utilizado por muchas personas, este es un punto clave para la venta de su producto.ntodas necesitamos el credito para salir adelante con nuestras familias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Un Nuevo Amanecer (A New Dawn) group. We are three very enthusiastic, responsible, and hard-working women with the desire to improve both our businesses and our quality of life. We have the following businesses: Gloria M., “I am the coordinator of the group. I sell goods for a living.
