My aim in requesting this loan is to increase profits, thus I can help my husband to support our children.” Mariela M. sells products for personal use and other goods. She needs the loan in order to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Yeny E. makes and sells donuts for a living. She sells her goods on a footbridge that is very frequented by pedestrians. This is a prime location for donut sales. “We all need this loan in order to get ahead with our families.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo la Esperanza, una caracteristica principal de nuestro grupo es que somos muy amigas las tres, eso nos hace ser un grupo fuerte ya que nunca nos hemos separado y todas nos ayudamos mutuamente, somos muy luchadoras y tenemos muchos deseos de salir adelante, nuestro proposito al solicitar un credito es para ampliar y mejorar nuestros respectivos negocios, pues tenemos demanda, tenemos clientes fijos, todas somos personas honestas, dueñas de nuestras viviendas, tambien somos madres de familia.nSenia S.: soy la coordinadora del grupo y me dedico a la venta de mercaderia, Maria A. ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y Maria L. se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos.n
texts.en:
Hello! We are a group called "La Esperanza" (Hope). An important feature of our group is that the three of us are very good friends. This makes our group strong, since we have always been together and we all help each other out. We are very determined and we really want to get ahead. Our reason for requesting a loan is to increase and improve our respective businesses. We have demand, we have established clients, we are very honest people, we are the owners of our homes, and we are also mothers. I, Senia S., am the coordinator of the group and I sell merchandise. Maria A. sells sweets, and Maria L. sells clothes and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilia Magaly

texts.es: Con todo este año de experiencia en la venta de ropa por pedido, la señora Lilia, de 37 años, es la madre de 3 pequeños niños, de 16, 12 y 7 años de edad. Al cursar todos sus hijos el colegio, son su fortaleza para no claudicar a pesar de la dura competencia en el rubro. Ella sabe que parte esencial de un eventual éxito es con cuánto capital puede contar para su abastecimiento de ropa y posterior venta, teniendo como clara meta darle a sus hijos una sólida educación, de la mano con su esposo en casa, para lo cual lucha día a día en pos de lograrlo.nnPara ello, necesita de un préstamo de 400 soles, porque su sueño es llevado por la perseverancia y responsabilidad, gran legado que deja explícito hacia sus hijos.n
texts.en:
For the last year, Lilia, 37 years old and the mother of three children (ages 16, 12, and 7), has sold clothing. Because she is committed to sending her children to school, she has persevered despite tough competition in her field. She knows that an essential part of her future success depends on how much capital she has to invest in maintaining a supply of clothes. She and her husband have a clear goal of giving their children a solid education, and they work hard every day in order to achieve it. To help them accomplish their goal, she requests a loan of $150. Fulfilling her dream will take perseverance and responsibility, values that she will pass on to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on clothing for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Vuelo De Un Aguila Group

texts.es: nosotras somos el grupo vuelo de un Aguila, todas somos mujeres, nos llevamos muy bien, tenemos una amistad muy fuerte y tenemos muchos deseos de superarnos.nBelinda S.: soy la coordinadora del grupo me dedico a la venta de ropa clasificada desde hace dos años, yo le ayudo a mi esposo con el sustento de nuestro hogar ya que tenemos tres hijos por sacar adelante.nNubia S.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de baleadas, ella tiene mucha demanda con las ventas de las baleadas ya que esta es una comida muy popular en nuestro pais y se come mucho en el desayuno.nLina B.: ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, su negocio lo tiene en un lugar muy estrategico, ella es madre soltera y de ella dependen sus hijos, ella necesita surtir mas su negocio para cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.ntodas estamos comprometidas con el sustento de nuestros hogares y necesitamos salir adelante, ya que la situacion en nuestro pais es muy dificil, por eso solicitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
We are part of the Vuelo de un Aguila (Flight of an Eagle) group. We are all women and we get along well. We have a very strong friendship and the desire for self-improvement. Belinda S.: “I am the group coordinator and have been selling used clothing for two years. I help my husband with the household expenses because we have 3 children that we need to help get ahead.” Nubia S. makes and sells baleadas—a wheat flour tortilla filled with beans and other ingredients—for a living because it is a very popular breakfast food in our country. Lina B. sells basic need items in her strategically-located business. She is a single mother whose children depend on her. She needs to restock her business in order to meet her customers’ demands. “We are all committed to maintaining our households, and we need to get ahead in life because we have a very difficult situation in our country. For this reason, we are requesting a loan in order to help our businesses move forward.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Hace 2 años que la señora Olga cuenta con un puesto donde expende salchipapa en la parte exterior de su casa. Con 30 años, la señora Olga tiene 4 menores hijos por los cuales velar junto con su esposo (de12, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad); por lo que su puesto no se da abasto para poder solventar la adecuada crianza y educación de sus hijos. Sin embargo, es más que perseverante la labor que realiza y mantiene sus sueños intactos, suyos y de sus hijos.nPara ello necesita de un préstamo de 600 soles, los cuales le brindarían una oportunidad de relanzar su negocio, proveyéndole de mayores ganancias y, por ende, de una mejor calidad de vida para los suyos.n
texts.en:
For the last two years, Olga has sold hot dogs and French fries from a stand at her home. Thirty years old, Olga has four children (ages 12, 6, 4, and 2) whom she takes care of with her husband. Her stand does not currently provide an adequate income to raise and educate her children. However, she is sure that working persistently she will realize both her dreams and those of her children. To accomplish this, she requests a loan of $200. The loan will give her the opportunity to relaunch her business and increase earnings, therefore providing a greater quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finance the supplies necessary for a hot dog and French fries stand

loans.name: Reina Dayse

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Reina F. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, soy una persona trabajadora, honesta y responsable. este negocio es muy bueno ya que la tortilla es un aliemento escencial en nuestro pais, la tortilla se come en los tres tiempos, ademas que es un alimento nutritivo. en estos momentos mi demanda es mucha y no me doy abasto con todo lo que produzco por tal razon estoy solicitando un credito para comprarme un molino electrico y asi poder moler mas maiz para tener mas masa y poder hacer muchas tortillas, esto me ahorra tiempo y esfuerzo ya que en estos momentos muelo el maiz con molino manual.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Reina F.. For several years I have made and sold tortillas. I am a hardworking, honest, and responsible person. This is a great business because tortillas are an essential and nutritious food in our country, eaten throughout the year. Right now, what I can produce cannot keep up with the high demand. For this reason, I am asking for a loan to buy an electric grinder. That way I can grind more corn to make more dough and be able to produce more tortillas. This will save me time and effort, since I currently grind the corn by hand.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an electric grinder

loans.name: Luz Amparito

texts.es: Con sólo 24 años de edad, la señora Amparito cuenta con un alma emprendedora, muestra de ello es los 2 negocios que tiene, ambos con su respectivo local: boutique y restaurante. Viviendo con su menor hijo de 4 años y siendo madre soltera, la señora Olga no deja de denotar esfuerzos en ambos negocios, que tienen 4 meses de ya implementados adecuadamente. Debido al Mercado que se encuentra en la zona, la competencia es grande y le depara mucho esfuerzo porque está al tanto de ambos negocios a la par.nEn pro de financiar ambos negocios y poder asegurarle a su hijo lo mejor y, más aún, a portas de su inicio escolar, es que necesita del préstamo de 600 soles.n
texts.en:
At the young age of 24, Mrs. Amparito already has an entrepreneurial soul. She is the owner of 2 businesses - a boutique and a restaurant - each with their own seperate location. Mrs. Amparito is a single mother who lives with her 4 children, and she is hardworking with both of her businesses that have each been operating successfully for about 4 months. Competition is fierce in the area that she works, and she must continually work hard to keep up with the conditions of the market. She has solicited a loan of 600 soles so that she can finance both of her businesses, and in turn be able to provide the best for her youngest son as he begins to start school.

Translated from Spanish by michelle kreger, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food + goods for her restaurant,  and to capitalize her boutique.

loans.name: Francisco Arturo

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Francisco Arturo L. me dedico a la venta de muebles para cocina, muebles para microondas, comodas, desayunadores etc. mis clientes me prefieren ya que les gusta como les atiendo ya que soy una persona muy amable, creo que esa es mi cualidad primordial, tengo muchos deseos de superarme y por tal razon estoy solicitando credito, tengo una hogar que mantener y tengo una hija. estoy casado. cuento con dos empleados que me ayudan a distribuir los articulos que vendo, mi producto lo vendo al contado y al credito.n
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Francisco Arturo L.. I sell kitchen cabinets, microwave hutches, breakfast bars, etc. My customers prefer me because they like my service. I am very pleasant, which I think is my prime quality. I have the desire for self-improvement, and it is for this reason that I am requesting a loan. I have a household and a daughter to support. I am married and have two employees who help me distribute the products that I sell for cash and credit.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dora Carolina

texts.es: Con 4 años de puesto su local de productos naturistas en un mercado cercano a su casa, la señora Dora, de 37 años, ve incrementar sus ganancias debido a lo productivo del negocio y a las pocas tiendas que expenden dicho producto. Con sus 2 hijos (de 13 y 2 años de edad) vive en casa y es por ellos que pone tanto empeño en su negocio en pos de asegurar su porvenir (el de sus hijos).nA sabiendas de lo fructífera que es usualmente la venidera temporada de fiestas navideñas, la señora Dora requiere de 800 soles en aras de solventar su negocio, invertir y sacar los réditos correspondientes para asegurar y optimizar en cuanto se pueda la calidad de vida, suya y de sus hijos.n
texts.en:
With 4 years running her natural health product stand in a market near her house, Ms. Dora, age 37, has seen an increase in her profits because of how productive her business is and because of the scarcity of health supply stores. She lives with her two children (ages 13 and 2) in a house. It is for them that she puts so much effort into her business in order to assure their future. Knowing full well how fruitful the holiday season usually is, Ms. Dora needs 800.00 PEN in the interest of settling the debts of the business, investing in it, and producing the corresponding revenues in order to assure and optimize her and her children’s quality of life as much as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital for natural health product shop

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: hola mi nomnbre es Maria Manzanares me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, tengo 27 años y estoy casada, mi esposo trabaja como albañil, con el hemos procreado 4 hijos los que estan en edad escolar y mantenemos los dos juntos.ntengo dos años de experiencia en la venta de tortillas, las cuales solo las vendo por encargo lo que hace que tenga muy buena clientela y tenga mi producto vendido todo el tiempo, estoy ubicada en el barrio Buenos Aires.nen estos momentos necesito el credito ya que necesito comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de mis tortillas pero todo ha aumentado de precio y ahora es mas dificil comprar las cosas, tambien necesito cambiar los utencilios en donde tengo mi produccion de tortillas ya que estan viejos y me dan problemas para hacer mi producto.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Manzanares. I make and sell tortillas. I'm 27 years old and I'm married. My husband is a builder. We have 4 children who are currently going to school and together we take care of them. I have 2 years experience in selling tortillas which I only sell through special requests from all my clients. I sell them right away. I live in the barrio called Buenos Aires. I'm requesting a loan at this time because I need to purchase basic ingredients in order to make tortillas. Prices have gone up and now it's more difficult to buy these things, and I would also like to change the pots/pans that I use since they are very old and don't work very well.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase logs, corn, water and matches

loans.name: Nilda Segunda

texts.es: De 52 años de edad, la señora Nilda tiene 3 de ellos invertidos en una pequeña tienda ambientada dentro de su hogar. Sabe que son tiempos difíciles, ella y su familia en sí, por lo que su hija de 18 años va tras la misma meta que ella: mejorar su calidad de vida, lo cual se explicita en que ella estudia y trabaja para poder darle una mano en casa a su señora madre: la señora Nilda. Al ser su zona rural y pobre, las ventas no son muy buenas pero ella quiere dar abasto en cuanto pueda a su barrio con relación a los productos que expende.nnTeniendo en cuenta que con mientras más capital cuente más serán sus posteriores ganancias, es que requiere de un préstamo de 250 soles, lo que le permitiría acariciar tan merecida calidad de vida que aún no goza.n
texts.en:
Nilda, 52, has been working for three years in a small grocery store she runs out of her home. She and her family know that these are tough times financially, so Nilda and her 18-year-old daughter work hard towards the same goal: improve their quality of life. Nilda's daughter goes to school and holds a job to help her mother with the household expenses. Sales on the store are not very good, because Nilda lives in a poor, rural area, but she wants to provide the products that her customers need. Since a larger investment will in turn create larger profits, Nilda is requesting a loan of 250 soles to invest in purchasing wholesale products to restock her store and, more importantly, to reach for the better quality of life that Nilda and her family deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wholesale products to restock small store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Artemia

texts.es: Con sus 50 años D. edad, la señora María dedicó 15 años a ser empleada del hogar, lo que la distanciaba D. su hija menor, actualmente D. 21 años, por lo que desD. comienzos D. año se dedica a lo que antes era un hobbie o recurso al momento D. hacer regalos a familiares: tejidos D. ropa y accesorios. A pesar D. la insistencia D. sus hijos, los mayores y la menor que aún la acompaña, ella sigue firme en el negocio aunque le es esencial poder invertir más en aras D. incrementar sus ganancias, para poder concretar una añoranza suya: poner un taller donD. actualmente vive e irse a vivir al terreno que 1 D. sus hijas le acaba D. comprar (lo que en sí mejoraría su calidad D. vida en todo ámbito –actualmente su casa queda en faldas D. un cerro y por la edad ya no le es tan fácil el acceso a ésta-).nnDicha realidad se hiciera más cercana D. poder obtener un préstamo D. 500 soles, financiando así una compra importante D. material a utilizar en la confección D. su arte.n
texts.en:
Of her 50 years of life, María dedicated 15 to being a maid, which distanced her from her youngest daughter, who is now 21 years old. Because of this, since the beginning of the year she has dedicated herself to what used to be a hobby or last minute resource to make family gifts: hand-woven clothing and accessories. Despite her children's insistence, the older ones and the youngest still accompany her. María remains firm in her business although the most important thing is being able to invest more in methods of increasing her earnings, so that she can start saving money. She would like to open a workshop where she currently lives and go to live on the land that one of her daughters just purchased (which would in itself improve her quality of life in all respects--currently her house is on the siD. of a mountain, and due to her age it is not easy to access it). A 500 soles loan would move her closer to this desire. The loan would finance an important purchase of materials used in the production of her art.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make hand-woven cloth.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CESAR TRABAJA PARA UNA EMPRESA BIEN ESTABLECIDA, SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GLORIA ES AMA DE CASA YA QUE SE DEDICA AL CUIDADO DE SU PEQUEÑO BEBE. ELLOS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UNA BARDA PARA MAYOR SEGURIDAD DE LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar works for a well established factory, his wife, Gloia is a housewife now that she is dedicated to the care of their small baby. They are asking for this loan for the construction of a house to improve the security of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a fence

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JUAN CARLOS Y LA SEÑORA BIRIDIANA SON PERSONAS CON UN GRAN SENTIDO DE RESPONSABILIDAD PARA TENER UN MEJOR MODO DE VIDA; ELLOS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA REMODELAR EL PISO DE SU HOGAR MEDIANTE LA COLOCACION DEL VITROPISO .
texts.en:
Juan Carlos and Biridiana feel very responsible about improving their quality of life. They are requesting this loan in order to remodel the floor in their home by installing new floor tile.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor Remodel

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Con 33 años de edad, la señora Rosa es promotora en el rubro de artículos de limpieza para el hogar en un trabajo mancomunado con su familia. El trabajo es más que arduo pero es el sustento de su casa, de sus 2 menores hijos, 1 por entrar al colegio y el otro ya estudiando. En casa, convive con su esposo y papá. La señora Rosa es consciente de la gran competencia existente en el rubro y de lo importante que es el invertir en grandes cantidades de mercadería en aras de abaratar los costos e incrementar las ganancias, augurando así una calidad de vida más decente y próspera para su familia y para sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son su más grande preocupación y adoración.nnCon el ánimo de obtener más ganancias, que obtendría de poder invertir una suma importante en la compra de su mercadería, la señora Rosa necesita de un préstamo de 800 soles.n
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa, who is 33 years old, runs a family business selling home cleaning products. The job is highly demanding but provides the family’s means of support, which includes her 2 youngest sons, 1 of whom is about to start school and the other of whom is already studying. She also lives with her husband and father. Mrs Rosa is aware of the highly competitive nature of the field in which she works and of the importance in investing in large amounts of merchandise with the aim of reducing costs and increasing profits. In doing this, she anticipates a more respectable and prosperous quality of life for her family and 2 younger children who are her greatest concern and adoration. If Mrs Rosa is to increase her profits, which she intends to achieve by investing a substantial amount of money into buying merchandise, she will need a loan of 800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise that will later be sold: home cleaning products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Haseena Fateh M.khan Group

texts.en:
Haseena baji, the wife of F. M. K., lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 28 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is in the 9th standard grade. Her younger son is in the 3rd standard grade. Her eldest daughter is in the 7th standard grade, and her younger daughter is in the 5th standard grade. 

Haseena baji's husband has a scrap business and has been in this business for the past 5 years. Haseena baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (iron, wasted papers and plastic bottles) to expand her husband's scrap business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Mahjabeen baji wants a loan to buy warm clothes to sell in the market. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Farzana Manzoor Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Farzana Manzoor baji, the wife of Z. I., lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 18 years. She is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Farzana baji's husband drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Farzana baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Razia baji wants a loan to repair her truck which she uses for hauling fruits and vegetables. Naheed baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rukhsana Naheed Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Naheed baji is the wife of A. S. and resides in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 12 years. She is the mother of two daughters and one son. Her son runs his own grocery shop in the community. Her two daughters are still attennding school. For the past 5 years, Rukhsana bajis husband has owned a tea stall in the community. Rukhsana baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

She has successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy tea and sugar for her husband's tea stall. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy new items for her grocery shop. Irshad baji and Fahmida baji each are requesting a loan to buy more clothes for their clothing business. Farzana baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy tea and sugar for tea stall

loans.name: Chrouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrouk Chaung, 62, and her husband, Mr. Chhy Den, 69,  live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1963 and have six children; four sons and two daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. The fifth daughter, who is a widow, the youngest son, a grand child all live in the family home.

Mrs. Chrouk and her husband have been farming for a long time. They grow vegetables such as cucumbers and green beans, on their farm land. They sell their products to a middle man who takes them to a Phnom Penh market to sell.

Chrouk is requesting a loan of $700. She will use some of it to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for farming. With the remainder, she will buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for farming, and purchase a motorbike for her children drive to work.

loans.name: Sakina Ishaq Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of I. A. and has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her elder son sells undergarments and her second oldest son has a poultry farm.The two younger sons are still in school. Sakina baji is a nurse that works in a clinic earning a monthly wage.

Sakina baji is applying for a loan to purchase more chickens to expand her sons poultry farm business. She is joined in her loan group by other members. Yasmeen baji is requesting a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. Razia baji is requesting a loan to buy electronic appliances (fridge and Television) on installments. Razia baji is requesting a loan to buy eggs, cooking oils and vegetables for her food stall.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for poultry farm

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov N., 49, and her husband, Mr. Choeun Pol, 67, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. The children are all married and live outside the family house.

Mrs. Pov and her husband have been in the business of selling bananas since 2003. They buy them from farmers in their village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a soldier as well.

Mrs. Pov is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase bananas for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mr. S. Bun, 39, and his wife, Mrs. Saven Doung, 40,  live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. Three of their children study in the local school and help their parents to grow banana trees and flowers when they have free time from school. The youngest son is still young and stays at home. 

Mr. Bun S. and his wife have been selling bananas for over ten years. They buy them from farmers in their village and from nearby villagers, and resell them at a market in Phnom Penh. Beside growing bananas, they also grow flowers. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale

loans.name: Sombo

texts.en:
Mrs. Sombo M., 30, and her husband, Mr. Ratha Phann, 42, were married in 1996 and have three daughters. Two of them study in local school and the youngest stays at home.

Mrs. Sombo has been selling fishes and vegetables for 12 years. She buys them in Ta Khmao market for selling. Her husband has been working in Angkor Beer Company for 15 years.

Mrs. Sombo lacks the money to buy a motorbike for carrying fishes to sell. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase one motorcycle for transporting fishes.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle to carry fishes for selling.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mr. Tol S., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Saros Sen, 38, were married in 1983, and have six children, four sons and two daughters. The oldest son is a fisherman, three children study in local school, one child is a weaver, and one child stays at home. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Tol and his wife have been fishing for over 30 years. He learned his skill from his grandparents when he was young. They fish from Mekong River and lakes near the village at the west of National Road Number Six and sell in the village market.

Mr. Tol is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Yousos

texts.en:
Mr. Yousos K., 36, (shown in the picture on the right) is single and lives with his sister's family and their parents. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. His sister and her husband are fisherman.

Mr. Yousos and his family members have been fishing since they were young. They do fishing from the Mekong River and the lake near their village. Besides fishing, Yousos assists his neighbor selling chickens to get extra income.

Mr. Yousos is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one boat motor and fishing nets for fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Ousman

texts.en:
Mr. Ousman S., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Chariyas Tort, 47, were married in 1985 and have six children. The first child, 22, is a disabled person. Two children raise cows, two children study in local school, and the youngest child is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Ousman has been fishing since he was young, a skill he learned from his grandparents. He does fishing from Mekong River and his wife sells the fish in the village market.

Mr. Ousman is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase one boat motor and fishing nets for fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Tiyum

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiyum M. (pictured with her son), 54, is a widow with two children. The children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Tiyum M. has been fishing since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. She does fishing from Mekong River and sells them in her village.

Mrs. Tiyum is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivet E., 59, is a widow with two children one son and one daughter. The first child is a garment worker and the second child was married and lives outside the family home. The family live in a small village off of National Road Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh

Mrs. Sivet has been growing rice and vegetables since she was young. Now she has created another job cutting grass to sell for cow feed. She is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase zinc to roof her house.

loans.use: To purchase zinc to roof her house.

loans.name: Sarum Ket's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum K. (pictured on the right, with her group member on the left) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The group members live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum, 54, and her husband, Mr. Yat Sun, 61, were married in 1979 and have six children, four sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Two sons are silk weavers and one son raise cows. Her two daughters have full time employment in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum has been weaving since she was 21 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mrs. Sarum is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to run her weaving business.

The other group member, Mrs. Sary K., 47 has been married for over 13 years to Mr. Vat So, 63. They have four children, two sons and two daughters, who all study in local school.

Mrs. Sary has been weaving since she was 13 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband does farming. He grows corns and tomatoes.

Mrs. Sary is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to run her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Gulzar Qasim Ali Group

texts.en: Gulzar baji is the wife of Q. A. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great Punjabi Sufi poet “Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar”. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of eight children: five sons and three daughters. Her elder son is a fruit seller. The next to him is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Gulzar baji’s husband has a cloth selling business and has been selling clothes for the past 8 years. Gulzar baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s cloth selling business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Haleema baji and Sharman baji and Seeran baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Saima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam On N. is a villager in Smaong Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder.

Her business is going well and she therefore wants to expand her work. She is now requesting a loan so she can buy eight more piglets and food for her current stock.

Her husband Mr. Long Chem is a construction worker and farmer.

Mrs. Sam On N. is 37 years old and the mother of four children. All of the children attend the local school.

Mr. Long Chem is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarith M. was born in 1961. She lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province.

She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice, which is how she earns a living. On her plantation, she faces a small problem - her field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sarith M. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband Mr. Oem Sareth helps his wife on the plantation.

Mrs. Sarith M. has four children. They all attend the local school.

Mr. Oem Sareth is presented on the left photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her farm

loans.name: Zikran M.fazil Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of M. and has resided in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 25 years. Pakpattan is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkaru. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters and all of them are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Zikran bajis husband has been running a grocery shop in the community for the past 4 years. Zikran baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Zikran baji has successfully repaid her prior two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zubaida baji is requesting a loan to buy tools to fix electronic items (tube lights and switches). Majeedan baji is requesting a loan to buy milk for her milk selling business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yein

texts.en:
Mrs. Yein C. lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer.

Mrs. Yein C. has difficulty cultivating her crop because her soil is not fertile. Therefore, she has decided to request a loan so she can buy fertilizers to support her field so it produces a better crop.

Her husband Mr. Sam Phen assists his wife on the current plantation.

Mrs. Yein C. is 33 years old and the mother of one child. Her child is enrolled in the local school.

Mr. Sam Pehn is pictured on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun N. is a villager in Chi Chrab Village in Takeo Province. She works in a garment factory. Her husband Mr. Sorn Sarom is a famer.

Since Mrs. Yoeun N.'s work place is far from home, she spends a lot of money on transportation. She wants to start saving money and reducing her expenses. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy a motorbike. In the long run, this will allow her to save money.

Mrs. Yoeun N. is 22 years old. She is the mother of one child. Her child is only five months old.

Mr. Sorn Sarom is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy N. lives in Chi Chrab Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer. She earns most of her money when she harvests her crop and receives revenue in January.

Unfortunately, she faces a problem on her plantation because her field is not fertile. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy fertilizers to support the field. This will allow her to grow a more productive crop.

Mrs. Phy N. is a 34-year-old widow. She has four children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field

loans.name: Roath

texts.en:
Mrs. Roath T. was born in 1981. She now lives in Ream Andeik Village in Takeo Province.

She owns a small piece of land on which she plants rice so she can earn a living. Her husband Mr. Loem Kong is a duck breeder.

Although Mrs. Roath T. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Roath T. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to eventually increase her income by selling her cow.

Mrs. Roath T. has three children. Her youngest child is only a year old and too young to work or study. Two of the children attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pov S. is a villager in Phngeas Village in Takeo Province.

She is a rice farmer. She harvests her field and therefore earns most of her revenue in February. Her husband Mr. Nop Koeurn is a pig breeder. Since the pig-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Srey Pov S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for the business. With the rest of the loan amount, she will buy fertilizers to help support her field and make the soil more fertile.

Mrs. Srey Pov S. is 31 years old. She is the mother one child. Her child is only four years old and too young to work or study.

Mr. Nop Koeurn is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizers

loans.name: Chhil

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhil S. lives in Trapaing Sdork Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she gathers her rice revenue every January. Her husband, Mr. Loem Chorl, is a laborer who can only make a small income to support his family. They have two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because that child is five.

Although Mrs. Chhil S. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family and improve their living conditions. In order to do that, Mrs. Chhil S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarann T. was born in 1947. She now lives in Kruos Village in Takeo Province.

She is a farmer who cultivates rice. She harvests her crop and earns most of her revenue every January. Unfortunately, she now faces a hurdle because the soil on her plantation is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Sarann T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer so she can support her field and make her crop more productive.

She has four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory. The youngest child is enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao H. is a villager in Thaom Ney Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who grows rice. She harvests her crop and earns her revenue every January.

Her husband Mr. H. Kosal is a fisherman who earns a small income to help support his family.

Although Mrs. Mao H. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family. In order to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Mao H. has decided to ask for a loan to start a new business. She would like to buy a buffalo for breeding. She hopes to increase her income by eventually selling the buffalo.

Mrs. Mao H. is 40 years old and the mother of four children. All of the children attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding.

loans.name: Truy

texts.en:
Mr. Truy V. lives in Sream Chieng Village in Kampong Cham Province. He has a hectar on which he cultivates rice, which allows him to earn a living. He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.

His wife Mrs. Phal Svoeun helps him on the plantation.

Mr. Truy V. is 37 years old and the father of four children. Three of the children attend the local school. The youngest child is only two months old.

His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his field

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. is a villager in Sream Chieng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns one hectar on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, she now faces a problem because she cannot cultivate the rice because she does not have any cows to help her plow her field.

Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizers to help support the field and make her crops more productive.

Her husband Mr. Suon Sam Oeurn is a palm juice collector. He gathers the palm juice to produce palm sugar.

Mrs. Phalla S. is 28 years old and the mother of two children. The children attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to help plow the field and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Chan Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Tha S. is a villager in Ampil Tvea Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder who is raising around 1000 ducks. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy food to feed her ducks. She is a 45-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is working in a garage while the other is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise and food to feed her ducks

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun C. is a villager in Khnar Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a recyclables collector who can buy empty bottles, cans, plastic …etc to re-sell in recycling factory for an income. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more waste things to re-sell and she hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Sor Phoeurn, assists his wife business. Mrs. Aun C. is 43 years old and the mother of two children one of whom helps the parents while the youngest one is attending the local school. A man who is on the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to buy more rrecyclable things to re-sell

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en: Rohat is a mother of 2 wonderful kids. For several years she has sewn bed sheets and pillowslips. Her son, who sells women's clothing at the market, sells his mom's sewing. Her husband works as a driver and doesn't make much money, so her business is very helpful to support their family. She wants to take a loan for expanding her business and pay for her son's wedding someday.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn P. was born in 1960 and now lives in Sdok Thom Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn his living. On his plantation he now faces a small problem because his field is infertile and this is affecting his crop.

To deal with this problem, he decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Mach Mon, assists him on the plantation. She is pictured here on the left of the photo.

Mr. Sorn P. is the father of nine children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while six others are attending the local school. The youngest one is staying at home because the child is too young for school.  .

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Mrs. Sry Y. lives in Kradas Village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a hectare of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. On her plantation she now faces a problem because her soil is infertile and this is having a bad effect on her crop.

To solve this problem, Mrs. Sry Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make her crop more productive. Mrs. Sry Y. is a 44-year-old widow with three children.  One is employed in a garment factory while another is a palm juice collector who gathers it to produce palm sugar and wine.  The youngest child is enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Srorn O. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who has a hectare of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Sen Nan, is a farmer and pig breeder. He is shown here on the left of the photo.

On their plantation, Mrs. Srorn O. and her husband are facing an obstacle because their soil is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Srorn O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her field, and she will use the rest of the money to buy pig food for her husband's pigs. 

Mrs. Srorn O. is 33 years old and the mother of four children. Two of the children are enrolled in the local school. The other two are too young for school, as one is four years old and the youngest is five months.  

.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field's soil, and buy pig food for her husband's pigs.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Aside from this plantation, she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. 

Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Yang Sok, is a breeder who is raising two pigs and cows. He is pictured on the right of the photo.

Mrs. Sem S. is 30 years old and the mother of four children. Three children are enrolled in the local school and the youngest is two years of age.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep stock and re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Mrs. Nob C. is a farmer in Chi Neang Village in Kampong Cham Province. On her plantation, she can earn a small income from her small piece of land. She now wants to expand her rice revenue so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice. Mrs. Nob C. is a 53-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Mrs. Kin P. is a villager in Sras Pring Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land used to grow rice. On her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate. 

To solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make her crop more productive. 

Her husband, Mr. Run Mao, is 35 years old and is pictured here on the right of the photo.  She is the mother of two children.  One child is attending the local school and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nhy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy C. is a villager in Andoung Samrith village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her income. She is currently facing an obstacle in earning enough money for her needs.

Her husband, Mr. Yin Samorn, is a construction worker and does not earn much money.  Therefore Mrs. Nhy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living standard with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of two children.  Two are employed in a garment factory and the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en: T. is a nurse by training but she is has decided to go into business. T. sells medicine, provisions, drinks and bottled water. Where T. resides, in Lagos, is a developing community so, as a health worker, she organizes health seminars for the local women on how to live healthy lives. T. buys goods in small batches but the demand for her provisions and drinks are high and she wants to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan to buy more provisions and drinks in bulk. T. is 34 years old and is married with three children. Her children are all in a private school in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicine and provisions to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells juice and noodles. She has been in this business for a long time. Charity buys the juice and noodles from a company and she sells it later in wholesale and retail to her customers. Charity needs the loan to purchase more juice and noodles to sell.  Charity is 44 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more juice and noodles to sell

loans.name: Nann

texts.en:
Mrs. Nann M. is a villager in Andoung Samreth Village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice to earn her living. She faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and far from the irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to request a loan to buy a pump to water her field and make her crop more productive. 

Her husband, Mr. Mey Chock, recharges batteries to earn money. Mrs Nann M. is 25 years old and does not yet have a child.

loans.use: To buy a pump to water her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 50 years old and married with four children. Grace sells drinks and foodstuffs and she has been in this business since 2004. Her children assist her in selling drinks and foodstuffs, and they do not attend school. She buys foodstuffs from the village market and sells to her customers through retail. She buys her drinks from distributors in Lagos. Grace needs the loan amount of 70000 Naira to buy more drinks directly from the company at a reduced rate. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support, and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and is married with four children. She is a qualified nurse but she resigned because she wanted to have more time for her husband and children. Mary, in her spare time, organizes health seminars for women in her locality and enlightens them on how to remain healthy and avoid health problems. Mary sells provisions, drinks and bottled water. She has been in this business for the past three years. Mary is the woman standing in the picture, while her sales girl is sitting behind her. She needs the loan to buy more provisions to sell. Mary says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Monisola

texts.en: Monisola is 55 years old and is married with two children who are in a higher institution of learning. Monisola sells food like plantain, beans, fufu (a native food prepared from cassava) among other things. She has been in this business for a long time. Monisola goes to the village market to buy food to sell in Lagos state. She says that the food business is good. She needs the loan to buy more items to sell. She says "thank you".

loans.use: To buy more bunches of plantain

loans.name: Yoy

texts.en:
Mrs.Yoy K. was born in 1969 and lives in Andoung Samreth Village in Takeo Province. She is a widow and the mother of one child who is attending the local school. 

She is a pig breeder, and in her business she faces an obstacle because she does not make much money to earn her living and support her business. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs.Yoy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and five pigs. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy pig food and five pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a digital computer printer and a generator

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs.Touch M. is a villager in Ponlai Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Horng Chhoun, are farmers. He is shown on the right of the photo.

She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living.  The soil in their fields has become infertile and it is having a negative effect on their crop. They do not have much money to improve the fields. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs.Touch M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to upgrade the soil and make the crop more productive. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field to make crops more productive.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells clothing materials (sarong) that can be used to make various designs like the dress she is wearing in this picture. Toyin buys the clothing materials from Lagos Island and brings it to Egbeda in Lagos to sell. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She needs the loan to buy more clothing materials in bulk at a reduced cost. She wants to meet the demands of her customers as the festive season is approaching. Toyin is 45 years old and is married with three children. When her children are on holidays they assist her in selling clothing materials. Toyin says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To Purchase more clothing materials (sarong) to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a photographer in Lagos state, Nigeria. She owns a photography studio. Elizabeth has lots of customers of whom she takes pictures. She has a trained shop assistant but Elizabeth only has one camera so sometimes, when her customers come to her photo studio, she is not able to meet their demands and she loses them to competitors that use digital cameras. She needs the loan to buy a digital camera so that she can meet the demands of her customers.  Elizabeth is 50 years old and is married with five children. Her children are all in school. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy a digital Camera and films

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs.Oem P. was born in 1964 and now lives in Banteay village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer and she owns a small piece of land where rice is cultivated to earn an income. Her husband, Mr. Kim Heng, is a farmer. On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because of infertile soil and does not have much money to improve his field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs.Oem P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to harvest the rice. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar R. is a 44-year-old entrepreneur who breeds cows in a small village in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He has been selling dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt, for 13 years. His business generates quite a good income, but it is not enough to expand. Ilgar also works as school teacher in the local school, but his salary is too small to cover basic needs of his three children.

To expand his business, Ilgar needs to purchase two cows. For this purpose, he is applying for a loan of $1200. This loan will allow to expand his business. Let's do our best to help this hard-working man!

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Tajir

texts.en:
Tajir H. is 22 years old; a young and very hard-working entrepreneur. He owns a store where he sells laundry soap, bath and washing powders, soaps and shampoo. He started his business in 2004 with the financial support of his father, who is now living on his pension. Tajit lives with his elderly parents and his business is the only financial source for his family.  

Tajir has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase more inventory for his shop. This will allow him to generate more income and better support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris Qurbaov is a 34-year-old trader who sells different foods in a small village in a southern city of Azerbaijan. He has run this business for eight years. Idris also has a car, and sometimes takes local people from his village to the city downtown, but the main income source is his shop. 

Idris is married and has three adorable children. All of his efforts to improve his business are designed to improve the living conditions of his children. 

Now Idris would like to expand his business and purchase more inventory for his shop, such as candies, cookies, mayonnaise, ketchup, sugar, and salt. For this purpose, Idris has applied for a loan of $1200. Your generosity will allow Idris to improve his family's life!

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Anwi Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is married with two children and lives in Mbengwi, a rural town about an hour from Bamenda. With this loan, Magdalene will continue her business of frying and selling gateau (a doughnut like treat), rearing pigs, and raising fowl. Her business plan involves the purchase two piglets, 8 kilograms of animal feed, flour, sugar, yeast, oil, 50 chicks, and chicken feed. She also plans to reinforce her fence with part of this loan. She plans to use 104,000 CFA (approximately $210 USD) of her own savings to supplement her loan and ensure she has the most success in her businesses. This loan will be repaid over a period of 18 months; the first payment will be made on the day the loan is dispersed.

This will be Regina's fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She plans to sell her fried gateaux to children on their way to school and to farmers in the morning. As there are many celebrations in the near future, including Christmas and New Years, chickens will be in high demand soon. She hopes to raise her chickens to sell before these celebrations, as they only take 6 to 8 weeks to become full grown. Her husband plans to help her raise her pigs and chickens, as he has a great deal of experience in raising animals. She plans to support her community by providing them with chickens, pigs, fried gateaux, and manure for sale at reasonable prices. Moreover, by purchasing her supplies, such as oil and pig feed, from her community, she will help to raise the incomes of others in her community. With the profits from this loan, Magdalene plans to pay her children's school fees. This is extremely important to her as she was unable to continue her education as a child of poverty. She also plans to improve her household. Magdalene hopes that this loan will continue to increase her family's standard of living as those in the past have done. She is grateful for the business training provided by GHAPE, and knows this training will be crucial in the success of her businesses.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and develops a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, animal feed, fencing, oil, chickens, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with six children and lives in Mbengwi, a rural town outside of Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, she plans to continue her business of rearing pigs and selling cooked food.  Her business plan for the loan involves repairing her pig pen, purchasing piglets, buying pig feed, and continuing to purchase ingredients for her cooked food.  She plans to contribute 55,000 CFA (approximately $110 USD) from her own savings to successfully follow through with her business plan.  

Regina has been a GHAPE client since 2004; this is her fourth loan.  This loan will help her financial situation by providing her with a long term investment and high profits through her pigs.  Moreover, the sale of cooked food will allow her to cover daily expenses until her pigs are ready to sell.  Many families in this area rear pigs due to their high profit margin and the security they provide as they can be sold in case of any health problems in the family or other emergencies.  The manure from the pigs will be used on Regina's farm as well as sold to those in her community.   

With the profits from this loan, Regina plans to ensure that her children's school fees are paid regularly and her children are properly equipped for school.  She also will make sure her family eats well and stays healthy.  However, in case of sickness, she will use some of her profits to ensure her family is treated properly for any illnesses.  Finally, she hopes to place much of her profit into her personal savings account that GHAPE provided for her.  She is happy to be taking out another loan with GHAPE and knows her success will be greater with each loan as she receives more business and life skills training from GHAPE.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To repair a pig pen and to buy feed, piglets, food stuff and ingredients for the sale of fried cake.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is married with six children and lives in Mbengwi, a rural town about an hour outside of Bamenda, Cameroon.  Pauline runs a small "buy and sell" stand in Mbengwi.  With this loan, she plans to invest in more products to sell at her stand.  Some of these products include rice, onions, groundnut oil, beans, tomatoes, salt, palm oil, and soya beans.  Her business plan shows she will invest 80,000 CFA (approximately $160 USD) of her own savings as well.

This will be Pauline's fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004.  She has been quite successful in the past with her buy-and-sell business due to her location on the main road, the variety of her products, and her reasonable prices.  She goes into Bamenda to purchase most of her products where they are much cheaper and sells them at her stall.  This saves many in her community the transportation costs and the time of going to Bamenda themselves to purchase these items.  She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales.  

The profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of Pauline's children.  One of her sons recently failed his exams and is required to redo the year, and she must pay an extra year of schooling for this child.  She also plans to purchase household items such as pots, knives, and dishes for her home.  Pauline does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments every two weeks.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase rice, onions, groundnuts, soya beans, salt, palm oil, garlic, and tomatoes for food stand.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells palm oil in gallons to her customers in retail. Palm oil is used in the preparation of Nigerian soup like Egusi, Banga, and Ogbono. Queen buys palm oil from distributors and she sells in retail to her customers. Queen needs the loan to purchase more palm oil to sell. Queen is 40 years old and is married with six children. Queen says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil to sell

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is single and has one child. She lives in Musang, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in a call box and the sale of food items, dresses, and fish pile (a fried dough containing fish). She intends to contribute 400,000 CFA ($800 USD) of her own personal savings towards her business plan.

This is Mariana's fourth loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 1998. Mariana has a great deal of experience in farming and her workshop. The location of her business is quite good for selling items. She has many customers already that rely on her for certain items. Also, since she now has enough capital, she can ensure that her products are always available. Many people run out of goods during the day since they cannot afford to purchase any more in the morning due to a lack of capital. This loan will increase her customer's confidence in her shop.

Mariana will use the profits from this loan to purchase a plot of land for herself. She also hopes to help her son open a shop. Her training in marketing and business management will help her to succeed in her shop.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase coco yams, Irish potatoes, flour, dresses for resale, and credit for phones for a call box.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar S. is a 41-year-old man who runs a barber shop in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He is a very polite and respectful hairdresser and he has many permanent clients. His training allows him to serve only male clients. 

Yashar starts his work at 8:00 in the morning and finishes between 9:00 and 10:00 at night. His busiest time is from 7:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m., because many of his clients come after work. 

Yashar is married and has three children. All of his efforts are designed to improve their lives and provide them with an excellent education. He would also like to teach one of his two sons his profession, so that his business can grow some day. 

Yashar has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase modern tools for haircutting and, most importantly, to supply water to his barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase modern tools for haircuts and a water supply for his barber shop

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid A. is a 25-year-old man who sells different type of goods, such as laundry powders, soaps, shampoos, and perfumes, in his shop. He started his business in 1999 when his father invited him to join his family business. Now, Vahid is owner of this shop and is the main financial source for his parents, his wife, and their child. 

Vahid is a repeat client of AqroInvest who has successfully completed his first loan. Vahid is now applying for $1200 to increase his stock and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his inventory

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat is a 48 year old mother of two from Khujand. She requests a personal loan to make repairs to her kitchen and purchase new furniture. The money will be used to install new gas lines to her kitchen, which is crucial during the winter months when electricity is available only during specific hours of the day. With gas lines she is able to use 'balloon' gas - or canisters which can be stored for use when gas is not available from the city supply. Because of last year's winter conditions, much of Bashorat's furniture was damaged.  During periods where there was no heat in the home, the furniture became very cold.  When the heat returned, condensation formed and has warped her wooden table, chairs and other furniture.  She will use a portion of proceeds for the purchase of new furniture.

Bashorat plans to repay the loan over the next 12 months from her salary earned as a notary. She and her husband have a grown daughter who is married and also a son who is currently studying at the University in Khujand. She is slowly learning English from her husband and son and was eager to practice a few words during our interview.  ith winter already here and electricity being rationed, she is eager to get started on the repairs and thanks Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Elshen

texts.en:
Elshan A. is a 38-year-old man who works as a butcher in a rented garage. Alshen started his business in 1993 when unemployment and poverty pushed him to open his own business. 

Every day, early in the morning, local farmers bring livestock and sheep to Elshan's garage. The busiest time of day for buying meat is morning and lunch time. After work, Elshen comes home where he looks after his livestock. Elshen is hard-working man who tries his best to provide good living conditions to his parents and two children. 

Now, Elshan would like to build a good butcher shop closer to the downtown. For this purpose, Elshen has applied for a loan of $1200. Elshen and his family are counting on your help!

loans.use: To build a butcher shop

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
Abdulla N. is a 44-year-old trader who sells different kind of goods in his shop, which is located in a city in southern Azerbaijan. 

Abdulla started his business in 1999 when poverty knocked at his door. Step by step, he developed his business and now he rents a place that he uses for his shop. However, his main wish is to build his own shop and expand his business. He has already saved some money for building, but to start the building process, he needs additional funds. Also, because this business is the only financial source in Abdulla's family, he also would like to expand number of goods he sells. 

To fulfill all his goals, Abdulla has applied for a loan of $1200. Your contribution can make his wishes come true!

loans.use: To build a shop and buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells provisions and drinks and she has been in this business for a long time. Margaret buys provisions in dozens and drinks in crates from distributors. She needs the loan amount of 99,000 Naira to buy more drinks to sell. Margaret is 42 years old and married with five children. She says "God bless all Kiva lenders".

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells cold drinks and children's sandals. She has been in this business for the past three years. She buys drinks in crates from the distributors and she sells in retail to her customers. She is happy with her business because she sells in cash to her customers. She has high patronage from parents who want to buy new school sandals for their children. Cecilia is 42 years old and is married with eight children. Cecilia needs the loan to purchase more drinks and children's sandals to sell. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and children's sandals

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Sinoeun C., 24, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Phorn, 25, who live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2005 and have one daughter. Mr. Sinoeun has been a silk weaver for four years, a skill he learned from his wife when he was 20 years old. His wife has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was 17 years old. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sinoeun is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 35 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Oke Aro, Abulegba area of Lagos state Nigeria. Joy sells yams and garri. She has been in this business for the past four years. She buys the food from villages surrounding Lagos and she brings the food to Lagos to sell. She needs the loan to purchase more food to sell. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri and yams to sell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 36 years old and married to O., who is a roadside mechanic. They have five children. The family lives in Abulegba area of Lagos state, Nigeria. Idowu sells drinks and she has been in this business for the past three years. She buys drinks in crates and then sells through retail to her customers. Idowu needs the loan amount of 140,000 Naira to buy more crates of drinks to sell. Idowu says thank you to all Kiva lenders for putting smiles on the faces of people.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng S., 31 years old, and her husband, Mr. Kong Dam, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
