Married in 1995, they had two children, one passed away, while another studies in the local school.  Mrs.Yeng has been a silk weaver for ten years. She learned the skill from her neighbors when she was sixteen years old. She sells finished products to a trader in the village, who then sells her products in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman who fishes from the lake near their house and sells them in the village. Mrs.Yeng is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase thread for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving business.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary L. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. She and her husband, Mr. Vong Hort, are farmers. They do not make much money to support their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Sary L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes and thus start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living situation with this loan. She is the 41-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes and thus start a new business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells bags of flour by wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for the past five years. Maria is 27 years old and married to A. who is a mechanic. They have two lovely children. Maria also sells snacks.

Maria needs the loan amount of 140,000 Naira to buy more bags of flour to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. Touch T. is a villager in Smaung village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer and owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice and earn an income. His wife, Mrs. Soun Yen, is a pig breeder. In this business, she is facing some problems because she does not make enough money to feed her stock. Thus, Mr. Touch T. decided to request a loan to buy pig food and eight pigs to add to his wife's business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 59 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and other three children are attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and eight pigs to add to his wife's business.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh Play, 42, is a widow with two sons and five daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home, while the other three children work in a garment factory. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Thanh has been a silk weaver, a skill learnt from her daughter, for three years. She sells her finished products to a trader in the village, who then sells her products in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials her weaving business and to help her son in-law purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and a boat

loans.name: Seur

texts.en:
Mrs. Seur S. is a villager in Torm Ney village in Takeo Province. She is a 44 year old widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two children are attending the local school. 

She owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. Even though Mrs. Seur S.'s family members have different careers, they still do not make enough money to support their living conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Seur S. decided to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes.. She hopes to increase her income when she sells her cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina Y., 31, and her husband, Mr. Tuy Morm, 35, live in a small village located twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter, both of whom are currently studying in a local school. Mrs. Sina, who learned silk weaving from her neighbor, has turned her skill into a business for twenty years. She sells her finished products to a trader in the village who then sells her products in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been working as a fisherman for fifteen years. Beside of weaving and fishing, the couple also grows rice. Mrs. Sina is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk materials for weaving and to purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and buy a water pump for farming

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy Y. is a villager in Trapaing Sdouk village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Vann Ny, is a worker and he receives a small salary but he does not earn enough money to support his family. Thus, Mrs. Thy Y. decided to ask for loan to buy a cow to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 42 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem K., 66, and her husband, Mr. Pann Mean, 67, live in a small village located about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1971, they have three sons and three daughters. One of her daughter's is a silk weaver, two of her sons are studying in a local school, and one son works as a fisherman. 

Mrs. Nem has been selling fish for ten years, while her husband has worked as a horse-car driver for five years. He has also been plowing farmland to earn extra income for over ten years. Mrs. Nem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a horse for her son's horse-car driving business and to purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and silk materials

loans.name: Wangang

texts.en:
Wangang is married with seven children and lives in Nkwen, an area just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. He plans to use his loan to purchase a machine to cut wood. He plans to invest 5000 CFA ($100 USD) of his own savings to be able to afford the machine itself.

This is Wangang's third loan from GHAPE; he has been a member since 2005. He plans to sell his cut wood to people in his community. His income will be supplemented by the pigs he has been raising from his past loan. He will use crops from his farm to provide food for his family. He knows he will succeed with this loan because he has been doing this type of work for so long. With the profits from this loan, Wangang plans to help his children and his wife. He hopes this loan will improve his family's standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a saw machine to cut wood.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mr. Ly K. was born in 1973 and now lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He is an ice cream seller. His wife, Mrs. Ton Na, is a farmer and she owns a small plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn an income. Even though they have different careers, they do not make enough money to support their living conditions. Therefore Mr. Ly K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more ingredients to make ice cream to sell in the local village. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living situation with this loan. He is the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell in the local village.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Mrs. Rem C., 49, and her husband, Mr. Ouch Thy, 52, live in a small village located fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Married in 1980, they have one son and one daughter. Their son is a fisherman, while their daughter works in a factory. Both husband and wife have been working in the fishing business for twenty years. She sells fishes that he catches in a nearby lake. Mrs. Rem is requesting loan of $600 to purchase one boat, a fishing net, and fish traps.

loans.use: To purchase one boat, fishing nets, and fish traps

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 42 years old and married to Mr. Sunny O. who is a teacher and they have five children. She sells secondhand shoes and clothes. Rosemary also mends clothes for local people. She needs the loan to purchase more second hand shoes to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy U., 41, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Vun, 44, married in 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Both of their daughters are garment factory workers and the two sons are studying in primary school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Chanthy is a tailor. She used to work in a garment factory before operating her own business. Her husband raises cows. The couple hopes that their business will be able to support their two sons while they study to as high a level as possible. Chanthy is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells provisions and drinks to her customers. She needs the loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. Mercy is 42 years old and is married to Mr. O. who is a taxi driver. They have seven children. Mercy hopes to assist her husband in providing for the educational needs of their children. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells drinks at wholesale and retail. In the evenings, she prepares and sells fried meat and pepper soup. She needs the loan to purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell. Veronica is 38 years old and is married with three children. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: Mrs. Sreytouch C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Kimhoun Hong, 40, live on an island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1998, they have one son and three daughters who are all currently studying in the local school. Mrs. Sreytouch learned how to weave from her parents when she was seventeen years old. She has been weaving for over twenty five years, while her husband has been weaving for ten years. They sell their finished products to the trader in the village. Mrs. Sreytouch is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with five children and lives in Mbengwi, a town about an hour outside of Bamenda, Cameroon. He plans to invest this loan in rearing pigs, fishing, and a feed store. He has used his past loans to support his pig business and fish farm. He plans to invest most of this loan in the opening of a feed store. He will reinforce his pig pen, purchase more fish species and ponds, and set up a food store with the money from this loan. He plans to contribute 200,000 CFA ($400 USD) of his own savings to ensure the success of this loan.

This will be Peter's fourth loan from GHAPE; he has been a member since 2004. He has found that there is an increasing demand for both fish and pigs; this loan will help him to meet the demands of those in his community. He has found that in his community, there are not many 'serious' pig farmers; this makes his pigs in higher demand than those of other farmers. The introduction of a new fish species will increase demand for fish and encourage others to take up fish farming.

With the profits from this loan, Peter plans to expand his business and increase the living standard of his family. He hopes to advance his children's education by paying for their school fees and other expenses. He also intends to complete his house and install electricity.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To set up a feed store, create more ponds for an additional fish species, and reinforce a pig pen.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna C., 47, and her husband, Mr. Peam Thou, 48, live on an island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1980, they have two sons and three daughters. One of their sons is a monk; the other son is a farmer; two daughters are weavers; and one daughter studies in high school.  Mrs. Vanna has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her neighbors when she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the trader in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. 

Her husband has been producing vermicelli for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase one motor and mill for her husband's vermicelli producing business.

loans.use: To purchase one motor and mill to produce vermicelli

loans.name: Sheriffat

texts.en: Aderenti is a hardworking mother of six children. Three of her children are in higher institutions of learning. She is 45 years old and married to Mr. Sherifatt. Aderenti sells firewood and also supplies clothes to her customers. She needs the loan to buy more clothes to sell. This is a festive period and there will be high demand for her clothes. She says "thank you" to all of the people that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Norena

texts.en: Norena J. is 46 years old and is married with four children. Norena runs a viewing centre where teenagers play computer games. She also sells drinks and pure water. In addition to this shop she has a kiosk where she sells phone calls and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in this business for a long time. She buys ice blocks to cool drinks in these coolers that are showing in the picture. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge to cool her drinks. Usually, she loses her customers when she does not get blocks to cool the drinks. She will also purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says "thank you" to all of the people that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Sokhoin

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoin V., 29, and her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Oung, 33, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 2000, they have two young sons. Mrs. Sokhoin bakes and sells different types of Cambodian cakes from her house. Her husband is a chef at a hotel in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to level up the foundation of her house.

loans.use: To level up her house foundation

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in this business for the past five years. Felicia is 40 years old and is married with three children. The demands for her goods are high. Felicia needs the loan  to buy more phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says "thank you" to all the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate E., a 48-year-old widow with six children, sells cooked foods and drinks in her shop, a business she has operated for a number of years. She opens her shop at 6 a.m. daily to sell to her customers before they leave for work.  

Kate started receiving financial Assistance from LAPO Microfinance two years ago, at which point her shop began to grow and expand. In order to keep growing and expanding, she is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks to sell.  Kate expresses her profound gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sauliat

texts.en:
O. Sauliat, 38 and married with three children, lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells clothes in her shop located along Ojo Igbede Road.  Previously selling clothing door to door, O. was able to rent a shop for her business with the assistance of LAPO MICROFINANCE.  She is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell, hoping to stock all that her customers need. This, she says, will enable her to retain those customers.  

O. says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita D. owns a clothing store in the town of Iha in the Bekaa valley. A 40-year old mother of three children, Rita has been in the clothes-selling business since 2000. In 2007, wishing to have her own business, she opened her own store. This trade allows Rita to help her husband, a local fireman, with the household income.

Today she requests a loan of $1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter and propose a bigger choice of clothes to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her winter inventory.

loans.name: Aina

texts.en:
Aina sells snacks, drinks and juice. Customers also hire her to bake cakes for their social engagements like birthday parties, marriages, etc. She has been in this business for the past eight years.

Aina is 36 years old and married to I. who works in a block factory. They have four children and they are all attending school. Aina and her husband are determined to give their children a quality education. Aina needs the loan to purchase more drinks, juice, and baking materials like flour, sugar, etc to sell. She says thank you to all who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more baking materials, juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es: Míguela tiene 38 años, convive con su pareja, tiene 7 hijos, el mayor de 20 años  y el último solo de 8 años. En horas de la mañana prepara los alimentos de sus hijos, hay dias en que ella tiene que ir de negoció llevando sus productos al mercado de la ciudad, pero otros días se queda en su chacra a cultivar sus productos, como arvejas y maíz. Desde su niñez trabaja en la chacra apoyando a sus padres, pero hace 2 años se dedica a la comercialización de sus productos los días de feria, que son dos veces por semana, el resto de los dias apoya a su esposo en las labores del campo. Lo que más le agrada, después de trabajar en la chacra, es vender sus productos porque le permite recobrar todo lo invertido. El problema es el alza del precio del abono, es la parte más difícil porque el dinero no le alcanza. Ella es una clienta nueva en su IMF, este es su primer préstamo. Con el dinero va comprar abono para la siembra de sus cultivos de arvejas, el saco cuesta 215 soles, considera que quizás le falte algo de dinero.
texts.en:
Miguela is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has 7 children (the eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is only 8 years old). In the early morning hours she prepares food for her children, some days she works selling her products at the city market, but other days she works at home on their small farm (chacra) to cultivate her products, like peas and corn. She has worked on the chacra since she was a child, helping out her parents, but two years ago she began to sell her products at the market, twice per week, and on the remaining days of the week she helps her husband with chores in the fields. What gratifies her most, apart from working on the chacra, is selling her products, because it allows her to recoup her investment. The problem now is the rising cost of fertilizer, which is a challenge for her because she is stretched for money. She is a new Microfinance Institution (MFI) client and this is her first loan. With the money from the loan, she will buy fertilizer in order to cultivate peas; each sack of fertilizer costs 215 soles, for which she is short of money.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for small farm cultivation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is married with a child. Esther is 38 years old and she sells clothes, shoes, and bags. Esther has her shop open 7am to 7 pm daily. She travels to Cotonou to buy her goods--a journey of about 3 hours from Lagos State.

Esther is a LAPO client. Esther attends to her customers politely and this has drawn more customers to her shop. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to buy more clothes, bags, and shoes to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags, and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre anciana y sus dos menores hijos, su pareja los abandonó. Se dedica a trabajar en sus cultivos desde su niñez, ha sembrado 15 sacos de semilla de papa, asimismo tiene sembrado arvejas, pero en menor cantidad. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los desayunos y almuerzos de su familia, después, a eso de las 8 saca la leche de su vaca, prepara los quesos y reparte a los negociantes, esto es solo dos veces por semana, también lleva a sus vacas al campo, y finalmente se va a su chacra todos los dias.  Le agrada la actividad que realiza, pero le falta el capital, nos dice que la agricultura es muy cansada y requiere mayor inversión. Es la primera vez que saca un préstamo de esta institución. Además de mantener en buen estado sus tierras, este préstamo para ella es la oportunidad de incursionar en otro negocio, así que también se va dedicar a la compra y venta de carne roja.
texts.en:
Irma is a 30-year-old single mother of two, who lives with her mother (her partner left them on their own). She has worked on her land since childhood, sowing 15 sacks of potato seed, as well as peas although in lesser quantities. She is up at 4am to prepare breakfast and lunch for her family; by 8am she is milking the cow, and preparing cheeses which she distributes to her clients twice per week; she then takes her cows out to pasture, and daily attends to her small farm. She enjoys her endeavors, but she lacks capital - she has shared with us that agricultural work is exhausting and requires heavy investment. This is her first request for a loan from this institution. In addition to maintenance of her land, this loan will provide her with an opportunity to invest in another business, so she will start buying and selling red meat.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for farming investment and to start a business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 26 años, convive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que ya están estudiando. Es agricultor desde muy pequeño, tiene campos de cultivo en zonas donde se siembra por temporada, según las lluvias, entonces tiene que alquilarse campos que tienen zonas de regadío. Cuando le toca regar su chacra lo hace a 4 de la madrugada para aprovechar el caudal del agua. Después regresa a desayunar y eso de las 9 nuevamente regresa a su chacra hasta las 5 de la tarde. Edwin está muy contento con la agricultura, porque tiene temporadas que su producción es muy buena. Considera que sus productos son rentables porque son de consumo cotidiano. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que pide comprará abono, tales como el fosfato de nitrato y potasio, para sus chacras ya sembradas.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two student-age children. He has been a farmer since he was young and he has land where he plants various crops each season depending on the rains but occasionally he has to rent irrigated land. When it is his turn to irrigate his land, he has to do it at 4 in the morning to take advantage of the water flow. Afterwards, he returns home to eat breakfast then works on his land from 9 to 5. Edwin is very happy as a farmer because he has seasons when his production is very good. His crops are profitable because they are things that are consumed by most people every day. This is his first loan from Prisma Microfinance and he will use the money to buy fertilizers such as phosphates, nitrates, and potassium for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his land

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Esther sells drinks and provisions in her shop. Esther is thankful to LAPO MICROFINANCE for linking her to Kiva lenders. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to stock her shop, so that she can sell in large quantities to her customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to re-sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn, who bakes snacks such as egg rolls, meat pies, and fish rolls in her house, is 45 years old and married with five children. Very determined to eradicate her family’s poverty and increase the prosperity of her business, Roselyn is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of flour, vegetable oil and one oven so that she can continue to develop her enterprise and meet customer demand. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy flour, vegetable oil and one oven for her business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 22 años, vive con su madre, hermanos y sus sobrinos, su padre falleció cuando era niño. Recuerda los viejos tiempos, cuando estaba vivo su padre sembraban en grandes cantidades, desde que falleció su madre había dejado de sembrar por falta de ayuda económica. Hace 10 años Jaime trabajaba para las chacras de los vecinos y le pagan a diario 15 soles, esto le permite mantener a su madre y sustentar la economía familiar. Le agrada la chacra y mejor si va sembrar su propio terreno, lo difícil, es la carencia de dinero, es por ello que sus terrenos están mucho tiempo sin  sembrar. Es el primer préstamo que solicita. Con este dinero comprará semilla de papa, porque  esta semilla produce en grandes cantidades y es comerciable, por arroba cuesta un aproximado de 14 soles.
texts.en:
Jaime is 22 years old and lives with his mother, siblings and nieces and nephews (his father died when Jaime was a boy). He remembers the old days, when his father was alive, they sowed in great quantities, but since the death of his father, his mother stopped sowing for lack of funds. Jaime works on his neighbors' small farms, going on 10 years now, where he is paid 15 soles daily in order to support his mother and contribute to the household finances. He enjoys the farm work and would prefer to be sowing his own land, which will be difficult as he lacks funds, and is why his own lands have lain unsown for so long. This is the first loan for which he has applied. With the money, he will buy potato seed which produces high yields and is a good seller; each 25-lb bag of seed costs approximately 14 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seed

loans.name: La Buena Fe Group

texts.en: "La Buena Fe" is a group of 10 entrepreneurs, who began participating in the Esperanza microcredit program in 2006.  This will be the fifth group loan for "La Buena Fe."  Margarita  is the chosen group representative in part due to her hard work ethic. She is also the mother of 4 children. Margarita will use her microloan to continue her small business (called "Modesta Margarita") selling beauty products and running a very small beauty salon. She hopes to one day have a larger beauty salon, generating greater income. Her main focus in starting her own business is her 4 children. She says that her dream is for her children to receive all the education they need to have better lives and to be able to enjoy life.  Other members of the group are also using their loans to finance other small stores-selling clothes, food, and other goods.

loans.use: Buying and selling beauty products

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells drinks and pure water and makes popcorn; she has been in this business for the past 3 years. Felicia is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Felicia is business-oriented, that is why she wants to include the sale of foodstuffs to her business.

Felicia needs the loan amount of N100,000 to buy more drinks, pure water, and foodstuffs to sell. This, she said, will increase her productivity and her profit. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind heart and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, pure water, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Blessing is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Blessing has been in this business for the past 4 years. She is a LAPO client. As a young woman who is eager to expand her business, she hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. Blessing appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Manka Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married with four children and lives in Mankon, near Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her "buyam sellam" store. More specifically, she will purchase maize, Irish potatoes, beans, yellow yams, calabah yams, and cocoyams. She plans to contribute 100,000 CFA ($200 USD) of her personal savings towards these purchases.

This is Emilia's fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004. She has been working in her "buyam sellam" business for a number of years now and has since found herself suppliers for the items she sells; this ensures she gets the best prices on these items. She also now has many customers who come to her for all of their vegetables. She allows some people to create a tab with her for their purchases and pay her at the end of the month.

With the profits from this loan, Emilia plans to send her children to school and support them after school. She will also consider adding other food stuffs to her stall. Her profits will also provide her the security of knowing she can afford hospital bills and health costs.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy maize, Irish potatoes, yellow yams, cocoyams, beans, and calabah yams for retail.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a skilled hair stylist who also sells weave-ons, hair extensions and hair cream. Happy because with the festive season approaching, sales will increase significantly, Mercy is requesting a loan to buy more weave-ons and hair extensions to meet the anticipated expanded demand.  She also believes that this increased stock will attract more customers to her shop. Mercy thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more weave-ons and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian, who is 30 years old and married with two children, sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 3 years and is now requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and kind hearts.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother with five children living in Musang, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. Her restaurant, "Mami Sha," has been operating for a number of years and she has regular customers. She is going to use the loan to buy maize, beans, rice, groundnut oil, salt, firewood, palm oil, and other spices. She has also acquired a good site for her business. She purchases some of her supplies from the "bush" or rural areas in order to get the best prices and increase her profits.

She plans to contribute 50,000 CFA ($100 USD) of her own personal savings to ensure the success of her business plan. This is Margaret's fourth loan from GHAPE, and she has been a member since 2004. The profits from this loan will be used to educate Margaret's children. She also hopes to purchase a plot of land and build a home for her family on that plot. Her profits will also be used to ensure her family eats well, stays healthy and dresses well. She would like to increase their standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, rice, oil, magi, salt, firewood, palm oil, egusi, pots and flasks, groundnut oil

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde, 43 years old and married with four children, sells cooked food in her shop located at Alaba International market, one of the biggest markets in Africa, located in Lagos State, Nigeria. Kehinde operates her business Monday through Saturday, 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her customers are mostly traders selling in the market.

Kehinde is now requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells foodstuffs like gari, yams, and fresh peppers out of her house. She has been in this business for a long time. Christiana travels to Abuja (a journey of 8-9 hours) to buy foodstuffs in bulk to sell. She travels twice a month. Christiana is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Christiana is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo, 30 years old and married with three children, is a petty trader determined to earn a living that will both feed her immediate household and assist in the payment of her children’s school fees.  Her husband N. is a commercial laborer (a truck pusher) earning only low wages, but Iyabo is determined to lift her family from their present poverty.  She is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and padlocks to sell.  Iyabo thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and padlocks to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is separated with two children; she lives in Musang, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. With this loan she plans to purchase supplies for her shop "Mami Coco". She will purchase country cocoyams, macabu cocoyams, spices, potatoes, yellow yams, palm oil, groundnut oil, and maggi sauce. She plans to contribute 50,000 CFA ($100 USD) of her own savings towards this business plan.

This is Anna's fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2004.  She now has a good market site that brings in many customers. She purchases her goods from suppliers she has found over the years who provide her with the best prices. She also ventures into the rural "bush" areas to get some of her supplies. She now has many regular customers that trust her and her pricing.

With the profit from this loan, Anna plans to buy a plot of land and build herself a home.  She will also continue to educate her children. She hopes that her loan and others will bring development to her area and community. The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, potatoes, palm oil, groundnut oil, yellow yams, and maggi sauce

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells foodstuffs like gari, yams, pepper, etc. in her shop located at Ilufe Road in Lagos State, Nigeria. Bola is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Bola is a LAPO client. Because of the growing demands on her foodstuffs and her inability to meet the demands of her customers, she needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She expresses her profound gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for affecting lives positively.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to re-sell

loans.name: Theckla

texts.en:
Theckla is married with four children and lives in Musang, a town just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her retail business and firewood business. Theckla has noticed high demand for palm oil, firewood and gari, derived from cassava in her community, as these are used in most meals. She is going to use the funds from the loan to purchase these items and other commodities such as fried groundnuts, sugar, sugar cane and pears (avocados). She hopes that her community will also benefit as their travel costs and time looking for these products will be reduced.

This is Theckla's third loan from GHAPE. With the profits from this loan, Theckla plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs. She also intends to help her sisters and brothers. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Firewood, palm oil, gari, sugar cane, groundnut oil, avocado

loans.name: Abinbola

texts.en: Abinbola is married with 7 children and she is 52 years old. Abinbola is focused on her business and wants to expand her business of selling clothes and shoes. She has had her business for a long time. Abinbola lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is hoping for a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Aniratu

texts.en:
Aniratu lives in Agege, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells chickens and ducks in the market. Aniratu has been in this business for a long time. With her experience in this business she has been able to maintain a good communication with her customers, thereby retaining them.

Aniratu is 52 years old and married with 6 children. Aniratu is a LAPO client, and needs a loan to buy more ducks and chickens to sell. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks to sell

loans.name: Madeline

texts.es: Madeline tiene 41, convive con su pareja, de esta unión tienen 3 hijos que están en la etapa escolar. Ella es madrugadora, solo así le alcanza el tiempo para preparar los alimentos de su familia y después llevar las vacas al campo, o de lo contrario ir en busca de pasto  para sus animales, para más tarde llevar el almuerzo de su esposo al campo y apoyarle en el cultivo de la papa y arveja, actividad que realizan desde que se comprometieron. Lo que más le agrada es sembrar arveja, porque dice que ahí no es mucha inversión como la papa, ya sea en dinero y en tiempo de trabajo, a veces la producción de papa es muy buena, pero cuando el precio no es alto en el mercado no les permite recupera su trabajo.  Es la primera vez que se presta dinero de esta IMF. Con el dinero va comprar productos contra insectos, para proteger su plantas, estos insecticidas cuestan un aproximado de 45 soles la bolsa de 500ml.
texts.en:
Madeline is 41 years old and lives with her husband with whom she has 3 children who are currently attending school. Madeline must get up early to allow her enough time to prepare the family’s meals and afterwards take the cows to graze or otherwise, go in search of pasture for them. Later, she must take her husband’s lunch to him out in the fields and help him cultivate the land to produce potatoes and peas, a livelihood they have continued since they married. Madeline prefers to grow peas rather than potatoes because they require less investment in terms of both money and labour time. Sometimes the potato harvest is very good but when the market price for them low, they are not able to recover costs. This is the first time Madeline has requested money from this IMF and with this money she intends to buy insecticides to protect her crops. These insecticides cost approximately 45 soles per 500ml bag.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Daniela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia del Carmen Rodríguez tiene la edad de 57 años habita en Ticuantepe junto a su esposo, este  señor trabaja como guarda de seguridad en el Instituto publico de Ticuantepe para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa. La señora Rodríguez  tiene un kiosco en el mismo instituto y hace almuerzos a los docente, tiene 20 años trabajando en su negocio pero todavía no ha cumplido su sueños de ver terminada su casa, por lo cual solicito un monto de C$ 8,000.00 córdobas para comprar materiales y poder cumplir su gran sueño .Esta señora tiene hijos pero ya todos están casado y le ayudan económicamente.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Danelia del Carmen R. is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Ticuantepe. Her husband works as security guard at the Public Institute of Ticuantepe to help her with household expenses. Mrs. R. has a grocery store in the same institute and prepares lunches for the teachers, she has 20 years working on her business but she hasn’t been able to fulfill her dream of finishing the construction of her home. This is why she is requesting a loan of C$8,000.oo Cordobas to buy material and fulfill her dream. Mrs. R. has children, but they are all grown up and married and help her financially.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone and cement to build walls

loans.name: Eudocia Eutropia

texts.es: La señora Eudocia tiene  39 años de edad, es  socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Mayo, Vive en la  Av.   Perú S/N.  distrito de Catac,  provincia de Recuay, departamentote Ancash.n Ella se dedica  a la venta de gaseosas  y  cerveza   su negocio  esta ubicado en su propio domicilio.nCon el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprara, 30 cajas de cerveza, 20 paquetes de gaseosa.nSu mayor sueño es ser mayorista en la venta de cervezas junto a su esposo, para lo cual trabajan todos los días juntamente con sus 3 hijos.n
texts.en:
Eudocia is 39 years old and a member of the communal bank “Flor de Mayo” (“May Flower”). She lives in the Catac district, Recuay province, in the department of Ancash. She dedicates herself to selling soft drinks and beer. Her business is located in her own home. With the loan of 1,000.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy 3 boxes of beer and 20 cases of soda. Her greatest wish is to be a beer wholesaler along with her husband, a goal which they work toward every day together with their children.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: La señora Paula Argentina A. tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio los Martínez ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposo y tres hijos, el esposo de la señora trabaja por si solo y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Esta señora es comerciante por lo cual nos solicita un monto de C$ 12,000.00 para comprar una cosecha de naranja y con lo que resta del dinero comprar materiales de construcción ya que su sueños es llegara tener un techo digno para darle mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula Argentina A. is 36 years old. She lives in the Martínez neighborhood in Concepción with her husband and three children. Her husband is self-employed and helps her with household expenses. Paula is a businesswoman and is requesting a loan of $625 to buy an orange harvest. With the remaining money, she plans to buy construction materials as she dreams of having a decent roof to make her home more secure for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, cement and sand to build a room

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: El señor Mario Enrique K. W. desea poner levantar una barda en su casa de block y luego ponerle protecciones. Pero por el momento con el préstamo otorgado quiere empezar la construcción. El vive en una colonia la cual no es muy segura y han surgido robo por lo cual el nos pide la cantidad de 7000 pesos.nnMario Enrique vive solamente con su esposa ella se trabaja en maquiladora y por un accidente de trabajo el Señor K. perdió movilidad en su mano derecha y fue pensionado por la empresa y con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo dado.n
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Enrique K. W. would like to build a wall around his house and eventually, reinforce it. With this loan of 7000 pesos, he will begin construction on this project. He lives in an area that is not very safe and robberies are on the rise. Mario Enrique lives with his wife, who works in a factory. Mr. K. himself was injured at work and lost mobility in his right hand. He will use the pension he receives from his previous employer to make payments on this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El señor Juan José Cuaresma tiene la edad de 65  habita en el barrio Pablo Calero junto a su esposa, este señor tiene hijos pero todos están casados y le ayudan .Don cuaresma desde hace 40 años trabaja como agricultor, el solicita el monto de C$ 6,000.00 córdobas para comprar insumos y tener una producción buena y así poder vender a un mejor precio la piña .Este señor con sus propios y el financiamiento de AFODENIC a logrado mantener su producción.
texts.en:
Juan José Cuaresma is 65 years old and lives in the Pablo Calero neighborhood with his wife. He has children, all of whom are married and help him. For 40 years, Don Cuaresma has worked as a farmer. He requests a loan of $325 to purchase supplies that will enable him to have a good crop and sell his pineapples at a better price. With his own savings and funding from AFODENIC, he has managed to maintain his output.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling perfumes, deodorants and similar products

loans.name: Fuerza Divina Group

texts.en: "Fuerza Divina" is a very large group of entrepreneurs all trying to start their own businesses. This particular loan is going to four members of the group who are trying to increase the size of their businesses. This will be the third loan cycle for these entrepreneurs. Rosa N. is the representative of this small group, and is really excited about receiving her third loan. She is the mother of three young children, and is saving so they can all go to high school and hopefully college someday. She has a small business right now selling clothing in her area. She hopes to expand the range of her business, and her dream is to someday own her own colmado (small store). She said she is on the right track and excited about what the future will bring for her and her family. The whole group feels the same way.  On behalf of Rosa, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buying clothing for sale

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria,  vive en el  Centro Poblado Poccona, del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno, es casada, tiene 58 años D. edad, madre D. 05 hijos (con familia) estudio  solo segundo grado D. primaria.nnElla es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 con el que compro  habas (menestras) para poder tostar, negocio que inicio cuando accedió al crédito, nos dice que no pudo estudiar porque sus padres no contaban con medios económicos suficientes, Demetria trabaja junto a su esposo en el tostado D. habas para luego vender su producto en el Mercado 15 D. Agosto D. Yunguyo. Con el préstamo que solicitara D. S/.2000.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas    comprara 10 arrobas D. habas en  Yunguyo  y continuar con su negocio.nnSu deseo es tener una tienda para poder vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Demetria lives in the center of Poccona, in the Yunguyo district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is married, 58 years old, the mother of five children (who have families), and studied only to the second graD. of primary school. She has been a member of the communal bank El Candelariau for six years. Her first loan was for 300.00 soles, with which she purchased beans to toast. She started the business when she gained access to the credit. She tells us that she wasn’t able to further her studies because her parents did not have sufficient economic means for her to continue. Demetria works together with her husband in the toasting of beans, to later sell their product at the “15th of August” market in Yunguyo. With the loan of 2,000.00 soles that she is requesting and will repay in 3 installments, she will buy 10 arrobas (unit of weight, about 14 kg) of beans in Yunguyo and continue with her business. Her wish is to have a store to be able to sell her goods at wholesale.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store and move the business forward.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: nDoña Dionisia tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 07 hijos, no estudio por que quedo huérfana muy pequeña, vive en el Jr. 28 D. Julio Nº 401 del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno.nnEs socia del Banco Comunal “Señor D. Locumba”- Yunguyo hace 07 años, con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 02  porcinos para engorD., ella empezó a trabajar desD. los 40 años vendiendo chuño y papa los días domingos en el mercado Laguna verD.. Actualmente se dedica a la crianza D. animales y continua vendiendo sus productos antes mencionados.nnCon el préstamo  que solicitara D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprara  10 arrobas D. papa a S/.  150 nuevos soles, 01 saco D. chuño a S/.  200 nuevos soles, crédito que pagara en 04 cuotas.nSu sueño es seguir con su negocio e  incrementar su capital.n
texts.en:
Dionisia is 50 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She did not study because she was orphaned at a very young age. She lives in the Yunguyo district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is a member of the communal bank for seven years. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she bought two pigs to fatten. Since she turned 40 years of age, she has worked selling chuflo (dried potatoes) and potatoes at the market in Laguna VerD.. Currently, she dedicates herself to raising animals and continues selling the aforementioned items. With the loan of 500.00 soles that she is now requesting, she will purchase 10 arrobas (unit of weight, about 14 kg) of potatoes at 0.15 soles, 1 sack of chuflo at 200.00 soles. She intends to repay her loan in four installments. Her dream is to continue with her business and increase her capital.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena  es separada, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de  02 hijos ya casados que viven en Lima, vive en el Sector Sihualaya del Distrito de Tinicachi, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.nnEs  socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” – Yunguyo con el primer préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado ovino y porcino para engorde. Anteriormente a los 14 años de edad aprendió a tejer llicllas por que tenía que mantenerse sola, no pudo estudiar porque su madre murió cuando ella nació y su papa solo apoyo a sus hermanos varones, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven. En la actualidad  continúa tejiendo llicllas  y  al mismo tiempo se dedica al negocio de venta de telas que envía a Lima en donde posee un Establecimiento comercial. nnCon el crédito que solicitara de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara 10  rollos de telas para confeccionar casacas, pantalones, buzos, etc.nnSu mayor deseo es tener una casa propia en Puno.n
texts.en:
Elena is separated from her husband and is 49 years old, she has 2 children and lives in Lima, in the Sihualaya sector of the Tinicachi district, province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is a member of the community bank Virgen de Lujanu Yunguyo. With her first loan of S/.300.oo new soles she bought pigs and sheep. She learned how to create llicllas to support herself, as she couldn’t study because her mother died when she was born and her father supported her brothers, but not her, so she started working very young. Currently she stills creates llicllas and she also sells fabrics she sends to Lima where she has a store. With the loan she is requesting of S/.1500.00 new soles that she will pay in 4 quotes, she will buy 10 rolls of fabric to create jackets, pants, sweaters, etc. Her biggest wish is to have her own house in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 35 años de edad es casada, madre de 05 hijos, no asistió a la escuela y vive en el C.P. Poccona del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.nnHace 04 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” – Yunguyo con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital para poder comprar habas. A los 25 años de edad empezó con este negocio de venta de granos de la región junto a su esposo  quien la acompaña a vender los días jueves y domingos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto de Yunguyo. Ella no puedo estudiar por que su papa la abandono muy pequeña y tuvo que apoyar a su mama a trabajar.nnCon el crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprará  01 saco de habas (granos).nnSu mayor deseo es apoyar a sus hijos  y continuar con su negocio.n
texts.en:
Elena is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children. She did not attend school, and lives in the Yunguyo-Puno province of the district of Yunguyo. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years. Her first loan of 300.00 soles increased her capital so she would be able to buy beans. At 25 years of age, she started in this business of selling regional grains together with her husband who accompanies her to sell on Thursdays and Sundays at the 15th of August market in Yunguyo. She could not continue her education because she was abandoned by her father at a young age, and had to help her mother by working. With the loan of 500.00 soles that she is requesting, and which she intends to pay in 4 installments, she will buy 1 sack of beans. Her greatest wishes are to support her children and to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Los Claveles De Morenita Group

texts.es: El Bancomunal Los Claveles D. Morenita esta ubicado en Huancavelica distrito D. Yauli, comunidad D. Ambato, entre arboles y pastizales se encuentran chozas que son casas D. adobes hechos con paja, es hermoso el paisaje, en L. zona vemos bastantes aves D. corral, gallinas y pollos.nLas actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. elaboracion D. mantas Pullas- fajas coloridas con hilos sinteticos, tambien con lanas D. Alpaca. Maximiliana D. L. C., es casada, tiene 12 hijos, entre ellos 2 pares D. gemelos D. 3 años y D. 8 años, el mayor tiene 25 años. Maximiliana se dedica a tejer, tiene  telares D. pullas y mantos coloridos con hilos sinteticos, todos sus hijos trabajan en los telares unos ovillan, otros seleccionan, otros colorean hasta que vayan al colegios o L. universidad. Con los prestamos que ha recibido a podido crecer por que antes no tenia capital, tejia D. 5 a 10 mantas, ahora tejo D. 30 a 40 mantas y llevo a las ferias grandes. Maximiliana en su bancomunal ha recibido charlas las cuales le han ayudado  mucho, pertenece a L. Junta Directiva, es fiscal y se considera muy  puntual, ha aprendido ahorrar. Maximiliana necesita un prestamo para comprar un telar mas, su sueño es tener una empresa granD. con 30 telares y esta ahorrando para comprarse una maquinas remalladora. Isabel A., esta casada con 5 hijos D. entre 4 y 14 anos, Isabel empezo a vender golosinas en L. escueL. gracias al prestamo inicial que obtuvo D. Finca, abrio un cafetin en al escueL. donD. da pension a los profesores y enfermeros, aprendio a cocinar, Isabel considera que se le abrio una oportunidad granD.. Las dificultades que paso, es que L. operaron D. un quiste en los ovarios  y estuvo en reposo, su esposo L. ayudaba pero no era igual L. clienteL. bajo. Isabel es presidenta D. club D. madres D. su comunidad, agradece a FINCA porque aprendio muchas cosas, entre ellas a dirigirse a las personas, tratar con ellas y ver las necesidades D. su grupo, Isabel nos dice que cambio mucho su forma D. ser. Su prestamo lo va a invertir en comprar granos D. menestras y llevarlos a L. capital D.  Lima. Su sueno es que sus hijos tengan estudios superiores, y va ahorrar para que sus cinco hijos estudien.nnTeresa C., es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Empezo con L. venta D. los quesos  en un baldecito, por las calles  gracias a L. llegada D. Finca Peru a  a su pueblo pudo obtener un prestamo y comprar mas queso, otras entidades le pedian mucha cosas, titulos y elL. manifiesta que apenas tiene su chozita D. abobe y algunos ganados. Las dificultades que ha pasado es que se murio su hijo D. 27 anos y dejo solo a sus nietos y tiene que trabajar duro para mantenerlos. Teresa recibe charlas D. como ahorrar, antes era muy callada, ahora sabe expresarse.  Su sueno es comprar un carro, con el credito que obtuvo D. FINCA va a comprar mas quesos, tambien huevos D. corral para vender.
texts.en:
El Bancomunal Los Claveles D. Morenita is located in the Huancavelica district of Yauli, Ambato. Amidst the trees and pastures, lie the chozas, adobe houses maD. with straw. The countrysiD. is beautiful and there are plenty of domesticated fowl in the area, hens and chickens. The principal activity of the community is the production of mantas pullas - colorful belts maD. of synthetic fiber and also with Alpaca wool.

Maximiliana D. L. C. is married and has 12 children, including two sets of twins who are 3 and 8 years old and her oldest who is 25. Maximiliana is a weaver and has pulL. looms and colorful vestments with synthetic fibers. All of her children work with the textiles. Some roll the threads into a ball, others separate and others dye until they go to high school or the university. With the loans she has received, she has been able to expand the business. Before she had capital, she could only weave from 5 to 10 mantas. Now she weaves 30 to 40 mantas and brings them to the large markets. At the Bancomunal, Maximiliana has received workshops that have helped her greatly. She serves on the executive board as the finance officer. She considers herself to be very punctual and has learned how to save money. Maximiliana needs a loan to buy an additional loom. Her dream is to own a big business with 30 looms. She is saving to buy a mending machine.

Isabel A. is married with 5 children between the ages of 4 and 14. Isabel began her business selling sweets in the school. Thanks to an inicial loan she received from FINCA, she opened a cafeteria in the school where the teachers and nurses take their meals. Isabel learned to cook and believes this opened her up to a big opportunity. She has had difficulties in her life. She was operated on for an ovarian cyst and spent time in recovery. Her husband helped her, but it wasn't the same and the clientele decreased. Isabel is president of the mothers' club in her community. She thanks FINCA because she has learned many things such as how to direct people, do business with them and see the necessities of her group. Isabel tells us that she has changed as a person. She is going to invest her loan by purchasing dried vegetables and bringing them to Lima, the capital. Her dream is that her children receive a higher education. She is going to save so that her five children can study.

Teresa C. is married and has 7 children. She began her business selling cheese from a pail in the streets. Thanks to the arrival of FINCA Peru to her town, she was able to receive a loan and buy more cheese. Other groups asked for many things and certifications while all she had was her small adobe house and some cattle. She has faced difficulties in her life, such as the death of her 27-year-old son. Her grandchildren were left alone and she has to work hard to take care of them. Teresa received workshops on how to save money. Before she was very quiet, now she knows how to express herself. Her dream is to buy a car. With the credit she received from FINCA she will buy more cheese and also eggs to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El Bancomunal Los Claveles de Morenita requests a loan of $4775 so the 21 partners can invest in their businesses

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 51 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 11 hijos,  vive en el Jr. Los Incas, Sector Totorjahuira del Distrito de Tinicachi, Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno.nnEs una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan”-Yunguyo hace 07 años con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro productos veterinarios. Antes de iniciar con este negocio vendía frazadas  y telas posteriormente  junto a su esposo, cambio de negocio y se dedico a vender productos veterinarios en Juliaca, Arequipa y Cuzco.nnCon el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara mas productos veterinarios como 1 docena de Jarabes contra parásitos a  S/. 356.00, Vitaminas   a  S/. 213.00, inyecciones a S/. 343.50 nuevos soles.nn “Gracias a los prestamos pude construir mi casita” - nos dice la Sra. ElenannSu mayor deseo es abrir una tienda de productos veterinarios en Puno o en Juliacan
texts.en:
Elena tiene 51 au00f1os de edad, es conviviente y madre de 11 hijos, vive en el Jr. Los Incas, Sector Totorjahuira del Distrito de Tinicachi, Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno.nnEs una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal u201cVirgen de Lujanu201d-Yunguyo hace 07 au00f1os con el primer pru00e9stamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro productos veterinarios. Antes de iniciar con este negocio vendu00eda frazadas y telas posteriormente junto a su esposo, cambio de negocio y se dedico a vender productos veterinarios en Juliaca, Arequipa y Cuzco.nnCon el pru00e9stamo que solicitara de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara mas productos veterinarios como 1 docena de Jarabes contra paru00e1sitos a S/. 356.00, Vitaminas a S/. 213.00, inyecciones a S/. 343.50 nuevos soles.nn u201cGracias a los prestamos pude construir mi casitau201d - nos dice la Sra. ElenannSu mayor deseo es abrir una tienda de productos veterinarios en Puno o en Juliacan

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos veterinarios.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza tiene 67 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 06 hijos, estudio el tercer año D. secundaria, vive en el Jr. Yunguyo del Distrito D. Juli, Provincia D. Chuchito-Puno.n Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” –Juli, hace 10 años, con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro bayeta (telas) para bordados. Doña Esperanza, trabajo por muchos años dedicada al negocio D. venta D. relojes que traía  D. Desaguadero y llevaba a Cusco,  una D. sus hija falleció y eso la entristeció bastante por lo que dejo D. viajar y dedicarse a la artesanía. Actualmente se dedica al negocio D. bordados en bayeta que ella misma teje y a veces compra en el campo, envía sus bordados  a su hija que viaja a Chile.nnCon el préstamo que solicitara D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara  bayeta  y lana D. diferentes colores.nnSu deseo es abrir una tienda D. abarrotes para vender en su propia casan
texts.en:
Esperanza is 67 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She studied to the third year of secondary school. She lives in the Chuchito province, Puno, and is a founding member of the communal bank. With her first loan of 300.00 soles received 10 years ago, she augmented her working capital and purchased fabrics for making borders. Esperanza worked for many years selling watches that she brought from Desaguadero to Cusco. One of her daughters died, which maD. her very melancholy, and caused her to switch her endeavors instead to handmaD. crafts. Currently, she dedicates herself to her enterprise making fabric borders that she herself may make or purchase in the countrysiD.. She sends her borders to her daughter who travels to Chile. With the loan of 1,200.00 soles that she is requesting and intends to pay in 4 installments, she will buy fabric and yarn of various colors. Her wish is to open a grocery store to sell products from her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and yarns at wholesale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, estudio el quinto año de secundaria, vive en el Jr. 7 de Junio S/N del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno.nnEs socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”- Yunguyo desde hace 01 año con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro galletas,  gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, etc.  para su tienda de abarrotes. A los 17 años de edad se fue a trabajar a Lima con su hermana, después de un año y medio regreso y puso su pequeña tienda cerca de la Plaza 2 de Mayo, en la que vende todos los días.nnCon el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara 02 sacos de arroz a S/. 280, 02 sacos de azúcar a S/.140, fideos, gaseosas, etc.nnSu deseo es tener una tienda grande y viajar a otros lugaresn
texts.en:
Esther is 19 years old, single, and studied to the fifth year of secondary school. She lives in the Yunguyo district, in the province of Yunguno-Puno. She has been a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Asunción” in Yunguyo for one year, when she received her first loan of 300.00 soles. The loan augmented her working capital and she purchased cookies, sodas, rice, sugar, etc. for her grocery store. At 17 years of age, she went to work in Lima with her sister. After 1 ½ years, she returned and installed her small store near the 2nd of May Plaza where she sells every day. With the loan of 1,500.00 soles that she is requesting and intends to pay back in four installments, she will purchase 2 sacks of rice at 0.28 soles, 2 sacks of sugar at 0.14 soles, noodles, sodas, etc. Her wish is to have a large store and travel to other places.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diverse products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: 310400028 Group

texts.es: El Bancomunal Santa Lucia esta ubicado en Huancavelica, en el distrito de Yauli, comunidad de Ambato en este lugar se encuentran abundantes árboles de Pino, de Eucalipto y plantas de quinua, se caracteriza con el sapo de piedra (qampato) con sus mitos y cuentos, desde su fundación es una zona muy acogedora a pesar de ser un pequeño pueblo. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la ganadería, aquí encontramos vacas, caballos, ovejas existe una zona amplia para la crianza de estos animales, en la agricultura se siembra en parcelas, se produce en forma natural la papa nativa, en el comercio las mujeres se dedican a tejer medias, chullos, gorros, chalinas, etc.n nIsidora Q., esta casada, tiene 8 hijos, se dedica a tejer, compra y vende tejidos ya hechos. Las mayor dificultad que ella ha pasado es que se apropiaron de su terreno y esas personas la apedrearon sufriendo muchos golpes y cayendo enferma. Su vida cambio, en FINCA Perú aprendió a hacer solidaria, ahorradora, puntual en sus pagos, agradece a FINCA por que le prestaron con facilidad 400 nuevos soles y  confiaron en ella, por eso la eligieron Presidenta de su bancomunal. Ella se dedica a comprar mercadería y llevar a otros lugares para hacer trueque, ella da carne por tejidos. El sueño de Isidora es que no le falte comida para cada día, y tener mas ganado ente vaca y ovinosnnSabina B., esta casada con tres hijos de 3 meses, 6 años y 12 años. Su negocio es ser tejedora con lana de alpaca, Sabina hace gorros chalinas, medias, ahora compra mas lanas para pedidos que le realizan las empresas pequeñas  de su pueblo. En su bancomunal se siente en familia, le gusta por que se preocupan por que le vaya bien, ella es muy cumplidora de los reglamentos, ha aprendido ahorrar, tiene muchas amigas. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda llena de mercadería nnSonia C., esta casada, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 12 años, se dedica a tejer a crochet y a palito, realiza pompones para fajas, fustanes. Ha aprendido a ahorrar, a ser líder participativa quiere muchísimo a su bancomunal. El préstamo que le hizo FINCA lo va invertir en comprar más lanas por fardo, realiza al día 30 pompones y al mes 900 pompones. Su sueño es comprar maquinas de coser y 2  remalladoras y para eso trabajará mucho hasta lograrlo.n
texts.en:
El Bancomunal Santa Lucia is located in Huancavelica, in the district of Yauli, Ambato. In this area, you can find an abundance of pine trees, eucalyptus trees and quinua plants. The region identifies itself with the stone frog, qampato, and its myths and stories. Since its foundation, the area has been very welcoming, despite being a small town. The main activity of the town is cattle farming. Here, you can find cows, horses and sheep living in open spaces suitable for the breeding of such animals. Farmers plant crops in tracts and grow a natural form of a native potato species. Women involved in businesses knit and weave socks, chullos (a type of hat), caps, shawls, etc.

Isidora Q. is married and has 8 children. She is a weaver and buys and sells cloth. The most difficult challenge she has faced is when her land was taken over. The people who took her land threw rocks at her and she was hit many times and became sick. Her life changed. With FINCA Peru, she learned solidarity, to become a saver and be punctual in her payments. She is grateful to FINCA because they lent her 400 nuevos soles without difficulty and trusted her. For this reason, they elected her to be President of the village bank. She purchases merchandise and brings it to other places to barter, exchanging meat for cloth. Isidora's dream is to have enough food to eat everyday and have more livestock, mostly cows and sheep.

Sabina B. is married with three children who are 3 months, 6 years old and 12 years old. She has a business, working as a weaver of alpaca wool. Sabina makes caps, shawls and socks. Now she buys more wool for the orders she receives from small businesses in her town. In the village bank, she feels like she is with family. She likes the bank because they concern themselves about how she is doing. She follows the rules closely, has learned how to save and has many friends. Her dream is to have her own store, full of merchandise.

Sonia C. is married and has 3 children who are 5, 9 and 12 years old. She crochets and knits, making pompom decorations for belts and skirts. She has learned how to save and be a participatory leader. She loves the bank very much. She is going to invest the loan that FINCA gave her in the purchase of more bundles of wool. She plans to make 30 pompoms a day and 900 per month. Her dream is to buy sewing machines and two mending machines. She will work until her dream comes true.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El Bancomunal Santa Lucia requests a loan of $2125 so the 11 partners can invest in their businesses

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "LOS JAZMINES" REPRESENTADAS POR SU PRESIDENTA LA SEÑORA LOURDES SE DEDICAN A DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMO POR EJEMPLO A LA VENTA D. ROPA, COMIDA Y CDS EN EL MERCADO D. SU ZONA, COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA ESPECIALMENTE EN EL SECTOR DEL COMERCIO. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. LAS SOCIAS, SERA DESTINADO PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SUS MERCADERIAS, COMPRA D. MATERIAL Y HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO PARA DESEMPEÑAR SU TRABAJO CON MAYOR EFICICENCIA Y PEDER LLEGAR CON MAYOR IMPACTO AL MERCADO. LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS, EN LO QUE RESPECTA A AGROCAPITAL ALGUNAS YA PARTICIPARON EN FINANCIAMIENTOS ANTERIORES.
texts.en:
The members of the Community Bank "Los Jazmines", represented by their president Ms Lourdes, earn a living from different activities such as selling clothes, food or CDs in their local market. In all commercial fields there always exists competition between supply and demand, but especially in the small business sector. According to the wishes of the members, the loan will be used to increase their merchandise, and to buy materials and work tools in order to carry out their work more efficiently and to be able to have a greater impact on the market. The members comment that they have experience with solidarity groups, and some have participated in previous Fundación Agrocapital financing.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Ann

texts.es: La señora Ann pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. José del Carmen Cabrejos Nº. 762, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de carpintería metálica. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de salchipapa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con un taller de costura en casa. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes confecciona prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.nnCon este préstamo de S/1,400, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 metros de tela dacrón, 8 kilos de tela algodón, 2 docenas de cierres, hilos y otros.nnGracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido y tiene el deseo de seguir progresando en su negocio para la estabilidad de sus hijos. nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Ann belongs to the Community Bank Corazon de Jesus, located on Jr. Josue del Carmen Cabrejos Nuba 762, Callerueda Discrict, province of Colonel Portillo, department of Ucyali. She is 46 years old and is a mother of 4, two grown and 2 who still depend on her. She is married and her house is dedicated to metal carpentry. with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest it in the sale of salchipapa. She has two years working with the community bank. She actually has a sewing workshop in her house. in the mornings she dedicates herself to her home, and in the afternoon to crafting men's, women's, and children's clothes. With this loan of 1400 soles, whish she will repay in 4 months, she will by 6 meters of dacrun fabric, 8 kilos of cotton, 2 dozen buttons, needles, and more. Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has grown and she hopes to continue progressing in her business for the stability of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Charly Jannisse

texts.es: La señora Charly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Piura Nº 151, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 1 hija menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa.
