Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con una motokar como herramienta de trabajo, la cual hace trabajar todos los días para tener ingresos económicos que le permita pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. nnCon este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 2 frenos, tapizará los asientos, arreglará el motor, etc.nnCharly manifiesta que todas las mujeres pueden salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y voluntad.n
texts.en:
Charly belongs to the comunal bank “Vecinas Unidas” (“United Neighbors”), located in the Calleria district of the Colonel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 30 years old, and is the mother of one young daughter who is still dependent on her. She is married, and her husband dedicates himself to driving a motokar. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in clothing sales. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Currently, she relies on a motokar as her tool, and she works it every day to earn income that will allow her to make her loan payments on time. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 tires, 2 brakes, reupholster the seats, fix the engine, etc. Charly states that all women can get ahead with effort and will.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires, brakes, seating upholstery, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  MUJERES VENCEDORAS, esta conformado por señoras que en su mayoría radican en la ciudad D. El Alto.nLa directiva esta conformada por la señora Teresa como su presidenta, Beatriz y Yolanda como tesorera y secretaria, las socias se dedican en su mayoría a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, al tejido a la venta D. comida y verduras, algunas son dueñas D. tiendas D. barrios y otros micronegocios independientes. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su cuarto ciclo, la mayoría D. ellas ya se conocen entre si y cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que componen el mismo grupo desD. hace ya tres ciclos atrás, es un grupo D. personas muy alegres y están muy animadas para trabajar con la Fundación AGROCAPITAL, debido a su puntualidad y compromiso en sus anteriores ciclos este grupo esta catalogado como uno D. los mas emprendedores dentro D. la fundación.n
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Vencedoras" Community Bank, meaning '"winning women" in English, is maD. up of women who primarily live in the city of El Alto. The executive is formed by Ms Teresa as president, Beatriz as treasurer and Yolanda as secretary. The members primarily earn a living from dress-making, and from selling food and vegetables. Some own neigbourhood stores, while others own independent micro-businesses. This group is starting their fourth cycle. The majority of the women already know each other and have experience in solidarity groups, as the same group has been together for the past three cycles. It is a group of very happy people, and they are very motivated to work with the Fundación Agrocapital. Owing to their punctuality and commitment during the previous cycles, this group is classified as one of the most enterprising within the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Cinthya Janet

texts.es: La señora Cinthya pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. Arbolización Mz. 2 Lt. 9, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (AVON, UNIQUE) y apoya a su esposo en el negocio de la madera.nnCon este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará productos de belleza, cremas de manos y cuerpos, colonias y otros.nnCinthya es una joven que le gusta el trabajo y gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.nn
texts.en:
Cinthya belongs to the communal bank “Amigas por Siempre” (“Friends Forever”), located in the Yarinacocha district in the Colonel Portillo province of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and the mother of two small children who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband is dedicated to the extraction of lumber. With the first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the communal bank for three years. Currently, she dedicates herself to selling beauty products (AVON, UNIQUE) and supports her husband in the lumber business. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, to be repaid in five installments, she will purchase beauty products such as hand and body creams, colognes, and other items. Cinthya is a young woman who enjoys work and, thanks to Manuela Ramos, her financial stability has improved.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products, creams, colognes, etc.

loans.name: Dalis

texts.es: La señora Dalis pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en la Calle Oxapampa Mz.P Lt.1 AAHH Nuevo Bolognesi, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 64 años de edad y es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en la crianza de pollos. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.n.nEn la actualidad continua con la crianza de pollos. Acostumbra a levantarse temprano para darles los alimentos a sus pollos y venderlos a sus clientes. n nCon este préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 100 pollos pequeños para criar, un saco de inicio, crecimiento y engorde. nnDalis agradece a Dios por todas las cosas buenas que le ha pasado y por tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y luchando por la vida.n
texts.en:
Dalis belongs to the communal bank San Fernando II, located in the Calleria district, Colonel Portillo province, in Ucayali. She is 64 years old and a single mother of six grown children. She decided to invest her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos into raising poultry. She has been working with the communal bank for five years. Currently, she continues with raising chickens. She is accustomed to getting up early to feed them, and then to work selling them to her customers. With this loan of 2,500.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 100 small chicks to raise and a bag of feed to help them grow and fatten. Dalis gives thanks to God for all the good she has in her life, and for giving her good health to continue working and fighting.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small chicks to raise and food for them.

loans.name: Delicia Rosa

texts.es: La señora Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en la Av. Colonización Nº 595, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Ttiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo labora como personal de servicio en ”EMAPACOPSA”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.n.nEn la actualidad se dedica a la venta de zapatos, polos y productos de belleza “AVON”. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permite cumplir con el pago del préstamo.  nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bolsas de perlas de diferente color, 6 paquetes de pétalos, 50 piezas de polos,10 láminas de biocuero y productos de belleza.  nnDelicia manifiesta que con fe, esfuerzo y voluntad se logra el éxito. Agradece al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada.n
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the communal bank “Corazón de Jesús” (“Heart of Jesus”), located in the Callería district of the Colonel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of two young children who still dependend on her. She is married, and her husband works as part of the personnel for EMAPACOPS. She decided to invest her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos into beauty product sales. She has been working with the communal bank for one year. Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of shoes, polos, and AVON products. This enterprise brings her earnings that allow her to meet her loan payment obligations. With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 4 bags of different colored pearls, 6 packets of petals, 50 polos, 10 sheets of shiny leather and beauty products. Delicia tells us that with faith, effort and will she manages to succeed. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos communal bank for the help provided.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of pearls, petals, polo pieces, etc.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La señora Dora pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Fitzcarrald Nº 314, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de la “UNU”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a administrar un locutorio, a la venta de gaseosas y bebidas, a su hogar y tiene el apoyo total de su familia.n nCon este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tarjetas de 10, 15 y recargas virtuales, 2 cajas de galletas, 2 paquetes de sporade, etc.  nnDora manifiesta alegría por todas las cosas buenas que le ha pasado en la vida, agradece al Banco por la ayuda brindada. n
texts.en:
Dora belongs to the Communal Bank “San Fernando II,” located at Jr. Fitzcarrald Nº 314, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali province. She is 47 years old, mother to 3 children, 2 are adults and one still depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a professor in the “UNU.” With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in the sales of soda pop. She has worked with the communal bank for 5 years. Today she is the manager of a phone café and sales of soda pop and beverages at her home and she has the support of her family. With this loan for S/.1,200, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy phone cards in denominations of 10 and 15 plus rechargeable cards, 2 cases of cookies, 2 packages of Sporade sports drink, etc. Dora states she is happy with everything that has happened in her life, and she thanks the Bank for the help it has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy telephone cards, cookies, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: La señora Enma pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 132, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de un carro, es  chofer. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.n.nEn la actualidad cuenta con la venta de verduras, ropa y zapatos usados. Emma viaja a vender su mercadería a sus clientes, lo cual le brinda ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una docena de blusas y faldas, 3 docenas de polos, 2 cajas de tomates, 2 cajas de cebolla y 20 pares de zapatos.nnEnma es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que lucha día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica.nn
texts.en:
Senora Enma is a member of "San Fernando" communal bank located on Jr. Sinchi Roca #132, Callerueda District, Colonel Portillo Province, Ucayali Department. She is 51, married, and the mother of 6 grown children. Her husband is a chauffeur. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for $100, she decided to invest in clothing sales. She has been working with the communal bank for 4 years now, and she currently sells vegetables and used clothing and shoes. Enma travels to sell her merchandise to her clients, which brings in the earnings to make her loan payments punctually. With this loan of $325, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a dozen blouses and skirts, 3 dozen polo shirts, 2 boxes of tomatoes, 2 cases of onions, and 20 pairs of shoes. Enma is an enterprising and hard-working woman who keeps on fighting to improve her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, skirts, polo shirts, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 134, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos, 6 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja viajando como jefe de campamento. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.n.nEn la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio de venta de comida “Menú”. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado y comprar lo necesario para preparar sus deliciosos platos de comida y brindarle lo mejor a sus clientes. nnCon este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 7 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 5 kilos de carne, 6 kilos de pescado, verduras, etc. nnGracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido y por ende tendrá la oportunidad de darle una mejor educación a su menor hija.n
texts.en:
Ms Julia belongs to the Community Bank "San Fernando II", located at 134 Jr. Sinchi Rosa, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the administrative division of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and the mother of seven children, six of whom are grown up, while one is still dependent on her. She is married and her husband works travelling as a camp director. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in selling food. She has worked with the community bank for six years. Currently she continues with the same business selling lunch menus. She wakes up early to go to the market and buy the necessary items to cook her delicious meals and bring the best to her customers. With this loan of S./ 2,500, which will be repayed in 4 months, she will buy 7 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 5 kilos of meat, 6 kilos of fish, vegetables and more. Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has grown, and she will have the opportunity to give her youngest daughter a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish, seafood etc.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. 1 de Mayo Nº 663 “Micaela Bastidas”, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad y es madre soltera de una hija menor de edad que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de refrescos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a la venta de plátanos, frutas y refresco, para ello se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ir atender su puesto. Trabaja todos los días, lo cual le  brinda ganancias que le permite cumplir con el préstamo.  nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 racimos de plátanos, 5 kilos de mango, 6 kilos de maíz, un saco de limón, etc. nnGracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido. Tiene el deseo de seguir surgiendo por el bienestar de su pequeña hija.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a member of "Mujeres Perseverantes" Community Bank, located at 663 "Micaela Bastidas", Jr. 1 de Mayo in the Calleria District, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the single mother of a little girl who is still dependent on her. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. She invested the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, a loan of $100, into the sale of soft drinks. Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of bananas, fruits and refreshments and to do so, she gets up at 5 in the morning to tend to her stall. She works every day, which earns her enough income to make good on the loans she receives. With this next loan of $425, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 4 bunches of bananas, 5 kilos of mangoes, 6 kilos of corn, a bag of lemons etc. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has grown. Julia has a great desire to keep succeeding for the well being of her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of bananas, mangos, corn, lemons etc.

loans.name: Maria España

texts.es: La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. Mariano Melgar Nº  596, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Ttiene 52 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de fréjol cocido. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, venta de fréjol regional y canario. Se levanta a las 3 a.m. a cocinar sus fréjoles para luego salir a venderlos a las 6 a.m. en el mercado Micaela Bastidas. nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 15 kilos de fréjol regional y canario. nnGracias al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos sus ventas han crecido y en estas últimas semanas sus clientes han aumentado con la bendición de Dios.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the "Mujeres Perseverantes" Communal Bank, located at 596 Jr. Mariano Melgar, in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has three grown children. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. She invested the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of $100, into the sale of cooked beans. Today, she continues to sell a variety of regional bean dishes. She gets up at 3 a.m. to cook so that her dishes will be ready for sale in the Micaela Bastidas market by 6 a.m. With this new loan of $400, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 15 kilos of beans. Thanks to the Manuela Ramos, her sales have increased and she has been blessed with an ever expanding number of clients. .

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of various beans

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: La señora Marilu pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en el Jr. 1 de Mayo Nº 678 “Micaela Bastidas”, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de vinos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio de “venta de vinos de uvas”, el cual le  brinda ganancias que le permite pagar su préstamo puntualmente.nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 galones de vinos de uvas para vender a sus clientes.nnMarilu agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada, lo cual le permitirá seguir ampliando más su negocio.nn
texts.en:
Mrs. Marilu is a member of the "Mujeres Perseverantes" Communal Bank, located at 678 "Micaela Bastidas", Jr. 1 de Mayo, in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo Province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and single. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 2 years. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was of $100, which she invested into the sale of wines. Today, she continues her business selling grape wines, which earns her enough income for the punctual payment of her loans. With this next loan of $325, which will be payed back over 4 months, she will buy 4 gallons of wine to sell to her clients. Marilu is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the assistance they offer, which allows her to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of 4 gallons of grape wine

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria Mz. A Lt. 21, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 42 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos, uno mayor D. edad y uno que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como patrón D. una lancha maderera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la costura. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller D. costura en casa, confecciona diferentes prendas D. vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. nnCon este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 metros D. tela algodón, 5 metros D. dacrón, 7 metros D. policeda, 4 cajas D. botones, elástico, blondas, etc.nnMarina manifiesta que el banco comunal es una ayuda para su familia. Agradece a todas aquellas personas que le brindaron su apoyo.n
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the Communal Bank, "Heart of Jesus", located in the Yarinacocha district in the city of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old. She is the mother of 2 sons- one of age and one that still depends on her. She is married, and her husband is the skipper of a lumber boat. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in dressmaking. She has worked with the communal bank for two years. Currently, she has a small sewing workshop at home and makes different articles of clothing for women, men and children. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy 6 meters of cotton fabric, 5 meters of polyester, 7 meters of silk, and 4 boxes of buttons, elastic, lace, etc. Marina feels that the communal bank helps her family. She is grateful for everyone that has offered her support.

Translated from Spanish by Anne R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of fabrics (cotton, silk, etc.), buttons, elastics, lace, etc.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es: La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, ubicado en el Jr. Los Cedros Mz. C Lt. 13, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como representantes de ventas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad confecciona zapatos para damas y niñas, negocio que le brinda una ganancia para pagar su préstamo puntualmente.  nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 docenas de mostacillas, una docena de lágrimas acrílicas, 3 docenas de hebillas plateadas y otros adornos. nnMónica manifiesta que desde muy joven se hizo independiente gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.n
texts.en:
Monica belongs to the Communal Bank, "Heart of Jesus", located in the district of Yarinacocha in the city of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali state. She is 26 years old and is the mother of 2 young children that still depend on her. She is married, and her husband is a sales representative. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling soda. She has worked with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently, she makes shoes for women and girls, a business that provides her with the earnings to pay her loan on time. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy 2 dozen beads, 1 dozen acrylic teardrops, 3 dozen silver-plated buckles, and other decorations. Monica claims that since she was very young she has been independent, thanks to the help that Manuela Ramos offers to her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 dozen beads, 1 dozen acrylic teardrops, 3 dozen silver-plated buckles, and other decorations

loans.name: Nisida Aurora

texts.es: La señora Nisida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes”, ubicado en la Carretera Antigua de Yarinacocha Nº 290, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vendedor de libros y productos medicinales. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza (EBEL). Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos naturales medicinales. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para vender los productos a sus clientes.nnCon este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 cajas de Vita Maca, 4 Omniplus, 5 cajas de Látex de Plátano y otros productos medicinales.nnNisida está muy contenta porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y su habilidad, lo cual le permitirá darles una buena educación a sus menores hijos.  nn
texts.en:
Nisida belongs to the Communal Bank, "Perseverant Women", located in the district of Yarinacocha in the city of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali state. She is 33 years old and is the mother of 3 young children that still depend on her. She is married, and her husband sells medicinal books and products. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling beauty products. She has worked with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently, she is dedicated to selling natural medicinal products. She has her husband's support to sell the products to his clients. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy 3 boxes of Vita Maca, 4 boxes of Omniplus, 5 boxes of Látex de Plátano, and other medicinal products. Nisida is very happy because everything she has achieved is thanks to her effort and her capabilities, which will permit her to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of Vita Maca, 4 boxes of Omniplus, and 5 boxes of látex de plátano, etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 50 años, convive con su esposo, tienen 5 hijos, quienes le ayudan a sembrar y cultivar sus chacras cuando requiera de apoyo. Se dedica a la siembra es la arveja, en sociedad con el dueño de los campos, esta vez ha sembrado de 24 kilos de semilla, que le permitirá cosechar una cantidad de 50 sacos, la arveja se cosecha de dos a tres veces, esta es la única actividad que conoce. Llegada la temporada de cosecha se divide en 50% con los dueños de la chacra, que denomina “sembrar a medias”. A ella y a su esposo esta actividad le permite educar a sus hijos. Nos dice que sería mucho mejor si tuvieran sus propias tierras, ya no tendría que compartir su producción. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero comprará guano de corral para el abono de las arvejas, Felicia ha sembrando papa en una chacra donde produjo anteriormente, por ello no necesita abono adicional.
texts.en:
Felicia, 50, lives with her husband. They have 5 children who help her to sow and cultivate her fields when help is needed. She cultivates peas in association with the field owner. This time she has sown 24 kilos of seed, which will allow her to harvest 50 sacks. Peas are sown 2 to 3 times, this is the only thing she knows. When harvest season arrives, it is divided 50/50 with the owners of the fields, meaning she gets half of what she sowed. This enables her and her husband to educate their children. She tells us that it would be much better if they had their own lands, so they would not have to share the produce. This is her first loan with MFP. With this money she will buy farm manure to fertilize the peas, Felicia has sown potatoes in a field she has used before, so she will not need additional fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her agricultural fields

loans.name: Norita

texts.es: La señora Norita pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytia Nº 571, distrito D. Manantay, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, 5 D. ellos mayores D. edad y uno que aún depenD. D. ella y está separada D. su esposo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio, la venta D. comida. Trabaja con la ayuda D. su hermana y ambas se dedican a su hogar y a su negocio. n nCon este préstamo D. S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 kilos D. arroz, 5 pollos, 6 kilos D. carne, 7 kilos D. pescado, verduras y otros.nnNorita manifiesta que Manuela Ramos apoya a todas aquellas mujeres trabajadoras y tiene el deseo D. surgir en la vida.nn
texts.en:
Norita belongs to the Communal Bank, "San Fernando II", located in the district of Manantay in the city of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali state. She is 49 years old and is the mother of 6 children- 5 of which are of age and 1 that still depends on her. She is separated from her husband. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling food. She has worked with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently, she is dedicated to the same business, the sale of food. She works with the help of her sister. Both are dedicated to their home and their business. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 6 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 6 kilos of meat, 7 kilos of fish, vegetables, and other foods. Norita claims that Manuela Ramos supports all working women and has the desire to rise up in life.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, chickens, meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores y su suegro. En horas de la mañana prepara los alimentos para su familia, luego se dedica a llevar el almuerzo de su esposo a la chacra a eso de las11 am., esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, desde que vive con su esposo. Para ella era muy dificultoso adaptarse al ritmo de vida que llevan en el campo, pero ahora ya se adaptó, es la única actividad que tiene su esposo. Pero ella ha visto conveniente criar y vender cerdos, alimentándolos con las papas que pierde en las cosechas, como no están en la calidad para la venta en los mercados, es mejor que los aprovechen los cerdos y de ese modo generarse una fuente de ingreso adicional.  Es una clienta nueva de MFP. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará fosfato y nitrato de potasio, de ese modo poder abonar su chacra de arvejas.
texts.en:
Lucila is 21 years old and lives with her husband, 2 younger children and father-in-law. In the morning she prepares the family’s meals and then at around 11am, takes it upon herself to deliver her husband’s lunch to him out in the fields, something she has been doing for 4 years, since living with her husband. At first she found it very difficult to adapt to the rhythm of life in the country but now she is used to it. Crop-growing is her husband’s only livelihood yet she has also seen an advantage in rearing and selling pigs, feeding them the potatoes that are not good enough to sell in the markets. For her it is better that the pigs feed on these crops than they go to waste and in this way generating an additional source of income. Lucila is new to MFP and with the loan she intends to buy phosphate and potassium nitrate so that she can fertilise her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser to cultivate her land

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 38 anos, esta divorciada convive con su pareja Florencio de 41 y sus dos hijos Wilfredo de 18 y Diego Armando de 12. Lo que le gusta a Yolanda de su trabajo es el poder hacerlo desde la comodidad de su casa, pero la dificultad reside en tener que permanecer durante todo el día en su establecimiento, sin tener la libertad de salir cuando ella lo disponga, ya que ahora se debe a su clientela. Es su segundo prestamo, y ella es muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero implementara su tienda con mayor cantidad de productos, para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old and divorced. She lives with her partner Florencio who is 41 and their sons, Wilfredo, 18 and Diego Armando, 12. The fact that Yolanda is able to work from the comfort of her home is the aspect of her job that she enjoys the most. However, she finds it hard to remain in the house all day long, without the freedom of being able to go outside when needed, now that she has a duty to her customers. This is the second loan she has requested and she always makes her repayments on time. With the money, she intends to fill her shop with more produce, in order to fulfil her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more produce for her shop

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita tiene 22 anos, convive con su pareja Fredy de 24 años el cual es chofer y su querido Aldo de 6 añitos. Benita se dedica desde hace 01 ano a la venta de cerveza, y a la venta de artefactos de segunda mano, ya que estas dos actividades le generan buenos ingresos economicos.nLo que le gusta a Benita es la independencia que le da para poder apoyar con los gastos del hogar, ya que el trabajo de chofer de su pareja no se abastece para abastecer con todos los gastos que requiere su hogar.nLo mas dificil de su trabajo es el tener que andar de un lado para otro con sus dos oficios, y no pudiendo pasar mucho tiempo con su familia. Benita esta es su segundo ciclo de su primer préstamo con micro finanzas prisma y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero del prestamo comprara mas cajas de cerveza  e incrementara su mercaderia de artefactos usados.n
texts.en:
Benita is 22 years old and lives with her 24-year old partner Fredy, who is a driver, and her dear Aldo who is six years old. Benita has worked for the past year selling beer and second-hand articles, since both these activities generate good income. What Benita likes is the independence these endeavors provide, allowing her to help with the household expenses since her partner’s work as a driver does not generate enough income. The most difficult part about her work is traveling from place to place to manage both activities, leaving her with little time to spend with her family. Benita is in the second cycle of her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and is very punctual with her payments. With the funds from the loan she will purchase more cases of beer and increase her supply of used merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase quantity of products

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es: Melquíades tiene 40 años, vive solo ya que esta divorciado de su pareja, pero ayuda a la manutención de sus 4 hijos Tania de 13, Joel de 6, Neftali de 4 y Jose de 3. El ser Albañil le ha traído muchas gratificaciones, ya que le permite mantener a sus hijos, los cuales necesitan de su apoyo. Melquiades realiza este trabajo desde hace ya 5 años, siendo  lo mas difícil de este que no es un trabajo seguro , sino esporádico ya que cuando acaba la construcción de alguna obra queda ese lapso de tiempo sin trabajo, por lo cual también ha decidido dedicarse a la carpinteria para asegurar sus ingresos. Melquiades esta es su segundo ciclo de su primer prestamo con micro finanzas Prisma y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero del prestamo comprara herramientas para su trabajo de albañil y para el de carpintero, para así poder forjarse un futuro mejor. n
texts.en:
Melquiades is 40 years old and he lives alone, having been divorced from his partner. But he helps to support their 4 children, Tania who is 13, Joel who is 6, Neftali who is 4, and Jose who is 3 years old. Being a laborer has brought him many benefits, especially because it helps him support his children, all of whom need his care. Melquiades has carried out his occupation for the past 5 years. The hardest part about his job is that is it not steady employment, but ready sporadic. After he completes a construction project there is a lapse of time he is without work. It is in those times that he decided to do carpentry to supplement his income. Melquiades is currently on the second cycle of his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is very punctual with his payments. With the funds from this loan he will purchase tools for his work as a laborer and as a carpenter, so that he may build a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work as a laborer and as a carpenter.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch R. is a villager in Rolos Village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a farmer.

On her plantation she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow her crops.

Her husband Mr. Chhouk Mon is a construction worker who earns only a small salary.

In order to fix her field, Mrs. Touch R. has decided to ask for a loan so she can hire laborers with two oxen to plow her field. She will also buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her field and make her crops more productive.

She is 49 years old and the mother of three children. One child is a construction worker. The other two children attend the local school.

Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow the field and buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoy S. was born in 1979. She now lives in Rolos Village in Takeo Province.

She is a farmer and she owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow her crops.

Her husband Mr. Pil Dey is a construction worker, who earns a small salary.

In order to improve her plantation Mrs. Ngoy S. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy fertilizers to support her field and make her crops more productive.

She is a mother of two children who attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy S. is a villager in Ta Preas Village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, she faces an obstacle because the soil on her field is infertile.

Her husband Mr. Him Thy is a construction worker, but does not earn a large salary.

In order to help her field, Mrs. Sothy S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers so she can support her field and grow more crops.

She is 31 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children attend the local school. The youngest child is too young to work or study.

Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field

loans.name: Chikou

texts.en: Mrs. Chikou N. was born in 1981 and now she lives in Thom village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder and her husband, Mr. Nget Nan, is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In Mrs. Chikou N.’s business, she faces a small problem because she does not much money to support her breeding. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy duck foods to support her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living condition with this loan. Mrs. Chikou N. is a mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy duck foods to support her business.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mom L. is a villager in Sen Born village in Takeo Province. She is a housewife who takes care of her children. Her husband Mr. Tho To is a construction worker. They have four children. One child is employed as a security gaurd and the other three children attend the local school.

They do not earn enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Srey Mom L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband. The motorbike will allow her husband to work more. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap N. was born in 1967, and she is now living in the village of Reusey Srouk in Takeo province. She is a farmer, and she owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice in order to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Phan Ly, pictured on the left, is a construction worker. They have five children who attend the local school.

Unfortunately, she and her husband do not generate sufficient revenues from their respective occupations to support their family's living expenses. Thus, Mrs. Pheap N. decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. In turn, she hopes to increase her income and to thereby improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith K. is a villager in Ang Tanuo village in Takeo Province. She is a hen and pig breeder. She faces some problems because her business is going well but it is nearly finished. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Ith K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy four pigs and one hundred hens for breeding to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Nang, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ith K. is a 29-year-old mother of four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and one hundred hens

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn N., who is 42 years old, lives in the village of Ang Tanuo in Takeo province. Notably, she is the mother of six children: one child is a construction worker, four children attend the local school, and the youngest child is too young to work or study. She is a farmer, and she owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice in order to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tang Nhoem, pictured on the left, is a construction worker.

Unfortunately, Mrs. Sorn N. and her husband do not generate enough income to cover their family's living expenses. Thus, Mrs. Sorn N. decided to seek a loan to buy two cows for breeding purposes; moreover, she plans on utilizing the cows to plow her field (rather than hiring laborers to do so). In turn, she hopes to increase her income and to thereby improve her family's standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for breeding purposes and for farming assistance

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra H., who is 37 years old, lives in the village of Rosey Srouk in Takeo province. Importantly, she is the mother of three children, all of whom attend the local school. For a living, she bakes cakes and then sells the cakes for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Chey Kakada, pictured on the left of the photo, is a farmer. More specifically, he owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice in order to earn a living.

Unfortunately, Mrs. Ra H. and her husband do not generate sufficient income to support their growing family. Therefore, she decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. In turn, she hopes to increase her income and to thereby improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding purposes

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol K. was born in 1978 and now she lives in Ang Tanuo village in Takeo Province. She is a hen and pig breeder. In her business, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to continue her business and she is out of animals.

In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Chanthol K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy eight pigs and a hundred chickens to raise. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nang Soka, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chanthol K. is the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy eight pigs and a hundred chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Soda

texts.en: Mrs. Soda S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Bora Hoeung, 38, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1992, they have three daughters who are currently studying at a local school. Mrs. Soda has been a silk weaver for twenty years. She learned the skill from her neighbors when she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished product to the trader in the village, who then sells them to Phnom Penh. Both Mrs. S. and her husband are also primary school teachers. Mrs. Soda is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Saing

texts.en: Mrs. Saing K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sokleang Saum, 45, live in a small village located 17 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Married in 1991, they have three sons and two daughters. One of their children works in a garment, while the other four are studying in a local school. Mrs. Saing has been a garment factory worker for five years, while Mr. Sokleang has been a motor remoque taxi driver for two years. A motor remoque taxi is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. His trailer is currently broken and he needs to replace it. Therefore, Mrs. Saing is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a new trailer to replace the one for her husband to continue his business. Besides driving a remoque, her husband is also a Khmer traditional musician.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer

loans.name: Naiseam

texts.en:
Mrs. Naiseam E., who is 28 years old, lives in the village of Eysan Meanchey in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Sim, pictured on the left of the photo, are both farmers; more specifically, they own a plot of land upon which they cultivate both rice and vegetables. In addition, they have two children, both of whom are too young to work or study.

On their plantation, they face an obstacle in that their rice field has infertile soil, which adversely affects their crops. In order to address this problem, Mrs. Naiseam E. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to make her land more productive and to thereby grow more crops. In turn, she hopes to generate an increase in her family's income and to improve her famiy's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To increase their crop yield by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Rashidan M.bashir Shahid Group

texts.en:
Rashidan baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan that is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkaru. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She is the mother of six sons all of whom are still in school. Rashidan baji's husband is a salesman and has been selling milk for the past 20 years. He buys milk from the milk shop of his local community and resells it in different areas of Pakpattan. Rashidan baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Rashidan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more milk to help expand her husband's milk selling business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Yasmeen baji is requesting a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Samina baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Shamim baji is requesting a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell. Fozia baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale

loans.name: Sakina M.arshad Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of M. and resides in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years and is the mother of three young children. Sakina bajiu husband is a milk seller by profession and has been selling milk for the past 5 years. He has one buffalo at his house. There are many men in the community that sell milk for a living and competition is great. Sakina baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Sakina baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk selling business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Anwar baji is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for resale. Shamim baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zakia baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Haleema baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to produce more milk for selling.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar baji is the wife of A. M. and lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkard. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 2 years. Shamim Akhtar baji is the mother of four young children: two sons and two daughters all of whom are attending school. Shamim baji's husband has owned a grocery shop in the community for the past 16 years. Shamim baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Shamim baji has successfully repaid her past two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zahida baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Tasleem baji is requesting a loan to buy tools for her bicycle repairing business. Hafeez baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Vannoen

texts.en:
Mr. Vannoen P., who is 22 years old, lives in the village of Preak Samraong in Kandal province. His wife, Mrs. Moeurn Sokoeurn, is a garment factory worker. They have a 4-year-old child who is too young to work or study.

He is a vegetable farmer who grows vegetables on a small plot of land. However, his field is in a remote location, so it is difficult to irrigate the land. As such, he is seeking a loan to buy a pump to water his field.

loans.use: To better irrigate his field by purchasing a pump

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Mrs. Muth S., who is 37 years old, lives in the village of Boeng in Kandal province. She is a garment worker, while her husband, Mr. Yoem Yen, pictured on the left of the photo, is a construction worker. They have four children, all of whom attend the local school.

Despite the fact that she and her husband work extremely hard, they do not generate enough income to support their family's living expenses or to improve their standard of living. As a result, Mrs. Muth S. is seeking a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house for her family in the future and to thereby provide the family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To one day build a new house in order to improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Mrs. Ann Soy Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ann S., who is 30 years old, is the group leader of five group members, all of whom live in the village of Preak Samraong in Kandal province. She owns a small lake where she breeds fish. Her husband, Mr. Pheng Ron, helps her with the business. They have four children, one of whom attends the local school, while the remaining three are too young to work or study (they are 1, 2, and 3 years old).

Because her business has been doing well, she wants to expand the business. Accordingly, she is seeking a loan to buy more fish for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for breeding purposes

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six people from the village of Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal province, and they are seeking a loan for different business purposes. Mrs. Chantha S. was selected by the other group members to be the group leader.

By way of a brief background, Mrs. Chantha S. is a 37-year-old widow, and she has one child who attends the local school. She sells goods in the local village for a living. And, because her business has been doing well, she wants to expand the business. As such, she is seeking a loan to buy more goods to re-sell, which she hopes will improve her family's living conditions in turn.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing inventory

loans.name: Mr. Phearak Pang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The members of this group live in the village of Preak Samraong Village in Kandal province, and they are seeking a loan for various business purposes.

Mr. Phearak P. is the group's leader. He is a 23-year-old fisherman who is unable to catch fish because he does not have enough fishing equipment. To address this problem, Mr. Phearak P. is seeking a loan to buy a new boat and fish nets to re-start his business. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeurn Nary, is employed in a garment factory, and she earns a small salary to support their household. They have a 1-year-old child who is too young to work or study.

In practice, this is a group loan, but the loans are structured in two ways: four members are seeking end-of-term loans, while the rest of the group's members would like monthly payment loans. With respect to the end-of-term loans, the borrowers are not required to repay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Notably, end-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor population. Specifically, such loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Even so, most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and nearly all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. In fact, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To revamp his business by purchasing a new boat and fish nets

loans.name: Ta's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members who live in Pou Village in Takeo province. Mrs. Ta O., who is 31 years old, is the group's leader, and she is a vegetable farmer. She owns a small piece of land, where she is able to generate a small amount of income. Now, she wants to expand her business operations, so she is seeking a loan to add to her savings and to eventually buy another piece of land in order to cultivate more vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Sao Sin, is a laborer who earns a small amount of income to support their household. In addition, they have one child, who is also a laborer.

These four group members are seeking end-of-term loans, which do not obligate borrowers to repay any principal on their loans until the end of the loans' term. Notably, end-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor population. Specifically, such loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Even so, most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and nearly all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. In fact, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland in order to cultivate more vegetables

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon K., a 30-year-old widow, lives in Sras Pring Village in Kampong Cham province, where she owns a small beauty salon. She is the mother of one child, who is enrolled in the local school.

Because her business has been doing rather well, she would like to expand the business. As such, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more equipment and beauty products for her salon. In turn, she expects to generate an increase in her income and to thereby improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand and improve her beauty salon by purchasing additional equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mr. Phea P. was born in 1977, and he now lives in Eysan Meanchey Village in Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, he is a farmer; more specifically, he owns land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Nhen Nob, helps him on their plantation. Moreover, they have a 3-year-old child, who is too young to work or study.

Unfortunately, he has been experiencing problems on his plantation because his field is infertile, which has an adverse affect on his crops. To address this problem, he is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to increase the crop yield on his plantation. In addition, he explains that if there are any remaining loan proceeds, he would use such proceeds to purchase more pesticides.

loans.use: To increase his plantation's crop yield by purchasing fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mr. Eng P., who is 52 years old, lives in Eysan Meanchey village in Kampong Cham province. He owns land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Prum Sreng, pictured on the left of the photo, assists him on their plantation. They have one child, who attends the local school.

Unfortunately, he has been experiencing problems on his plantation due to the fact that the soil is infertile. As a result, in order to address this issue, he is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to increase his crop yield.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. lives in Eysan Meanchey Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares for cultivating rice. Unfortunately, she now faces a small problem on her plantation as the soil is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Mao, is a buffalo breeder.

Mrs. Oun S. is 30 years old and the mother three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of two years. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Theun

texts.en:
Mr. Theun C. is a villager in Eysan Meanchey Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who grows cassava on a 1-hectar field. He now has a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy cassavas to plant. Thus, Mr. Theun C. decided to request a loan for this purpose.

His wife, Mrs. Sok Eng, assists him on the plantation. Mr. Theun C. is 36 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining one is too young to work or study at four years old. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassava to plant.

loans.name: Sinart

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinart N. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Takeop Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. For her rice farming, she cultivates a 1 hectare field, and cultivates vegetables on the other 2 hectare field. In the second plantation, she is facing a small problem because she does not have enough money buy cassavas to grow, so she decided to ask for a loan.

Mrs. Sinart N. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is only two years old. The man on the right of the photo is Mrs. Sinart N.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to grow

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mr. Rin C. is a villager in Angk Chey Village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a small piece of land where he cultivates both rice and cassavas. His wife, Mrs. Phal Sdoeng, is a pig breeder. She faces an obstacle in her business because she does not have enough money to support and continue her breeding. Thus, Mr. Rin C. decided to request a loan to buy pig feed and to build a pig pen. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 26 years old and the father of a young child. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and build a pig pen.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H., 48, is a widow with seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. Three daughters are silk weavers and one son is a worker. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chea has been raising pigs since she was young and has been a silk weaver for one year. She learned her skill from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Chea is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
Abdukodir K. is 37 years old. He is married with two children. Abdukodir rents out a mini-bus. offering taxi services for the population of his city. Having attended to this business for 10 years, he has gained rich experience. The business is stable and generates the main income for Abdukodir’s family, allowing improving their living conditions.

However, even though the business generates income, it also needs some funding. So now Abdukodir is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher quality services in future. Today he needs to purchase spare parts and to pay for the repair of the mini-van. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Being the client of IMON for two years almost, Abdukodir had demonstrated himself to be an accurate, reliable client. He thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Spare parts for his mini-van and covering the repairs

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Mr. Chun C. is a villager in Ta Tep village in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Om Yoer, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. They now have a small problem because they do not have enough money to buy cassavas to grow. Thus, Mr. Chun C. decided to request a loan for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 44 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a farmer who helps the parents, while the other attends the local school. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to grow.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreang P. was born in 1967 and she lives in Eysan Meanchey village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer and other one is attending the local school. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates both rice and vegetables to earn a living. She has a small problem with her plantation, because she does not have enough money to buy cassavas to grow. Thus, Mrs. Sreang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy cassavas. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to grow.

loans.name: Suraiya M.khalid Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. and has been living in the city of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 30 years. She is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter who are all enrolled in a neighborhood school. Suraiya baji’s husband has been selling wood for the past 20 years. For the past 5 years, Suraiya baji has been working in the thread making business but she also does household work and takes care of her family.

Suraiya baji has successfully repaid her prior three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood selling business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Allah Rakhi baji is requesting a loan to buy thread for resale. Jamila baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for resale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Toeu

texts.en: Mrs. Toeu B. is a villager in Ra village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a problem with her plantation, because she does not have enough money to buy oxen to plow her field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Toeu B. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to plow her field and reduce her expenses. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Poal Sok, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow her field.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat B. is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children. Over the years, as her family has been living off the crops they grow, the property has been divided among the children and grandchildren. Since she is divorced, it is very difficult for her to raise her children alone. But the love for her children is what made her to work hard day by day. 

Now all of her children are adults and alongside them, she works cultivating wheat and different kinds of vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to Dushanbe city for sale. This activity has helped to pay the expenses of her family and to give an education to her children. 

Today she needs a loan for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing wheat. With this desire in mind, she asks your consideration to receive her family into your kind heart. She is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Adolat wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Seeds and mineral fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Mussarat Taj Din Butt Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji is the wife of T. D. B. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She is the mother of eight children: six sons and two daughters. Her oldest three sons work in a factory while the remaining children are still enrolled in a neighborhood school. Mussarat baji’s husband is a daily wage laborer. For the past 10 years, Mussarat baji has been selling milk.

Mussarat baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more milk for resale. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji is requesting a loan to buy medicines and equipment for her midwife business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy items (chairs and tables) for her school. Suraiya baji is requesting a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Razia baji is requesting a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in theirown business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: P. Rahima is 45 years old. She is divorced with three children who are all in school. Rahima started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home. She began 10 years ago selling women shoes. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then. Today, due to the beginning of the cold season, she wants to add new seasonal stock to her merchandise. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 3300 Somoni (975 USD), which she is promising to repay over 10 months. This way she wants to earn more and to meet her children’s expenses. With your help, this will be possible. Rahima would like to express her gratitude for everyone's support.

loans.use: Shoes for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Muniran M.alam Group

texts.en:
Muniran baji is the wife of M. and has been living in the city of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 35 years. She is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. The oldest three sons work in a factory while the others are still enrolled in a neighborhood school. Muniran baji’s husband is a shoe maker and has been making shoes for the past 10 years. He makes his shoes in a workshop near his home and then sells them in the shoe market. Muniran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Muniran baji has successfully repaid her prior three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy leather and nails for her husband to make more shoes to sell. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Azra baji is requesting a loan to buy thread for resale. Jamila baji is requesting a loan to buy wood for resale. Shahnaz baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Suraiya baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Kosar baji is requesting a loan to buy more shoes for resale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe making

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon S.  is 30 years old. He is married and the father of two children. Alijon has been selling curtains for eight years already and has gained a rich experience in this kind of business. 

Initially Alijon started with selling children’s clothing with US$ 100 as working capital. Gradually he expanded his business and decided to sell curtains as there are few competitors in this kind of business. He has good taste in choosing curtains while purchasing them which allows him to have a good clientele.

Alijon wants to continue growing his business to improve his quality of life and guarantee the success of his children. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) which he will use to buy merchandise and offer products more rapidly as well as to fill his pending orders. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Alijon and his family thank you very much for helping them succeed.

loans.use: New modern curtains for re-sale

loans.name: Khursheed M.anwar Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of M. and has been living in the city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past 6 years. She completed her education only until the 5th standard because her family was poor and could not afford her education expenses. Khursheed baji is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son runs a small hotel in his community. The remaining children are enrolled in a neighborhood school. Khursheed baji’s husband has been selling wood for the past 10 years. For the past 10 years, Khursheed baji has been selling clothes. She buys second hand sweaters at cheap prices and resells them in her community.

Khursheed baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more warm clothes and sweaters to increase her profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rahmat baji is requesting a loan to buy more shoes for resale. Sakina baji is requesting a loan to buy tools used to fix electronic items (air conditioner, tube lights). Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy oil and gas for resale. Safia baji is requesting a loan to buy wood for resale. Naseem baji is requesting a loan to buy more wood for resale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes and sweaters for resale.

loans.name: Aur

texts.en:
Mr. Aur A., and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Pol, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1990 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of them study in local schools and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Aur and his wife are in the business of battery-charging for other villagers. Many villagers come to their shop every day to charge their battery because in this commune, they still don’t have electricity yet. Some families use small generators but most other families use batteries. Therefore, the couple needs to expand their business by purchasing one more motor and materials for charging batteries.

So, Aur is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motor and other materials for his battery-charging business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor and other materials for charging batteries

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun S., 53, and her husband, Mr. Doeun Em, 58, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1973, they have four sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Out of the remaining children: two daughters are silk weaver; one son is a construction worker; and another three children are studying in a local school.

As a silk weaver, she has passed on her weaving business to her daughters. As a farmer, she currently raises pigs and grows rice and other crops on her farmland.  Her husband also works on the farm raising cows, as well as being carpenter.  

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her daughters' business and buy pigs for her farming business.

Mrs. Khoen is pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and pigs

loans.name: Serey

texts.en:
Mrs. Serey P. is 34 years old and lives with her mother. Three nephews and two nieces, four of them working in factories, while another studies, also share the same house. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Serey has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to a trader in the village, who then sells her products at a market in Phnom Penh. Her mother is 70 years old and assists her with spinning threads. Serey is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Zuhra M.yousaf Group

texts.en:
Zuhra baji is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She is the mother of one 8 year old son. Zuhra baji and her husband own a business that sells warm clothes. For the past 10 years, they have been buying clothes from old markets at cheap rates and selling them in different areas of their native city for a profit.

Zuhra baji is applying for a loan to buy to buy more warm clothes and sweaters to increase her profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nusrat baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Seema baji is requesting a loan to buy a horse cart for loading. Riaz baji is requesting a loan to buy a thread making machine. Rashida bajiis is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy warm clothes and sweaters for resale

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn M., 42, and her husband, Mr. Kong Chey, 45, live in a small village located 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1984, they have four sons and one daughter. Two of their children work at Angkor Beer factory, and the others study in a local school.

Mrs. Sorn has been selling fish in her village for two years. She buys the fish from Prek Anchan market across Mekong River. She also gets fish from her husband, who has been fishing for ten years. He fishes from a lake in a nearby village. Besides their fish business, the couple also raise cows and pigs.Mrs. Sorn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cows and piglets.

loans.use: To purchase cows and piglets

loans.name: Sophai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophai H., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sol Sen, 32, live in a small village located 15 kms from Phnom Penh. Married in 2007, they take care of two daughters from her husband's first marriage.
