Mrs. Sophai has been a silk weaver from a very early age, learning the skill from a villager near her commune. She sells her finished products to the trader in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for five years. Sophai is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Somean

texts.en: Mr. Somean C. lives in Ra village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Phum Hun, owns a small grocery store in the local village. Aside from these businesses, they own a small piece of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. They now have a small problem because they do not have enough oxen to plow their fields; thus, Mr. Somean C. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox, to add to his old one, to plow the fields. He is 25 years old and the father of three children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the fields.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem K. lives in Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She and her husband, Mr. Chheng Chhoern, are farmers. They are now facing a problem because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to buy seed rice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yoem K. decided to ask for a loan to buy seed rice and fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children; one is a construction worker, another one attends the local school, and the other two children are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy seed rice and fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang S., 55, and her husband, Mr. Nat Chum, 58, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1970, they have three sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two of their other children are garment factory workers, two are silk weavers, and the youngest in study in local school.

Mrs. Lang and her husband have been in the business of selling mangoes for five years. They buy mangoes from farmers on contract, meaning they pay money upfront to villagers before the harvesting season and then they collect mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market. Mrs. Lang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase mangoes before the harvest season for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha K., 41, and her husband, Mr. Kimyorn Korng, 42, live in a small village across from the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They married in 1989 and have four children, three sons and one daughter.  Three of their children study at the local school. The eldest son also assists his parents with their business in his spare time. 

Sokha has been selling grocery items for four years.  She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh and resells them in her village. Her husband cooks for wedding and other ceremonies in the village in addition to growing rice. Sokha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery items for resale and to increase her stock.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen K. was born in 1947 and she now lives in Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. By Yei, are farmers who own 1 hectare where they cultivate rice to earn a living. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money to buy seed rice to support their field. Additionally, their field is infertile and is badly affecting their field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Yen K. decided to request a loan to buy seed rice and fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy seed rice and fertilizer to make crop more productive.

loans.name: Kobil

texts.en: A. Kobil is 32 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuff and detergents in his store. His store is very famous in his community thus allowing him to have a good clientele. Currently Kobil has about 7000 Somoni (2050 USD) in inventory and his monthly net profit is about $ 300-400. Today Kobil is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for the term of 5 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Kobil’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Foodstuff and detergents for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Hong Laeng

texts.en: Mrs. Hong Laeng K. lives in Trapaing Chrey village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, her field is infertile and has a lot pests, which is badly affecting her crop. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Hong Laeng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nhor Ngouy, is a fisherman. Mrs. Hong Laeng K. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Nabeela Javed-Ul-Hassan Group

texts.en:
Nabeela baji is the wife of J. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 8 years. Nabeela baji is not educated because her parents could not afford the expense. She has no children. Nabeela baji’s husband is an electrician by profession. For the past 6 years, Nabeela baji has had a thread making business. She buys old and warm sweaters from old markets at cheap prices, removes the thread out of them and washes them for resale in the big markets. It is time intensive work.

Nabeela baji is applying for a loan to buy a thread making machine so that she will be able to make more thread and earn more profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rashidan baji is requesting a loan to buy warm sweaters to make thread to sell. Tanveer baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy a thread making machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat H., 46, and her husband, Mr. Leang Lonh, 50, live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They married in 1980 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside of the family home. Two of their children are garment factory workers and the other three children study at the local school.

Yat and her husband have been farming for over twenty years. They grow many types of vegetables such as cucumbers, squash and other many types of crops on their farmland, which is not far from their home.  She is requesting a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: Mrs. Vun M. lives in Ty Boun village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She makes fish paste from different kinds of fish, and sells it, as it is a popular dish of Cambodian people. Since her current business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to make more fish paste, and be able to satisfy her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. Chea Chengly, is a motorbike driver. Mrs. Vun M. is 29 years old and the mother of three children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish to make more fish paste.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: G. Nazira is a very responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has two adorable kids. Six years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has a sewing machine in her house where she produces national dresses for women. Nazira has a big family. Now her children are going to kindergarten. She hopes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a loan of 2700 Somoni (800 USD) that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and meet the customers' demands. She commits herself to return the amount in 8 months. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Nazira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Fabrics for sewing women national dresses.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy K., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Nare K., 37, live about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They married in 1992 and have four sons. All of them study at the local school.

Vuthy has been a policeman in Phnom Penh for twenty years and has been a motor taxi driver for six years. He operates his motor taxi business when he finishes work in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Nare has been a garment factory worker for two years.  Vuthy is requesting a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike to replace his old one.  This will enable him to drive to work and operate his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to replace his current one.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Mrs. Yam K. lives in Ponlai village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells coconuts. She is a 63 year old widow and the mother of a child who sells petrol. Even though Mrs. Yam K.’s family members have different businesses, they do not earn very much money. Thus, Mrs. Yam K. decided to ask for a loan to buy petroleum for her daughter’s business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy petroleum for her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Bushra Faqeer Hussain Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is the wife of F. H. and lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Bushra baji’s husband has a shuttering business. Bushra baji herself has a clothes selling business and has been selling clothes for the past 10 years. She buys clothes from a famous market in the city of Lahore named “Shahalmi and Orega”, and sells in her own city. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes for her clothes selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine to make embroidered dresses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mr. Ra C. was born in 1967 and now lives in Ra village in Kampong Chhang Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Khat Choun, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living. However, they do not make enough money to support themselves well. Thus, Mr. Ra C. decided to ask for a loan, which he will add to his savings to buy timber to build a new house to replace the old one. He is a father of five children: one is employed in a garment factory; one is a construction worker; and the other three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy timber to build new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: M. Dilorom is a happy mother of 4 children. She is 29 years old and married. Dilorom is a teacher. Her salary is very little whicj is’s why she has been running her own grocery business. For five years she has been selling foodstuff like sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee and many other things in her grocery store. Dilorom’s wish is to increase her business, offering various type of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 9 months. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting her.

loans.use: Foodstuff to increase the range of selling goods
